metadata.description: The Ontology for Biomedical Investigations (OBI) is build in a collaborative, international effort and will serve as a resource for annotating biomedical investigations, including the study design, protocols and instrumentation used, the data generated and the types of analysis performed on the data. This ontology arose from the Functional Genomics Investigation Ontology (FuGO) and will contain both terms that are common to all biomedical investigations, including functional genomics investigations and those that are more domain specific.

BFO:0000002.label: continuant
BFO:0000002.definition: An entity that exists in full at any time in which it exists at all, persists through time while maintaining its identity and has no temporal parts.

BFO:0000003.label: occurrent
BFO:0000003.definition: An entity that has temporal parts and that happens, unfolds or develops through time.

BFO:0000031.label: generically dependent continuant
BFO:0000031.definition: b is a generically dependent continuant = Def. b is a continuant that g-depends_on one or more other entities. (axiom label in BFO2 Reference: [074-001])

BFO:0000004.label: independent continuant
BFO:0000004.definition: b is an independent continuant = Def. b is a continuant which is such that there is no c and no t such that b s-depends_on c at t. (axiom label in BFO2 Reference: [017-002])

BFO:0000020.label: specifically dependent continuant
BFO:0000020.definition: b is a relational specifically dependent continuant = Def. b is a specifically dependent continuant and there are n > 1 independent continuants c1, … cn which are not spatial regions are such that for all 1  i < j  n, ci  and cj share no common parts, are such that for each 1  i  n, b s-depends_on ci at every time t during the course of b’s existence (axiom label in BFO2 Reference: [131-004])

BFO:0000015.label: process
BFO:0000015.definition: An occurrent that has temporal proper parts and for some time t, p s-depends_on some material entity at t.

BFO:0000035.label: process boundary
BFO:0000035.definition: p is a process boundary =Def. p is a temporal part of a process & p has no proper temporal parts. (axiom label in BFO2 Reference: [084-001])

BFO:0000040.label: material entity
BFO:0000040.definition: An independent continuant that is spatially extended whose identity is independent of that of other entities and can be maintained through time.

GO:0003674.label: GO:molecular_function
GO:0003674.definition: A molecular process that can be carried out by the action of a single macromolecular machine, usually via direct physical interactions with other molecular entities. Function in this sense denotes an action, or activity, that a gene product (or a complex) performs. These actions are described from two distinct but related perspectives: (1) biochemical activity, and (2) role as a component in a larger system/process.

GO:0003823.label: antigen binding
GO:0003823.definition: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with an antigen, any substance which is capable of inducing a specific immune response and of reacting with the products of that response, the specific antibody or specifically sensitized T-lymphocytes, or both. Binding may counteract the biological activity of the antigen.

GO:0008150.label: biological_process
GO:0008150.definition: A biological process represents a specific objective that the organism is genetically programmed to achieve. Biological processes are often described by their outcome or ending state, e.g., the biological process of cell division results in the creation of two daughter cells (a divided cell) from a single parent cell. A biological process is accomplished by a particular set of molecular functions carried out by specific gene products (or macromolecular complexes), often in a highly regulated manner and in a particular temporal sequence.

OBI:0000011.label: planned process
OBI:0000011.definition: A processual entity that realizes a plan which is the concretization of a plan specification.

OBI:0000339.label: planning
OBI:0000339.definition: a process of creating or modifying a plan specification

BFO:0000144.label: process profile
BFO:0000144.definition: b is a process_profile =Def. there is some process c such that b process_profile_of c (axiom label in BFO2 Reference: [093-002])

OBI:0000076.label: unplanned occurrence effecting an investigation
OBI:0000076.definition: a process which is external in origin to the investigation that has an impact on the outcome.

HP:0000855.label: Insulin resistance
HP:0000855.definition: Increased resistance towards insulin, that is, diminished effectiveness of insulin in reducing blood glucose levels.

OGMS:0000031.label: disease
OGMS:0000031.definition: A disposition (i) to undergo pathological processes that (ii) exists in an organism because of one or more disorders in that organism.

OBI:0001511.label: disposition to be a product of antigen processing and presentation
OBI:0001511.definition: A disposition of a material entity to be presented by MHC molecules on the cell surface as a result of antigen processing by an antigen presenting cell.

OBI:0001486.label: disposition to be bound by an MHC protein complex
OBI:0001486.definition: Is the disposition borne by a material entity that is realized in a process of being bound in the antigen binding grove of an MHC protein complex.

PATO:0000018.label: fluorescence
PATO:0000018.definition: A luminous flux quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's emitting longer wavelength light following the absorption of shorter wavelength radiation; fluorescence is common with aromatic compounds with several rings joined together.

PATO:0001741.label: radioactive
PATO:0001741.definition: A radiation quality inhering in bearer by virtue of the bearer's exhibiting or being caused by radioactivity.

OBI:1110045.label: disposition to be bound by an adaptive immune receptor
OBI:1110045.definition: Is the disposition borne by a material entity that is realized in a process of being bound by a adaptive immune receptor.

OBI:1110010.label: disposition to cause an allergic reaction
OBI:1110010.definition: The role borne by a material entity that is realized when it is recognized by the immune system and results in the occurrence of an allergic disease.

OBI:1110093.label: disposition to infect an organism
OBI:1110093.definition: Is a role borne by an agent, and realized when in contact with or inside another organism in which it is capable of replicating and causing disease

IDO:0000666.label: human pathogenicity disposition
IDO:0000666.definition: A disposition to initiate processes that result in a disorder in a human organism.

OBI:0000260.label: plan
OBI:0000260.definition: A plan is a realizable entity that is the inheres in a bearer who is committed to realizing it as a planned process.

BFO:0000023.label: role
BFO:0000023.definition: A realizable entity  the manifestation of which brings about some result or end that is not essential to a continuant  in virtue of the kind of thing that it is but that can be served or participated in by that kind of continuant  in some kinds of natural, social or institutional contexts.

OBI:0000654.label: device setting
OBI:0000654.definition: a quality inheres_in some device and is concretization of some (device_setting_specification and is_about a quality of the device

PATO:0000122.label: length
PATO:0000122.definition: A 1-D extent quality which is equal to the distance between two points.

PATO:0000125.label: mass
PATO:0000125.definition: A physical quality that inheres in a bearer by virtue of the proportion of the bearer's amount of matter.

PATO:0001338.label: mixed sex
PATO:0001338.definition: A biological sex quality inhering in a population of multiple sexes.

PATO:0001995.label: organismal quality
PATO:0001995.definition: A quality that inheres in an entire organism or part of an organism.

OGMS:0000023.label: phenotype
OGMS:0000023.definition: A (combination of) quality(ies) of an organism determined by the interaction of its genetic make-up and environment that differentiates specific instances of a species from other instances of the same species.

IAO:0000015.label: information carrier
IAO:0000015.definition: A quality of an information bearer that imparts the information content

PATO:0001237.label: quality of a single physical entity
PATO:0001237.definition: A physical object quality which inheres in a single-bearer.

PATO:0001238.label: quality of related physical entities
PATO:0001238.definition: A physical entity quality which exists in relation towards some other entity.

BFO:0000145.label: relational quality
BFO:0000145.definition: b is a relational quality = Def. for some independent continuants c, d and for some time t: b quality_of c at t & b quality_of d at t. (axiom label in BFO2 Reference: [057-001])

BFO:0000017.label: realizable entity
BFO:0000017.definition: A specifically dependent continuant  that inheres in continuant  entities and are not exhibited in full at every time in which it inheres in an entity or group of entities. The exhibition or actualization of a realizable entity is a particular manifestation, functioning or process that occurs under certain circumstances.

OBI:0000949.label: accessed material role
OBI:0000949.definition: is realized in a planned process where the bearer participates

OBI:0000857.label: complementary nucleotide probe role
OBI:0000857.definition: A role played by a nucleic acid molecule that is used in a planned process for its ability to bind a nucleic acid molecules with complementary nucleotide sequence

OBI:0000725.label: host role
OBI:0000725.definition: host role is a role played by an organism and realized by providing nourishment, shelter or a means of reproduction to another organism within the organism playing the host role

OBI:0000202.label: investigation agent role
OBI:0000202.definition: A role borne by an entity and that is realized in a process that is part of an investigation in which an objective is achieved. These processes include, among others: planning, overseeing, funding, reviewing.

OBI:0000571.label: manufacturer role
OBI:0000571.definition: Manufacturer role is a role which inheres in a person or organization and which is realized by a manufacturing process.

OBI:0000718.label: pathogen role
OBI:0000718.definition: pathogen role is a role which inheres in an organism and realized in the process of disease course in the organism bearing host role caused by the organism bearing pathogen role

OBI:0000941.label: service consumer role
OBI:0000941.definition: a role which inheres in a person who uses a service

OBI:0000947.label: service provider role
OBI:0000947.definition: is a role which inheres in a person or organization and is realized in in a planned process which provides access to training, materials or execution of protocols for an organization or person

OBI:0000847.label: test substance role
OBI:0000847.definition: A role born by a material entity and realized in a process where the substance is used as specified as the independent variable for an investigation

OBI:1110092.label: adjuvant role
OBI:1110092.definition: Adjuvant role is a role that inheres in a material entity and which is realized through a process of modifying a biological response.

OBI:0000237.label: antigen role
OBI:0000237.definition: Antigen is a role played by material which when introduced into an immune-competent organism causes an immune response

OBI:1110120.label: assay antigen role
OBI:1110120.definition: Any molecule recognized by the adaptive immune receptors? Recognized means bound with a certain affinity? From GO ag binding:Interacting selectively with an antigen, any substance which is capable of inducing a specific immune response and of reacting with the products of that response, the specific antibody or specifically sensitized T-lymphocytes, or both. Binding may counteract the biological activity of the antigen. see OBI_1110120 below

IAO:0000442.label: author role
IAO:0000442.definition: A role inhering in a person or organization that is realized when the bearer participates in the work which is the basis of the document, in the writing of the document, and signs it with their name.

OBI:0302731.label: buffer role
OBI:0302731.definition: a role which inheres in some molecular entity realized during the process of buffering

OBI:0000029.label: centrifuge pellet role
OBI:0000029.definition: pellet role is a role which inheres in a material entity and is realized by a material separation process using gravitational force generated by a centrifuge in which the material bearing the pellet role is the heavier or heaviest component of the output material..

OBI:0000416.label: cloning insert role
OBI:0000416.definition: cloning insert role is a role which inheres in DNA or RNA and is realized by the process of being inserted into a cloning vector in a cloning process.

OBI:0001687.label: contact representative role
OBI:0001687.definition: A role inhering in a person who represents an institution, organization, or service provider and realized when communication is directed at them about the entity they represent.

OBI:0000091.label: detector reagent role
OBI:0000091.definition: a role which inheres in a molecular entity and is realized by the process of recording or registering a stimulus.

OBI:1110087.label: donor
OBI:1110087.definition: A role which inheres in an organism or part thereof from which any part including cell, organ or tissue is removed with the intention that the donated part will be placed into another organism and/or cultured in vitro.

OBI:0000040.label: drug role
OBI:0000040.definition: a role borne by a molecular entity and is realized in a process of absorption by an organism  alters, or effects  (or is assumed to effect) a function(s) which inhere in an organism

OBI:0000067.label: evaluant role
OBI:0000067.definition: a role that inheres in a material entity that is realized in an assay in which data is generated about the bearer of the evaluant role

OBI:1110083.label: host of immune response role
OBI:1110083.definition: is a role borne by an organism. It is realized by the organism during an immunization or an immune response taking place inside or on the surface of the organism, and in which the responding or stimulated immune system is part of the host.

OBI:1110091.label: immune epitope carrier role
OBI:1110091.definition: A role inhering in a material entity that is covalently bound to an epitope in order to increase the epitopes immunogenicity.

OBI:1110082.label: immunogen role
OBI:1110082.definition: any entity capable of eliciting an immune response when introduced to components of the immune system

OBI:0000319.label: material to be added role
OBI:0000319.definition: material to be added role is a protocol participant role realized by a material which is added into a material bearing the target of material addition role in a material addition process

OBI:0002444.label: measurand role
OBI:0002444.definition: A role borne by a material entity and realized in an assay which achieves the objective to measure the magnitude/concentration/amount of the measurand in the entity bearing evaluant role.

REO:0000171.label: molecular label role
REO:0000171.definition: a reagent role inhering in a molecular entity intended to associate with some molecular target to serve as a proxy for the presence, abundance, or location of this target in a detection of molecular label assay.

OBI:0000204.label: nutrient role
OBI:0000204.definition: a role that inheres in a material entity and is realized in the use of that material entity by an organism when it is used in that organism's metabolism and provides nourishment.

OBI:0000097.label: participant under investigation role
OBI:0000097.definition: A role that is realized through the execution of a study design in which the bearer of the role participates and in which data about that bearer is collected.

OBI:0000093.label: patient role
OBI:0000093.definition: a role which inheres in a person and is realized by the process of being under the care of a physician or health care provider

OBI:0302846.label: randomized group participant role
OBI:0302846.definition: a role that borne by an organism and realized by some group randomization process

OBI:0000086.label: reagent role
OBI:0000086.definition: A role inhering in a biological or chemical entity that is intended to be applied in a scientific technique to participate (or have molecular components that participate) in a chemical reaction that facilitates the generation of data about some entity distinct from the bearer, or the generation of some specified material output distinct from the bearer.

OBI:0000025.label: reference substance role
OBI:0000025.definition: a role inhering in a material entity that is realized when  characteristics or responses elicited by the substance are used for comparison or reference.

OBI:0000017.label: regulatory role
OBI:0000017.definition: a role which inheres in material entities and is realized in the processes of making, enforcing or being defined by legislation or orders issued by a governmental body.

OBI:1110086.label: restricting MHC role
OBI:1110086.definition: The role played by an MHC molecule by binding a material entity playing the role of epitope when that epitope/MHC molecule pair are recognized (bound) by a TCR molecule on the surface of a cell playing the role of effector cell.

OBI:0302733.label: solute role
OBI:0302733.definition: solute role is a role played by a chemical entity which is dissolved by another chemical entity (the solvent) when creating a solution

OBI:0302732.label: solvent role
OBI:0302732.definition: solvent role is a role which inheres in a molecular entity capable of ensuring the dissolution of another chemical entity and realized by the process of solvation

OBI:0000112.label: specimen role
OBI:0000112.definition: a role borne by a material entity that is gained during a specimen collection process and that can be realized by use of the specimen in an investigation

OBI:0000174.label: study group role
OBI:0000174.definition: a study population role where the bearer is a population of material entities and the role is realized in the implementation of a study design wherein the entities bearing the study population role are observed or subjected to intervention according to the study design and are biological replicates, i.e. they receive the same treatment under the protocol

OBI:0000034.label: supernatant role
OBI:0000034.definition: supernatant role is a role which inheres in a material entity and is realized by a material separation process using gravitational force in which the material bearing the supernatant role is the liquid component of the output material.

OBI:0000444.label: target of material addition role
OBI:0000444.definition: target of material addition role is a role realized by an entity into which a material is added in a material addition process

GAZ:00000448.label: geographic location
GAZ:00000448.definition: A reference to a place on the Earth, by its name or by its geographical location.

OBI:0400059.label: interrogation_point
OBI:0400059.definition: Point within the fluidic subsystem at which the laser intersects the stream, illuminating the cells where they emit their fluorescence and scatter the light. The laser irradiates the cell at the interrogation point.

OBI:0400061.label: jet_in_air_flow_chamber
OBI:0400061.definition: A flow cell in which the cells are pinched off as droplets and allowed to drop through the air. The laser intersects with the cell in mid-air. A jet in air flow chamber allows the laser to intersect with the cells without any intermittent media other than air.

SO:0000001.label: region
SO:0000001.definition: A sequence_feature with an extent greater than zero. A nucleotide region is composed of bases and a polypeptide region is composed of amino acids.

IAO:0000030.label: information content entity
IAO:0000030.definition: A generically dependent continuant that is about some thing.

OBI:0001040.label: current amplification function
OBI:0001040.definition: A current amplification function is an amplification function that increases the amplitude of a current.

OBI:0005246.label: injection function
OBI:0005246.definition: The function of a device realized when administering a substance in vivo, applied particularly to the forcible insertion of a liquid or gas by means of a syringe, pump, etc.

OBI:0000928.label: material combination function
OBI:0000928.definition: A material separation function is a function that decreases the resolution between two or more material entities.

OBI:0000960.label: reagent application function
OBI:0000960.definition: A function that is realized when a reagent is automatically added to some research material.

OBI:0001036.label: specimen fixation function
OBI:0001036.definition: a function that allows specific identification of individual speciment from one another.

OBI:0001041.label: stabilization function
OBI:0001041.definition: A stabilization function is a function that holds or isolates an entity such as an instrument or specimen steadfast or at an unfluctuating level or quantity.

OBI:0000946.label: sterilization function
OBI:0000946.definition: a function to remove viable organisms from an input material

OBI:1110016.label: adaptive immune effector function
OBI:1110016.definition: A function realized as an immune response, which inheres in a T cell, B cell or antibody which derives from or is produced by a cell with prior antigen experience.

OBI:1110085.label: antigen presentation function
OBI:1110085.definition: a function inhering in a cell  that expresses MHC molecules which is realized in the process of antigen processing and presentation of antigen derived parts by MHC molecules on the cell surface.

OBI:0000388.label: connection function
OBI:0000388.definition: A connection function is a function to couple two or more flow channels so that material or signals can be transported from one set of channels to another.

OBI:0000455.label: consume data function
OBI:0000455.definition: Process data function is a function that is borne by in a material entity by virtue of its structure. When realized the material entity consumes data.

OBI:0000370.label: contain function
OBI:0000370.definition: A contain function is a function to constrain a material entities location in space

OBI:0000387.label: cool function
OBI:0000387.definition: A cool function is a function to decrease the internal kinetic energy of a material below the initial kinetic energy of that type of material.

OBI:0000391.label: energy supply function
OBI:0000391.definition: An energy supply function is a function to supply or transfer energy from an energy source to a consumer of the energy

OBI:0000401.label: environment control function
OBI:0000401.definition: An environmental control function is a function that regulates a contained environment within specified parameter ranges. For example the control of light exposure, humidity and temperature.

OBI:0000374.label: excitation function
OBI:0000374.definition: A excitation function is a function  to inject energy by bombarding a material with energetic particles (e.g., photons) thereby imbuing internal material components such as electrons with additional energy.  These internal, 'excited' particles may lead to the rupturing of covalent chemical bonds or may quickly relax back to there unexcited state with an exponential time course thereby locally emitting energy in the form of photons.

OBI:0000375.label: freeze function
OBI:0000375.definition: A freeze function is a function to decrease the internal kinetic energy of a material below the freezing point of that type of material.

OBI:0000371.label: heat function
OBI:0000371.definition: A heat function is a function that increases the internal kinetic energy of a material

OBI:0000392.label: information processor function
OBI:0000392.definition: An information processor function is a function that converts information from one form to another, by a lossless process or an extraction process.

OBI:0000385.label: ionization function
OBI:0000385.definition: An ionization function is a function to physically convert an atom or molecule into an ion by adding or removing charged particles such as electrons or other ions.

OBI:0000369.label: magnify function
OBI:0000369.definition: A magnify function is a function to increase the size of a transmitted object image through the precise arrangement of energy diffraction elements along an imaging path.

OBI:0000372.label: material separation function
OBI:0000372.definition: A material separation function is a function that increases the resolution between two or more material entities. The  to distinction between the entities is usually based on some associated physical quality.

OBI:0000453.label: measure function
OBI:0000453.definition: Measure function is a function that is borne by a processed material  and realized in a process in which information about some entity is expressed relative to some reference.

OBI:0000379.label: mechanical function
OBI:0000379.definition: A mechanical function is a function that is realised via mechanical work (through an certain amount of energy transferred by some force).

OBI:0000377.label: perturb function
OBI:0000377.definition: A perturb function is a function that disrupts the normal function of a system induced through either internal or external means.  External means of perturbation include: (1) displacement fields in the physical sense - e.g., temperature change, osmotic shock, pressure change; (2) application of small molecules such as drugs or toxins to perturb the function of specific pathways or application of surfactants to perturb the normal function of plasma membrane.  Internal means of perturbation include: (1) manipulation of gene function via gene knockout or transcript knockdown via RNAi; (2) directed genetic mutation leading to minimal aa alterations that interfere with peptide function.

OBI:0000368.label: record function
OBI:0000368.definition: A record function is a function that registers or collects information in a particular format on a particular recording medium. For example on paper or a digital representation

OBI:0000399.label: solid support function
OBI:0000399.definition: A solid support function is a function of a device on which an entity is kept in a defined position and prevented in its movement

OBI:0000376.label: synthesizing function
OBI:0000376.definition: A synthesizing function is a function to assemble new output materials from distinct input materials.  The output materials typically consist of chemically distinct monomeric objects or object aggregate polymers.

OBI:0000383.label: transfer function
OBI:0000383.definition: A transfer function is a function to displace a material from one location to another.

OBI:1110201.label: allergen
OBI:1110201.definition: A material entity bearing the disposition to cause an allergic reaction

UBERON:0000477.label: anatomical cluster
UBERON:0000477.definition: Anatomical group that has its parts adjacent to one another.

CHEBI:33250.label: atom
CHEBI:33250.definition: A chemical entity constituting the smallest component of an element having the chemical properties of the element.

CL:0000000.label: cell
CL:0000000.definition: A material entity of anatomical origin (part of or deriving from an organism) that has as its parts a maximally connected cell compartment surrounded by a plasma membrane.

GO:0005575.label: cellular_component
GO:0005575.definition: A location, relative to cellular compartments and structures, occupied by a macromolecular machine when it carries out a molecular function. There are two ways in which the gene ontology describes locations of gene products: (1) relative to cellular structures (e.g., cytoplasmic side of plasma membrane) or compartments (e.g., mitochondrion), and (2) the stable macromolecular complexes of which they are parts (e.g., the ribosome).

ENVO:00010483.label: environmental material
ENVO:00010483.definition: A portion of environmental material is a fiat object which forms the medium or part of the medium of an environmental system.

OBI:0100086.label: glucose in solution
OBI:0100086.definition: A scattered aggregate of glucose molecules in a liquid

OBI:0000997.label: growth environment
OBI:0000997.definition: The collection of material entities and their qualities that are located near a live organism, tissue or cell and can influence its growth.

OBI:0000814.label: guar gum
OBI:0000814.definition: Guar gum, also called guaran, is a galactomannan. It is primarily the ground endosperm of guar beans. The guar seeds are dehusked, milled and screened to obtain the guar gum.[1] It is typically produced as a free flowing, pale, off-white colored, coarse to fine ground powder.

OBI:0000835.label: manufacturer
OBI:0000835.definition: A person or organization that has a manufacturer role

OBI:1110108.label: material to be added
OBI:1110108.definition: a material that is added to another one in a material combination process

CHEBI:23367.label: molecular entity
CHEBI:23367.definition: Any constitutionally or isotopically distinct atom, molecule, ion, ion pair, radical, radical ion, complex, conformer etc., identifiable as a separately distinguishable entity.

GO:0043234.label: protein complex
GO:0043234.definition: A stable macromolecular complex composed (only) of two or more polypeptide subunits along with any covalently attached molecules (such as lipid anchors or oligosaccharide) or non-protein prosthetic groups (such as nucleotides or metal ions). Prosthetic group in this context refers to a tightly bound cofactor. The component polypeptide subunits may be identical.

OBI:1110109.label: target of material addition
OBI:1110109.definition: A material entity into which another is being added in a material combinatino process

VO:0000001.label: vaccine
VO:0000001.definition: A vaccine is a processed material with the function that when administered, it prevents or ameliorates a disorder in a target organism by inducing or modifying adaptive immune responses specific to the antigens in the vaccine.

OBI:1110034.label: antigen
OBI:1110034.definition: is a material entity that has the antigen role

OBI:0302729.label: chemical solution
OBI:0302729.definition: A material entity  that is made up of at least 2 scattered molecular aggregates, one playing the role of solvent and the other one playing the role of solute.

OBI:0002076.label: collection of specimens
OBI:0002076.definition: A material entity that has two or more specimens as its parts.

OBI:0000427.label: enzyme
OBI:0000427.definition:
(protein or rna) or has_part (protein or rna) and
has_function some GO:0003824 (catalytic activity)

OBI:1110001.label: epitope
OBI:1110001.definition: a material entity bearing the epitope role

OBI:1110023.label: immunogen
OBI:1110023.definition: a material entity bearing the immunogen role

IDO:0000586.label: infection
IDO:0000586.definition: A part of an extended organism that itself has as part a population of one or more infectious agents and that (1) exists as a result of processes initiated by members of the infectious agent population and is (2) clinically abnormal in virtue of the presence of this infectious agent population, or (3) has a disposition to bring clinical abnormality to immunocompetent organisms of the same Species as the host (the organism corresponding to the extended organism) through transmission of a member or offspring of a member of the infectious agent population.

IAO:0000178.label: material information bearer
IAO:0000178.definition: A material entity in which a concretization of an information content entity inheres.

OBI:0100026.label: organism
OBI:0100026.definition: A material entity that is an individual living system, such as animal, plant, bacteria or virus, that is capable of replicating or reproducing, growth and maintenance in the right environment. An organism may be unicellular or made up, like humans, of many billions of cells divided into specialized tissues and organs.

OBI:0000245.label: organization
OBI:0000245.definition: An entity that can bear roles, has members, and has a set of organization rules. Members of organizations are either organizations themselves or individual people. Members can bear specific organization member roles that are determined in the organization rules. The organization rules also determine how decisions are made on behalf of the organization by the organization members.

OBI:0000181.label: population
OBI:0000181.definition: a population is a collection of individuals from the same taxonomic class living, counted or sampled at a particular site or in a particular area

OBI:0000047.label: processed material
OBI:0000047.definition: Is a material entity that is created or changed during material processing.

OBI:0000576.label: scattered molecular aggregate
OBI:0000576.definition: a material entity that consists of all the molecules of a specific type that are located in some bounded region and which is part of a more massive material entity that has parts that are other such aggregates

OBI:0001947.label: sequence annotation provider
OBI:0001947.definition: A person or organization reporting the feature annotation results from the analysis of a macromolecular sequence.

OBI:0100051.label: specimen
OBI:0100051.definition: A material entity that has the specimen role.

BFO:0000140.label: continuant fiat boundary
BFO:0000140.definition: b is a continuant fiat boundary = Def. b is an immaterial entity that is of zero, one or two dimensions and does not include a spatial region as part. (axiom label in BFO2 Reference: [029-001])

PR:000000001.label: protein
PR:000000001.definition: An amino acid chain that is produced de novo by ribosome-mediated translation of a genetically-encoded mRNA.

OBI:0100065.label: synthetic peptide
OBI:0100065.definition: a synthetic peptide is an material entity which is artificially engineered and results from the synthesis of a chain of amino acids which may also be found in natural protein and be identical in sequence to a protein fragment

OBI:0000809.label: amplified DNA
OBI:0000809.definition: DNA that has been produced in an enzymatic amplification process

OBI:0001946.label: forward PCR primer
OBI:0001946.definition: A short oligonucleotide complementary to target DNA (5'->3' on plus strand) that acts as the leader for DNA extension in a PCR reaction. The polymerase starts replication at the 3'-end of the primer, and copies the opposite strand. A primer is characterized by its 'melting temperature' (Tm) and pairs of primers should have similar Tm.

OBI:0001967.label: multiplexing sequence identifier
OBI:0001967.definition: A multiplexing sequence identifier is a nucleic acid sequence which is used in a ligation step of library preparation process to allow pooling of samples while maintaining ability to identify individual source material and creation of a multiplexed library

OBI:0001951.label: reverse PCR primer
OBI:0001951.definition: A short oligonucleotide complementary to target DNA (5'->3' on minus strand) that acts as the leader for DNA extension in a PCR reaction. The polymerase starts replication at the 3'-end of the primer, and copies the opposite strand. A primer is characterized by its 'melting temperature' (Tm) and pairs of primers should have similar Tm.

CHEBI:59055.label: (S)-1-(4-bromoacetamidobenzyl)EDTA
CHEBI:59055.definition: A tetracarboxylic acid consisting of ethylenediaminetetraacetic acid having a 4-bromoacetamidobenzyl group at the C1-position and (S)-configuration.

CHEBI:59052.label: 1,1-dihydroxy-3-ethoxy-2-butanone
CHEBI:59052.definition: A butanone derivative having two hydroxy substituents at the 1-position and an ethoxy substituent at the 3-position.

CHEBI:17709.label: 5'-adenylyl sulfate
CHEBI:17709.definition: An adenosine 5'-phosphate having a sulfo group attached to one the phosphate OH groups.

CHEBI:472552.label: 5-bromo-2'-deoxyuridine
CHEBI:472552.definition: A pyrimidine 2'-deoxyribonucleoside compound having 5-bromouracil as the nucleobase.

CHEBI:15422.label: ATP
CHEBI:15422.definition: An adenosine 5'-phosphate in which the 5'-phosphate is a triphosphate group. It is involved in the transportation of chemical energy during metabolic pathways.

CHEBI:59056.label: EDTA methidiumpropylamide
CHEBI:59056.definition: A combined intercalating and chelating reagent. The iron chelate, prepared by adding Fe(NH4)2(SO4)2, effects random oxidative cleavage of DNA in the presence of O2 and a reducing agent. This activity is useful as a footprinting probe.

CHEBI:59053.label: N-cyclohexyl-N'-(2-(4-morpholinyl)ethyl)carbodiimide
CHEBI:59053.definition: A carbodiimide having cyclcohexyl and 2-(4-morpholinyl)ethyl as the two N-substituents.

CHEBI:23995.label: N-ethyl-N-nitrosourea
CHEBI:23995.definition: A member of the class of N-nitrosoureas that is urea in which one of the nitrogens is substituted by ethyl and nitroso groups.

CHEBI:28619.label: acrylamide
CHEBI:28619.definition: A member of the class of acrylamides that results from the formal condensation of acrylic acid with ammonia.

CHEBI:33709.label: amino acid
CHEBI:33709.definition: A carboxylic acid containing one or more amino groups.

CHEBI:59424.label: bromophenol blue
CHEBI:59424.definition: 3H-2,1-Benzoxathiole 1,1-dioxide in which both of the hydrogens at position 3 have been substituted by 3,5-dibromo-4-hydroxyphenyl groups. It is used as a laboratory indicator, changing from yellow below pH 3 to purple at pH 4.6, and as a size marker for monitoring the progress of agarose gel and polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis. It has also been used as an industrial dye.

CHEBI:50076.label: chromium-51
CHEBI:50076.definition: A synthetic radioactive isotope of chromium having a half-life of 27.7 days and decaying by electron capture with emission of gamma rays (0.32 MeV); it is used to label red blood cells for measurement of mass or volume, survival time, and sequestration studies, for the diagnosis of gastrointestinal bleeding, and to label platelets to study their survival.

CHEBI:29237.label: deuterium atom
CHEBI:29237.definition: The stable isotope of hydrogen with relative atomic mass 2.014102 and a natural abundance of 0.0115 atom percent (from Greek deltaepsilonupsilontauepsilonrhoomicronnu, second).

CHEBI:59051.label: diethyl pyrocarbonate
CHEBI:59051.definition: The diethyl ester of dicarbonic acid.

CHEBI:59050.label: dimethyl sulfate
CHEBI:59050.definition: The dimethyl ester of sulfuric acid.

CHEBI:42191.label: ethylenediaminetetraacetic acid
CHEBI:42191.definition: A polyamino carboxylic acid that has formula C10H16N2O8.

OBI:0000817.label: fucoidan
OBI:0000817.definition: Fucoidan is a sulfated polysaccharide (MW: average 20,000) found mainly in various species of brown seaweed such as kombu, limu moui,bladderwrack, wakame, mozuku, and hijiki (variant forms of fucoidan have also been found in animal species, including the sea cucumber).

CHEBI:37333.label: gadodiamide
CHEBI:37333.definition: A non-ionic gadolinium chelate having a macrocyclic triamine framework. It is used as a paramagnetic contrast agent in magnetic resonance imaging (MRI).

CHEBI:33375.label: gadolinium atom
CHEBI:33375.definition: A lanthanoid atom that has formula Gd.

CHEBI:31643.label: gadoteridol
CHEBI:31643.definition: A non-ionic gadolinium chelate having a macrocyclic tetraamine framework. It is used as a paramagnetic contrast agent in magnetic resonance imaging (MRI).

CHEBI:17234.label: glucose
CHEBI:17234.definition: An aldohexose used as a source of energy and metabolic intermediate.

CHEBI:17137.label: hydrogensulfite
CHEBI:17137.definition: A sulfur oxoanion that has formula HO3S.

CHEBI:29191.label: hydroxyl
CHEBI:29191.definition: An oxygen radical that has formula HO.

CHEBI:27889.label: lead(0)
CHEBI:27889.definition: An elemental lead that has formula Pb.

CHEBI:25078.label: luciferin
CHEBI:25078.definition: A low-molecular-mass compound present in bioluminescent organisms that emits light when oxidized in presence of enzyme luciferase.

CHEBI:33839.label: macromolecule
CHEBI:33839.definition: A macromolecule is a molecule of high relative molecular mass, the structure of which essentially comprises the multiple repetition of units derived, actually or conceptually, from molecules of low relative molecular mass.

REO:0000280.label: molecular label
REO:0000280.definition: a molecular reagent intended to associate with some molecular target to serve as a proxy for the presence, abundance, or location of this target in a detection of molecular label assay

CHEBI:61073.label: oxygen radical
CHEBI:61073.definition: An inorganic radical in which a free electron resides on one or more oxygen atoms of an oxygen species.

CHEBI:31991.label: phenol red
CHEBI:31991.definition: 3H-2,1-Benzoxathiole 1,1-dioxide in which both of the hydrogens at position 3 have been substituted by 4-hydroxyphenyl groups. A pH indicator changing colour from yellow below pH 6.8 to bright pink above pH 8.2, it is commonly used as an indicator in cell cultures and in home swimming pool test kits. It is also used in the (now infrequently performed) phenolsulfonphthalein (PSP) test for estimation of overall blood flow through the kidney.

CHEBI:24636.label: proton
CHEBI:24636.definition: Nuclear particle of charge number +1, spin 1/2 and rest mass of 1.007276470(12) u.

CHEBI:33359.label: rhodium atom
CHEBI:33359.definition: A cobalt group element atom that has formula Rh.

CHEBI:30682.label: ruthenium atom
CHEBI:30682.definition: An iron group element atom that has formula Ru.

CHEBI:26710.label: sodium chloride
CHEBI:26710.definition: An inorganic chloride salt having sodium(1+) as the counterion.

CHEBI:33376.label: terbium atom
CHEBI:33376.definition: A lanthanoid atom that has formula Tb.

CHEBI:9754.label: tris
CHEBI:9754.definition: A primary amino compound that is tert-butylamine in which one hydrogen attached to each methyl group is replaced by a hydroxy group. A compound widely used as a biological buffer substance in the pH range 7--9; pKa = 8.3 at 20 degreeC; pKa = 7.82 at 37 degreeC.

CHEBI:53526.label: tritiated thymidine
CHEBI:53526.definition: Thymidine linked to the radioisotope tritium. Used to label DNA in the study of cellular and viral DNA synthesis.

CHEBI:15377.label: water
CHEBI:15377.definition: An oxygen hydride consisting of an oxygen atom that is covalently bonded to two hydrogen atoms.

OBI:0000065.label: polyethylene glycol p-(1,1,3,3-tetramethylbutyl)-phenyl ether
OBI:0000065.definition: triton X100 is a chemical entity which belongs to the group of The pluronics which are triblock copolymers of ethylene oxide and propylene oxide. Triton x-100 is_used_as detergent due to its non-ionic surfactant properties

CHEBI:37972.label: phosphorus-32 atom
CHEBI:37972.definition: The radioactive isotope of phosphorus with relative atomic mass 31.973907 and half-life of 14.26 days.

CHEBI:37973.label: phosphorus-33 atom
CHEBI:37973.definition: The radioactive isotope of phosphorus with relative atomic mass 32.971725, half-life of 25.34 days and nuclear spin (1)/2.

CHEBI:16991.label: deoxyribonucleic acid
CHEBI:16991.definition: High molecular weight, linear polymers, composed of nucleotides containing deoxyribose and linked by phosphodiester bonds; DNA contain the genetic information of organisms.

OBI:0001868.label: genetic material
OBI:0001868.definition: A nucleic acid macromolecule that is part of a cell or virion and is inherited from an immediate ancestor, or incorporated in a manner that it has the disposition to be replicated and inherited by descendants.

OBI:0000742.label: nucleic acid restriction enzyme digest
OBI:0000742.definition: A nucleic acid digest is a material that is the output of a process in which nucleic acids are combined with a restriction enzyme resulting in digested fragments with defined ends based on the enzymes cleavage site

CHEBI:33697.label: ribonucleic acid
CHEBI:33697.definition: High molecular weight, linear polymers, composed of nucleotides containing ribose and linked by phosphodiester bonds; RNA is central to the synthesis of proteins.

CHEBI:33696.label: nucleic acid
CHEBI:33696.definition: A macromolecule made up of nucleotide units and hydrolysable into certain pyrimidine or purine bases (usually adenine, cytosine, guanine, thymine, uracil), D-ribose or 2-deoxy-D-ribose and phosphoric acid.

CHEBI:16670.label: peptide
CHEBI:16670.definition: Amide derived from two or more amino carboxylic acid molecules (the same or different) by formation of a covalent bond from the carbonyl carbon of one to the nitrogen atom of another with formal loss of water. The term is usually applied to structures formed from alpha-amino acids, but it includes those derived from any amino carboxylic acid. X = OH, OR, NH2, NHR, etc.

OBI:0302835.label: denatured polymer
OBI:0302835.definition: Is a polymer which has lost secondary or tertiary structure

OBI:0302847.label: methylated polymer
OBI:0302847.definition: A methylated polymer which has artificially acquired one or more methyl groups

OBI:0000709.label: yeast artificial chromosome vector
OBI:0000709.definition: a double-stranded DNA that was engineered to contain a yeast origin of replication, encodes for a selectable gene product, contains a cloning site, and has yeast telomerase sequences

OBI:0000406.label: PCR product
OBI:0000406.definition: is double stranded DNA that is the specified output of a polymerase chain reaction

OBI:0000430.label: plasmid
OBI:0000430.definition:
plasmid = DNA and has_quality circular and has_function
(is_realized_as some gene expression) GO:0010467

OBI:0002437.label: widefield microscopy
OBI:0002437.definition: A fluorescence microscopy technique where the specimen under investigation is fully bathed in light, as opposed to confocal microscopy in which only a small portion of the specimen is illuminated.

CLO:0000019.label: immortal cell line cell
CLO:0000019.definition: A cell line cell that is expected to be capable of an unlimited number of divisions, and is thus able to support indefinite propagation in vitro as part of an immortal cell line.

CLO:0000018.label: mortal cell line cell
CLO:0000018.definition: A cell line cell that is capable of replicating a limited number of times in culture before undergoing senescence.

CLO:0009828.label: immortal cell line
CLO:0009828.definition: A cell line that is expected to be capable of indefinite propagation in an vitro culture.

CLO:0009829.label: mortal cell line
CLO:0009829.definition: A cell line is able to support only a limited number of passages in vitro.

OBI:0001906.label: cancer cell line
OBI:0001906.definition: An immortal cell line derived from a transformed cell that was part of a malignant tumor.

OBI:1110028.label: 293-T cell line
OBI:1110028.definition: A cell line derived from human embryonic kidney cells. This cell line contains the SV40 Large T-antigen, allowing episomal replication of transfected plasmids containing the SV40 origin of replication.

OBI:1110029.label: C1R cell line
OBI:1110029.definition: A cell line derived from human B cells. This cell line was created by EBV transformation (B-lymphoblastoid cell-line (BLCL)).

OBI:1110031.label: EL-4 cell line
OBI:1110031.definition: A cell line derived from mouse (C57BL/6N) lymphoma cells.

OBI:1110032.label: HeLa cell line
OBI:1110032.definition: A cell line derived from human cervical cancer cells.

OBI:1110033.label: JAWS II cell line
OBI:1110033.definition: A cell line derived from mouse dendritic cells.

OBI:1110036.label: JY cell line
OBI:1110036.definition: The JY cell line is an Epstein-Barr virus (EBV)-immortalised b cell lymphoblastoid line.(wikipedia)

OBI:1110035.label: Jurkat cell line
OBI:1110035.definition: A cell line derived from human T cells.

OBI:1110099.label: L cell line
OBI:1110099.definition: A cell line derived from mouse fibroblasts.

OBI:1110118.label: P815 cell line
OBI:1110118.definition: A cell line derived from mouse mastocytoma.

OBI:1110038.label: RMA cell line
OBI:1110038.definition: A cell line derived from a mouse lymphoma, specifically a Rauscher virus-induced tumor.This cell ine is antigen processing-defective and expresses a very low level of MHC molecules on its surface.

OBI:1110039.label: T2 cell line
OBI:1110039.definition: A human T-B lymphoblastoid hybrid cell line

CL:0000767.label: basophil
CL:0000767.definition: Any of the immature or mature forms of a granular leukocyte that in its mature form has an irregularly shaped, pale-staining nucleus that is partially constricted into two lobes, and with cytoplasm that contains coarse, bluish-black granules of variable size. Basophils contain vasoactive amines such as histamine and serotonin, which are released on appropriate stimulation. A basophil is CD123-positive, CD193-positive, CD203c-positive, and FceRIa-positive.

CL:0000451.label: dendritic cell
CL:0000451.definition: A cell of hematopoietic origin, typically resident in particular tissues, specialized in the uptake, processing, and transport of antigens to lymph nodes for the purpose of stimulating an immune response via T cell activation. These cells are lineage negative (CD3-negative, CD19-negative, CD34-negative, and CD56-negative).

CL:0000066.label: epithelial cell
CL:0000066.definition: A cell that is usually found in a two-dimensional sheet with a free surface. The cell has a cytoskeleton that allows for tight cell to cell contact and for cell polarity where apical part is directed towards the lumen and the basal part to the basal lamina.

CL:0000232.label: erythrocyte
CL:0000232.definition: A red blood cell. In mammals, mature erythrocytes are biconcave disks containing hemoglobin whose function is to transport oxygen.

CL:0000578.label: experimentally modified cell in vitro
CL:0000578.definition: A cell in vitro that has undergone physical changes as a consequence of a deliberate and specific experimental procedure.

CL:0000057.label: fibroblast
CL:0000057.definition: A connective tissue cell which secretes an extracellular matrix rich in collagen and other macromolecules. Flattened and irregular in outline with branching processes; appear fusiform or spindle-shaped.

CL:0000235.label: macrophage
CL:0000235.definition: A mononuclear phagocyte present in variety of tissues, typically differentiated from monocytes, capable of phagocytosing a variety of extracellular particulate material, including immune complexes, microorganisms, and dead cells.

CL:0000097.label: mast cell
CL:0000097.definition: A cell that is found in almost all tissues containing numerous basophilic granules and capable of releasing large amounts of histamine and heparin upon activation. Progenitors leave bone marrow and mature in connective and mucosal tissue. Mature mast cells are found in all tissues, except the bloodstream. Their phenotype is CD117-high, CD123-negative, CD193-positive, CD200R3-positive, and FceRI-high. Stem-cell factor (KIT-ligand; SCF) is the main controlling signal of their survival and development.

CL:0000842.label: mononuclear cell
CL:0000842.definition: A leukocyte with a single non-segmented nucleus in the mature form.

CL:0000003.label: native cell
CL:0000003.definition: A cell that is found in a natural setting, which includes multicellular organism cells 'in vivo' (i.e. part of an organism), and unicellular organisms 'in environment' (i.e. part of a natural environment).

CL:0000001.label: primary cultured cell
CL:0000001.definition: A cultured cell that is freshly isolated from a organismal source, or derives in culture from such a cell prior to the culture being passaged.

OBI:0001866.label: secondary cultured cell
OBI:0001866.definition: A cultured cell that has been passaged or derives from a cell that has been passaged in culture.

CL:0000182.label: hepatocyte
CL:0000182.definition: The main structural component of the liver. They are specialized epithelial cells that are organized into interconnected plates called lobules. Majority of cell population of liver, polygonal in shape, arranged in plates or trabeculae between sinusoids; may have single nucleus or binucleated.

CL:0000789.label: alpha-beta T cell
CL:0000789.definition: A T cell that expresses an alpha-beta T cell receptor complex.

CL:0000786.label: plasma cell
CL:0000786.definition: A terminally differentiated, post-mitotic, antibody secreting cell of the B cell lineage with the phenotype CD138-positive, surface immunonoglobulin-negative, and MHC Class II-negative. Plasma cells are oval or round with extensive rough endoplasmic reticulum, a well-developed Golgi apparatus, and a round nucleus having a characteristic cartwheel heterochromatin pattern and are devoted to producing large amounts of immunoglobulin.

CL:0000236.label: B cell
CL:0000236.definition: A lymphocyte of B lineage with the phenotype CD19-positive, CD20-positive, and capable of B cell mediated immunity.

CL:0000084.label: T cell
CL:0000084.definition: A type of lymphocyte whose defining characteristic is the expression of a T cell receptor complex.

CL:0000010.label: cultured cell
CL:0000010.definition: A cell in vitro that is or has been maintained or propagated as part of a cell culture.

CL:0000794.label: CD8-positive, alpha-beta cytotoxic T cell
CL:0000794.definition: A CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cell that is capable of killing target cells in an antigen specific manner with the phenotype perforin-positive and granzyme B-positive.

CL:0000624.label: CD4-positive, alpha-beta T cell
CL:0000624.definition: A mature alpha-beta T cell that expresses an alpha-beta T cell receptor and the CD4 coreceptor.

CL:0000625.label: CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cell
CL:0000625.definition: A T cell expressing an alpha-beta T cell receptor and the CD8 coreceptor.

CL:0000814.label: mature NK T cell
CL:0000814.definition: A mature alpha-beta T cell of a distinct lineage that bears natural killer markers and a T cell receptor specific for a limited set of ligands. NK T cells have activation and regulatory roles particularly early in an immune response.

CL:0000542.label: lymphocyte
CL:0000542.definition: A lymphocyte is a leukocyte commonly found in the blood and lymph that has the characteristics of a large nucleus, a neutral staining cytoplasm, and prominent heterochromatin.

ENVO:00002257.label: podzol
ENVO:00002257.definition: Podzols are soils with a typically ash-grey upper subsurface horizon, bleached by loss of organic matter and iron oxides, on top of a dark accumulation horizon with brown, reddish or black illuviated humus and/or reddish Fe compounds. Podzols occur in humid areas in the boreal and temperate zones and locally also in the tropics.

ENVO:00001998.label: soil
ENVO:00001998.definition: Soil is an environmental material which is primarily composed of minerals, varying proportions of sand, silt, and clay, organic material such as humus, gases, liquids, and a broad range of resident micro- and macroorganisms.

OBI:0001717.label: B cell epitope specific antibody-dependent cellular cytotoxicity
OBI:0001717.definition: antibody-dependent cellular cytotoxicity resulting from antibody binding to epitope

OBI:0001212.label: epitope specific type IV hypersensitivity by T cells
OBI:0001212.definition: A process of type IV hypersensitivity by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

GO:0044808.label: Oncostatin M production
GO:0044808.definition: The appearance of Oncostatin M due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0032639.label: TRAIL production
GO:0032639.definition: The appearance of TRAIL due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0032602.label: chemokine production
GO:0032602.definition: The appearance of a chemokine due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0032601.label: connective tissue growth factor production
GO:0032601.definition: The appearance of connective tissue growth factor due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0002367.label: cytokine production involved in immune response
GO:0002367.definition: The appearance of a cytokine due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus contributing to an immune response, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0002534.label: cytokine production involved in inflammatory response
GO:0002534.definition: The synthesis or release of a cytokine following a inflammatory stimulus as part of an inflammatory response, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

OBI:0001193.label: epitope specific cytokine production by T cells
OBI:0001193.definition: A process of cytokine production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

GO:0071611.label: granulocyte colony-stimulating factor production
GO:0071611.definition: The appearance of granulocyte colony-stimulating factor due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0032604.label: granulocyte macrophage colony-stimulating factor production
GO:0032604.definition: The appearance of granulocyte macrophage colony-stimulating factor due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0032605.label: hepatocyte growth factor production
GO:0032605.definition: The appearance of hepatocyte growth factor due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0032608.label: interferon-beta production
GO:0032608.definition: The appearance of interferon-beta due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0032609.label: interferon-gamma production
GO:0032609.definition: The appearance of interferon-gamma due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels. Interferon-gamma is also known as type II interferon.

GO:0032612.label: interleukin-1 production
GO:0032612.definition: The appearance of interleukin-1 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0032613.label: interleukin-10 production
GO:0032613.definition: The appearance of interleukin-10 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0032614.definition: The appearance of interleukin-11 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0032615.label: interleukin-12 production
GO:0032615.definition: The appearance of interleukin-12 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0032616.label: interleukin-13 production
GO:0032616.definition: The appearance of interleukin-13 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0032617.label: interleukin-14 production
GO:0032617.definition: The appearance of interleukin-14 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0032618.label: interleukin-15 production
GO:0032618.definition: The appearance of interleukin-15 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0032619.label: interleukin-16 production
GO:0032619.definition: The appearance of interleukin-16 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0032620.label: interleukin-17 production
GO:0032620.definition: The appearance of any member of the interleukin-17 family of cytokines due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0032621.label: interleukin-18 production
GO:0032621.definition: The appearance of interleukin-18 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0032622.label: interleukin-19 production
GO:0032622.definition: The appearance of interleukin-19 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0032623.label: interleukin-2 production
GO:0032623.definition: The appearance of interleukin-2 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0032624.label: interleukin-20 production
GO:0032624.definition: The appearance of interleukin-20 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0032625.label: interleukin-21 production
GO:0032625.definition: The appearance of interleukin-21 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0032626.label: interleukin-22 production
GO:0032626.definition: The appearance of interleukin-22 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0032627.label: interleukin-23 production
GO:0032627.definition: The appearance of interleukin-23 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0032628.label: interleukin-24 production
GO:0032628.definition: The appearance of interleukin-24 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0032629.label: interleukin-25 production
GO:0032629.definition: The appearance of interleukin-25 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0032630.label: interleukin-26 production
GO:0032630.definition: The appearance of interleukin-26 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0032631.label: interleukin-27 production
GO:0032631.definition: The appearance of interleukin-27 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0032632.label: interleukin-3 production
GO:0032632.definition: The appearance of interleukin-3 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0032633.label: interleukin-4 production
GO:0032633.definition: The appearance of interleukin-4 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0032634.label: interleukin-5 production
GO:0032634.definition: The appearance of interleukin-5 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0032635.label: interleukin-6 production
GO:0032635.definition: The appearance of interleukin-6 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0032636.label: interleukin-7 production
GO:0032636.definition: The appearance of interleukin-7 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0032637.label: interleukin-8 production
GO:0032637.definition: The appearance of interleukin-8 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0032638.label: interleukin-9 production
GO:0032638.definition: The appearance of interleukin-9 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0044807.label: macrophage migration inhibitory factor production
GO:0044807.definition: The appearance of macrophage migration inhibitory factor due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0002390.label: platelet activating factor production
GO:0002390.definition: The synthesis or release of platelet activating factor following a stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0071604.label: transforming growth factor beta production
GO:0071604.definition: The appearance of any member of the transforming growth factor-beta family of cytokines due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels. Transforming growth factor-beta family members include TGF-B1, TGF-B2, and TGF-B3.

GO:0032905.label: transforming growth factor beta1 production
GO:0032905.definition: The appearance of transforming growth factor-beta1 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0032906.label: transforming growth factor beta2 production
GO:0032906.definition: The appearance of transforming growth factor-beta2 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0032907.label: transforming growth factor beta3 production
GO:0032907.definition: The appearance of transforming growth factor-beta3 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0071706.label: tumor necrosis factor superfamily cytokine production
GO:0071706.definition: The appearance of any member of the TNF superfamily due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0032606.label: type I interferon production
GO:0032606.definition: The appearance of type I interferon due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels. Type I interferons include the interferon-alpha, beta, delta, episilon, zeta, kappa, tau, and omega gene families.

GO:0034343.label: type III interferon production
GO:0034343.definition: The appearance of type III interferon due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels. Interferon lambda is the only member of the type III interferon found so far.

GO:0010573.label: vascular endothelial growth factor production
GO:0010573.definition: The appearance of vascular endothelial growth factor production due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0001913.label: T cell mediated cytotoxicity
GO:0001913.definition: The directed killing of a target cell by a T cell through the release of granules containing cytotoxic mediators or through the engagement of death receptors.

GO:0097278.label: complement-dependent cytotoxicity
GO:0097278.definition: Lysis of a cell resulting from triggering of the complement cascade. An example can be seen with complement activation and subsequent lysis of a bacterial cell as a result of the binding of IgM to the cell surface followed by the binding of complement proteins to that antibody.

GO:0043316.label: cytotoxic T cell degranulation
GO:0043316.definition: The regulated exocytosis of secretory granules containing preformed mediators such as perforin and granzymes by a cytotoxic T cell.

OBI:1110204.label: epitope specific killing by T cells
OBI:1110204.definition: A biological process where T cells lyse antigen presenting cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope on MHC molecules of the antigen presenting cell.

GO:0035397.label: helper T cell enhancement of adaptive immune response
GO:0035397.definition: Positive regulation of an adaptive immune response mediated via cytokine production by helper T cell.

GO:0002514.label: B cell tolerance induction
GO:0002514.definition: A process involving any mechanism for tolerance induction in B cells.

GO:0002517.label: T cell tolerance induction
GO:0002517.definition: A process involving any mechanism for tolerance induction in T cells.

OBI:0001201.label: epitope specific tolerance induction by T cells
OBI:0001201.definition: A process of tolerance induction by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:0001249.label: epitope specific T cell tolerance induction
OBI:0001249.definition: A process of T cell tolerance induction resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:0001722.label: B cell epitope specific hypersensitivity
OBI:0001722.definition: hypersensitivity resulting from antibody binding to epitope

GO:0001806.label: type IV hypersensitivity
GO:0001806.definition: An inflammatory response driven by T cell recognition of processed soluble or cell-associated antigens leading to cytokine release and leukocyte activation.

GO:0003824.label: catalytic activity
GO:0003824.definition: Catalysis of a biochemical reaction at physiological temperatures. In biologically catalyzed reactions, the reactants are known as substrates, and the catalysts are naturally occurring macromolecular substances known as enzymes. Enzymes possess specific binding sites for substrates, and are usually composed wholly or largely of protein, but RNA that has catalytic activity (ribozyme) is often also regarded as enzymatic.

GO:0042605.label: peptide antigen binding
GO:0042605.definition: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with an antigen peptide.

GO:0034061.label: DNA polymerase activity
GO:0034061.definition: Catalysis of the reaction: deoxynucleoside triphosphate + DNA(n) = diphosphate + DNA(n+1); the synthesis of DNA from deoxyribonucleotide triphosphates in the presence of a nucleic acid template and a 3'hydroxyl group.

GO:0003964.label: RNA-directed DNA polymerase activity
GO:0003964.definition: Catalysis of the reaction: deoxynucleoside triphosphate + DNA(n) = diphosphate + DNA(n+1). Catalyzes RNA-template-directed extension of the 3'- end of a DNA strand by one deoxynucleotide at a time.

GO:0000785.label: chromatin
GO:0000785.definition: The ordered and organized complex of DNA, protein, and sometimes RNA, that forms the chromosome.

GO:0005694.label: chromosome
GO:0005694.definition: A structure composed of a very long molecule of DNA and associated proteins (e.g. histones) that carries hereditary information.

GO:0043227.label: membrane-bounded organelle
GO:0043227.definition: Organized structure of distinctive morphology and function, bounded by a single or double lipid bilayer membrane. Includes the nucleus, mitochondria, plastids, vacuoles, and vesicles. Excludes the plasma membrane.

GO:0097458.label: neuron part
GO:0097458.definition: Any constituent part of a neuron, the basic cellular unit of nervous tissue. A typical neuron consists of a cell body (often called the soma), an axon, and dendrites. Their purpose is to receive, conduct, and transmit impulses in the nervous system.

GO:0008228.label: opsonization
GO:0008228.definition: The process in which a microorganism (or other particulate material) is rendered more susceptible to phagocytosis by coating with an opsonin, a blood serum protein such as a complement component or antibody.

GO:0002250.label: adaptive immune response
GO:0002250.definition: An immune response mediated by cells expressing specific receptors for antigen produced through a somatic diversification process, and allowing for an enhanced secondary response to subsequent exposures to the same antigen (immunological memory).

GO:0097280.label: histamine secretion mediated by immunoglobulin
GO:0097280.definition: Histamine release triggered by the binding of an antigen to an immunoglobulin bound to the cell surface.

GO:0006306.label: DNA methylation
GO:0006306.definition: The covalent transfer of a methyl group to either N-6 of adenine or C-5 or N-4 of cytosine.

GO:0006260.label: DNA replication
GO:0006260.definition: The cellular metabolic process in which a cell duplicates one or more molecules of DNA. DNA replication begins when specific sequences, known as origins of replication, are recognized and bound by initiation proteins, and ends when the original DNA molecule has been completely duplicated and the copies topologically separated. The unit of replication usually corresponds to the genome of the cell, an organelle, or a virus. The template for replication can either be an existing DNA molecule or RNA.

GO:0042110.label: T cell activation
GO:0042110.definition: The change in morphology and behavior of a mature or immature T cell resulting from exposure to a mitogen, cytokine, chemokine, cellular ligand, or an antigen for which it is specific.

GO:0030041.label: actin filament polymerization
GO:0030041.definition: Assembly of actin filaments by the addition of actin monomers to a filament.

GO:0070358.label: actin polymerization-dependent cell motility
GO:0070358.definition: A process involved in the controlled movement of a bacterial cell powered by the continuous polymerization of actin at one pole of the cell.

GO:0001508.label: action potential
GO:0001508.definition: A process in which membrane potential cycles through a depolarizing spike, triggered in response to depolarization above some threshold, followed by repolarization. This cycle is driven by the flow of ions through various voltage gated channels with different thresholds and ion specificities.

GO:0001788.label: antibody-dependent cellular cytotoxicity
GO:0001788.definition: Cytolysis of target cells by natural killer cells, eosinophils, neutrophils, monocytes, or macrophages following engagement of antibodies bound to the target cells by Fc receptors on the effector cells.

GO:0019882.label: antigen processing and presentation
GO:0019882.definition: The process in which an antigen-presenting cell expresses antigen (peptide or lipid) on its cell surface in association with an MHC protein complex.

OBI:0001588.label: binding
OBI:0001588.definition: The process of material entities forming complexes.

GO:0007596.label: blood coagulation
GO:0007596.definition: The sequential process in which the multiple coagulation factors of the blood interact, ultimately resulting in the formation of an insoluble fibrin clot; it may be divided into three stages: stage 1, the formation of intrinsic and extrinsic prothrombin converting principle; stage 2, the formation of thrombin; stage 3, the formation of stable fibrin polymers.

GO:0007049.label: cell cycle
GO:0007049.definition: The progression of biochemical and morphological phases and events that occur in a cell during successive cell replication or nuclear replication events. Canonically, the cell cycle comprises the replication and segregation of genetic material followed by the division of the cell, but in endocycles or syncytial cells nuclear replication or nuclear division may not be followed by cell division.

GO:0001906.label: cell killing
GO:0001906.definition: Any process in an organism that results in the killing of its own cells or those of another organism, including in some cases the death of the other organism. Killing here refers to the induction of death in one cell by another cell, not cell-autonomous death due to internal or other environmental conditions.

GO:0008283.label: cell proliferation
GO:0008283.definition: The multiplication or reproduction of cells, resulting in the expansion of a cell population.

GO:0048869.label: cellular developmental process
GO:0048869.definition: A biological process whose specific outcome is the progression of a cell over time from an initial condition to a later condition.

GO:0009987.label: cellular process
GO:0009987.definition: Any process that is carried out at the cellular level, but not necessarily restricted to a single cell. For example, cell communication occurs among more than one cell, but occurs at the cellular level.

GO:0051276.label: chromosome organization
GO:0051276.definition: A process that is carried out at the cellular level that results in the assembly, arrangement of constituent parts, or disassembly of chromosomes, structures composed of a very long molecule of DNA and associated proteins that carries hereditary information. This term covers covalent modifications at the molecular level as well as spatial relationships among the major components of a chromosome.

GO:0001816.label: cytokine production
GO:0001816.definition: The appearance of a cytokine due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

OGMS:0000063.label: disease course
OGMS:0000063.definition: The totality of all processes through which a given disease instance is realized.

GO:0009566.label: fertilization
GO:0009566.definition: The union of gametes of opposite sexes during the process of sexual reproduction to form a zygote. It involves the fusion of the gametic nuclei (karyogamy) and cytoplasm (plasmogamy).

GO:0010467.label: gene expression
GO:0010467.definition: The process in which a gene's sequence is converted into a mature gene product or products (proteins or RNA). This includes the production of an RNA transcript as well as any processing to produce a mature RNA product or an mRNA or circRNA (for protein-coding genes) and the translation of that mRNA or circRNA into protein. Protein maturation is included when required to form an active form of a product from an inactive precursor form.

GO:0006006.label: glucose metabolic process
GO:0006006.definition: The chemical reactions and pathways involving glucose, the aldohexose gluco-hexose. D-glucose is dextrorotatory and is sometimes known as dextrose; it is an important source of energy for living organisms and is found free as well as combined in homo- and hetero-oligosaccharides and polysaccharides.

GO:0036262.label: granulysin production
GO:0036262.definition: The appearance of granulysin due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0035746.label: granzyme A production
GO:0035746.definition: The appearance of granzyme A due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0071613.label: granzyme B production
