GO:0071613.definition: The appearance of granzyme B due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0030097.label: hemopoiesis
GO:0030097.definition: The process whose specific outcome is the progression of the myeloid and lymphoid derived organ/tissue systems of the blood and other parts of the body over time, from formation to the mature structure. The site of hemopoiesis is variable during development, but occurs primarily in bone marrow or kidney in many adult vertebrates.

GO:0016570.label: histone modification
GO:0016570.definition: The covalent alteration of one or more amino acid residues within a histone protein.

GO:0002524.label: hypersensitivity
GO:0002524.definition: An inflammatory response to an exogenous environmental antigen or an endogenous antigen initiated by the adaptive immune system.

OBI:0001707.label: immunoglobulin mediated histamine release
OBI:0001707.definition: The release of histamine by cells stimulated through their Fc receptors which are loaded with immunoglobulins.

GO:0016064.label: immunoglobulin mediated immune response
GO:0016064.definition: An immune response mediated by immunoglobulins, whether cell-bound or in solution.

UBERON:0000105.label: life cycle stage
UBERON:0000105.definition: A spatiotemporal region encompassing some part of the life cycle of an organism.

GO:0033036.label: macromolecule localization
GO:0033036.definition: Any process in which a macromolecule is transported to, or maintained in, a specific location.

GO:0035944.label: perforin production
GO:0035944.definition: The appearance of a perforin protein due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0006909.label: phagocytosis
GO:0006909.definition: An endocytosis process that results in the engulfment of external particulate material by phagocytes. The particles are initially contained within phagocytic vacuoles (phagosomes), which then fuse with primary lysosomes to effect digestion of the particles.

GO:0040030.label: regulation of molecular function, epigenetic
GO:0040030.definition: Any heritable epigenetic process that modulates the frequency, rate or extent of protein function by self-perpetuating conformational conversions of normal proteins in healthy cells. This is distinct from, though mechanistically analogous to, disease states associated with prion propagation and amyloidogenesis. A single protein, if it carries a glutamine/asparagine-rich ('prion') domain, can sometimes stably exist in at least two distinct physical states, each associated with a different phenotype; propagation of one of these traits is achieved by a self-perpetuating change in the protein from one form to the other, mediated by conformational changes in the glutamine/asparagine-rich domain. Prion domains are both modular and transferable to other proteins, on which they can confer a heritable epigenetic alteration of function; existing bioinformatics data indicate that they are rare in non-eukarya, but common in eukarya.

GO:0050896.label: response to stimulus
GO:0050896.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a stimulus. The process begins with detection of the stimulus and ends with a change in state or activity or the cell or organism.

GO:0002507.label: tolerance induction
GO:0002507.definition: A process that directly activates any of the steps required for tolerance, a physiologic state in which the immune system does not react destructively against the components of an organism that harbors it or against antigens that are introduced to it.

OBI:0000278.label: disease stage
OBI:0000278.definition: a part of an occurrence of a disease process which is associated with position in the normal progression of the disease

OBI:1110024.label: environmental exposure to infectious agent
OBI:1110024.definition: Is a process in which an infectious agent is in direct contact with a potential host organism in its habitat. This is preceded by proximity to the infectious agent

OBI:1110111.label: environmental proximity to infectious agent
OBI:1110111.definition: Is a process in which an infectious agent comes close enough to a potential host organism in its habitat that a contact can result

OBI:1110014.label: epitope binding by adaptive immune receptor
OBI:1110014.definition: is the process in which an adaptive immune receptor binds to a material entity (realizing its disposition). The binding affinity is significant enough to trigger an immune response. Specifically, transient non-specific binding of adaptive immune receptors occurring during immune surveillance is not considered significant binding.

OBI:1110061.label: exposure resulting in immune reactivity
OBI:1110061.definition: a process in which an organism (host) is exposed to some material entity, which results in an immune reactivity

OBI:1110003.label: host exposure to infectious agent
OBI:1110003.definition: a process in which an infectious agent comes into physical contact with a host organism.

OBI:1110094.label: immunization
OBI:1110094.definition: The process of an epitope that is part of or derived from an immunogen coming into contact with adaptive immune cells resulting in these cells acquiring immune effector functions specific for the epitope.

OBI:1110122.label: pathologic process
OBI:1110122.definition: abnormal, harmful processes caused by or associated with a disease

OBI:0001713.label: B cell epitope specific opsonization
OBI:0001713.definition: opsonization resulting from antibody binding to epitope

GO:0042098.label: T cell proliferation
GO:0042098.definition: The expansion of a T cell population by cell division. Follows T cell activation.

GO:0006338.label: chromatin remodeling
GO:0006338.definition: Dynamic structural changes to eukaryotic chromatin occurring throughout the cell division cycle. These changes range from the local changes necessary for transcriptional regulation to global changes necessary for chromosome segregation.

GO:0005216.label: ion channel activity
GO:0005216.definition: Enables the facilitated diffusion of an ion (by an energy-independent process) by passage through a transmembrane aqueous pore or channel without evidence for a carrier-mediated mechanism. May be either selective (it enables passage of a specific ion only) or non-selective (it enables passage of two or more ions of same charge but different size).

OBI:0001612.label: epitope specific vascular endothelial growth factor production by T cells
OBI:0001612.definition: A process of vascular endothelial growth factor production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

GO:0097281.label: immune complex formation
GO:0097281.definition: The process that gives rise to an immune complex. Immune complexes are clusters of antibodies bound to antigen, to which complement may also be fixed, and which may precipitate or remain in solution. Examples are the clumping of cells such as bacteria or red blood cells in the presence of an antibody, precipitation of a toxin after an antibody binds to it, and clumping of viral particles as a result of antibody binding to the virus.

GO:0097282.label: immunoglobulin-mediated neutralization
GO:0097282.definition: The inhibition of an antigen's biological effects by antibody binding to it. An example is neutralization of diphtheria toxin by preventing its entry into human cells via the binding of antibody specific for diphtheria toxin.

GO:0042571.label: immunoglobulin complex, circulating
GO:0042571.definition: An immunoglobulin complex that is secreted into extracellular space and found in mucosal areas or other tissues or circulating in the blood or lymph. In its canonical form, a circulating immunoglobulin complex is composed of two identical heavy chains and two identical light chains, held together by disulfide bonds. Some forms of are polymers of the basic structure and contain additional components such as J-chain and the secretory component.

GO:0071612.label: IP-10 production
GO:0071612.definition: The appearance of IP-10 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0071610.label: chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 1 production
GO:0071610.definition: The appearance of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 1 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0044809.label: chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 17 production
GO:0044809.definition: The appearance of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 17 (CCL17) due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0097388.label: chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 19 production
GO:0097388.definition: The appearance of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 19 (CCL19) due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0036392.label: chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 20 production
GO:0036392.definition: The appearance of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 20 (CCL20) due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0097389.label: chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 21 production
GO:0097389.definition: The appearance of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 21 (CCL21) due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0071924.label: chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 22 production
GO:0071924.definition: The appearance of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 22 (CCL22) due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0071606.label: chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 4 production
GO:0071606.definition: The appearance of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 4 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0071609.label: chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 5 production
GO:0071609.definition: The appearance of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 5 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0097390.label: chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 12 production
GO:0097390.definition: The appearance of chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 12 (CXCL12) due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0097391.label: chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 13 production
GO:0097391.definition: The appearance of chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 13 (CXCL13) due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0097392.label: chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 16 production
GO:0097392.definition: The appearance of chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 16 (CXCL16) due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0035393.label: chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 9 production
GO:0035393.definition: The appearance of chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 9 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0071608.label: macrophage inflammatory protein-1 alpha production
GO:0071608.definition: The appearance of macrophage inflammatory protein 1 alpha due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0071607.label: macrophage inflammatory protein-1 gamma production
GO:0071607.definition: The appearance of macrophage inflammatory protein-1 gamma due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0071605.label: monocyte chemotactic protein-1 production
GO:0071605.definition: The appearance of monocyte chemotactic protein-1 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

OBI:1110184.label: epitope specific GM-CSF release by T cells
OBI:1110184.definition: A biological process where T cells produce GM-CSF resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

GO:0032607.label: interferon-alpha production
GO:0032607.definition: The appearance of interferon-alpha due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

OBI:0001421.label: epitope specific interferon-beta production by T cells
OBI:0001421.definition: A process of interferon-beta production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:1110185.label: epitope specific IFN-g release by T cells
OBI:1110185.definition: A biological process where T cells produce IFNg resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:0001257.label: epitope specific interleukin-1 alpha production by T cells
OBI:0001257.definition: A process of interleukin-1 alpha production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:1110196.label: epitope specific IL-1b release by T cells
OBI:1110196.definition: A biological process where T cells produce IL-1b resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

GO:0032610.label: interleukin-1 alpha production
GO:0032610.definition: The appearance of interleukin-1 alpha due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0032611.label: interleukin-1 beta production
GO:0032611.definition: The appearance of interleukin-1 beta due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

OBI:1110187.label: epitope specific IL-10 release by T cells
OBI:1110187.definition: A biological process where T cells produce IL-10 resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:1110190.label: epitope specific IL-12 release by T cells
OBI:1110190.definition: A biological process where T cells produce IL-12 resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:1110191.label: epitope specific IL-13 release by T cells
OBI:1110191.definition: A biological process where T cells produce IL-13 resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:0001446.label: epitope specific interleukin-15 production by T cells
OBI:0001446.definition: A process of interleukin-15 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:0001275.label: epitope specific interleukin-16 production by T cells
OBI:0001275.definition: A process of interleukin-16 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

GO:0097087.label: interleukin-17A production
GO:0097087.definition: The appearance of interleukin-17A due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0097088.label: interleukin-17F production
GO:0097088.definition: The appearance of interleukin-17F due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

OBI:1110193.label: epitope specific IL-17 release by T cells
OBI:1110193.definition: A biological process where T cells produce IL-17 resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:1110195.label: epitope specific IL-18 release by T cells
OBI:1110195.definition: A biological process where T cells produce IL-18 resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:1110056.label: epitope specific IL-2 release by T cells
OBI:1110056.definition: A biological process where T cells produce IL-2 resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:0001316.label: epitope specific interleukin-21 production by T cells
OBI:0001316.definition: A process of interleukin-21 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:0001399.label: epitope specific interleukin-22 production by T cells
OBI:0001399.definition: A process of interleukin-22 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:0001381.label: epitope specific interleukin-23 production by T cells
OBI:0001381.definition: A process of interleukin-23 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:0001262.label: epitope specific interleukin-27 production by T cells
OBI:0001262.definition: A process of interleukin-27 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:0001254.label: epitope specific interleukin-3 production by T cells
OBI:0001254.definition: A process of interleukin-3 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:1110199.label: epitope specific IL-4 release by T cells
OBI:1110199.definition: A biological process where T cells produce IL-4 resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:1110202.label: epitope specific IL-5 release by T cells
OBI:1110202.definition: A biological process where T cells produce IL-5 resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:1110203.label: epitope specific IL-6 release by T cells
OBI:1110203.definition: A biological process where T cells produce IL-6 resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:0001535.label: epitope specific interleukin-7 production by T cells
OBI:0001535.definition: A process of interleukin-7 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:0001373.label: epitope specific interleukin-8 production by T cells
OBI:0001373.definition: A process of interleukin-8 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:0001415.label: epitope specific interleukin-9 production by T cells
OBI:0001415.definition: A process of interleukin-9 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:1110206.label: epitope specific TNF release by T cells
OBI:1110206.definition: A biological process where T cells produce TNF resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:0001256.label: epitope specific lymphotoxin A production by T cells
OBI:0001256.definition: A process of lymphotoxin A production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:0001439.label: epitope specific chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 9 production by T cells
OBI:0001439.definition: A process of chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 9 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

GO:0035399.label: helper T cell enhancement of B cell mediated immune response
GO:0035399.definition: Positive regulation of a B cell mediated immune response mediated via cytokine production by a helper T cell.

GO:0035398.label: helper T cell enhancement of T cell mediated immune response
GO:0035398.definition: Positive regulation of a T cell mediated immune response mediated via cytokine production by a helper T cell.

OBI:0001420.label: epitope specific helper T cell enhancement of T cell mediated immune response
OBI:0001420.definition: A process of helper T cell enhancement of T cell mediated immune response resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:0001314.label: epitope specific T cell enhancement of B cell mediated immune response
OBI:0001314.definition: A process of T cell enhancement of B cell mediated immune response resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:0001678.label: epitope specific granzyme A production by T cells
OBI:0001678.definition: A process of granzyme A production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:0001502.label: epitope specific perforin production by T cells
OBI:0001502.definition: The production of perforin, an immune mediator molecule involved in T cell degranulation,  resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:0001677.label: epitope specific granulysin production by T cells
OBI:0001677.definition: A process of granulysin production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

GO:0044030.label: regulation of DNA methylation
GO:0044030.definition: Any process that modulates the frequency, rate or extent of the covalent transfer of a methyl group to either N-6 of adenine or C-5 or N-4 of cytosine.

GO:0040029.label: regulation of gene expression, epigenetic
GO:0040029.definition: Any process that modulates the frequency, rate or extent of gene expression; the process is mitotically or meiotically heritable, or is stably self-propagated in the cytoplasm of a resting cell, and does not entail a change in DNA sequence.

OBI:1110182.label: epitope specific T cell proliferation
OBI:1110182.definition: A biological process where T cells proliferate resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:0001208.label: epitope specific T cell activation
OBI:0001208.definition: A process of T cell activation resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

GO:0005739.label: mitochondrion
GO:0005739.definition: A semiautonomous, self replicating organelle that occurs in varying numbers, shapes, and sizes in the cytoplasm of virtually all eukaryotic cells. It is notably the site of tissue respiration.

GO:0042575.label: DNA polymerase complex
GO:0042575.definition: A protein complex that possesses DNA polymerase activity and is involved in template directed synthesis of DNA.

GO:0042611.label: MHC protein complex
GO:0042611.definition: A transmembrane protein complex composed of an MHC alpha chain and, in most cases, either an MHC class II beta chain or an invariant beta2-microglobin chain, and with or without a bound peptide, lipid, or polysaccharide antigen.

GO:0019814.label: immunoglobulin complex
GO:0019814.definition: A protein complex that in its canonical form is composed of two identical immunoglobulin heavy chains and two identical immunoglobulin light chains, held together by disulfide bonds and sometimes complexed with additional proteins. An immunoglobulin complex may be embedded in the plasma membrane or present in the extracellular space, in mucosal areas or other tissues, or circulating in the blood or lymph.

OBI:1110022.label: adaptive immune receptor
OBI:1110022.definition: is a receptor produced by cells of the adaptive immune system with the purpose of binding epitopes.

OBI:0001394.label: epitope specific cytotoxic T cell degranulation
OBI:0001394.definition: A process of cytotoxic T cell degranulation resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

GO:0006974.label: cellular response to DNA damage stimulus
GO:0006974.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a stimulus indicating damage to its DNA from environmental insults or errors during metabolism.

GO:0006955.label: immune response
GO:0006955.definition: Any immune system process that functions in the calibrated response of an organism to a potential internal or invasive threat.

OBI:0001267.label: epitope specific transforming growth factor-beta production by T cells
OBI:0001267.definition: A process of transforming growth factor-beta production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:0001386.label: epitope specific monocyte chemotactic protein-1 production by T cells
OBI:0001386.definition: A process of monocyte chemotactic protein-1 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:0001362.label: epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 4 production by T cells
OBI:0001362.definition: A process of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 4 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:0001447.label: epitope specific macrophage inflammatory protein-1 gamma production by T cells
OBI:0001447.definition: A process of macrophage inflammatory protein-1 gamma production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:0001207.label: epitope specific macrophage inflammatory protein-1 alpha production by T cells
OBI:0001207.definition: A process of macrophage inflammatory protein-1 alpha production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:0001366.label: epitope specific RANTES production by T cells
OBI:0001366.definition: A process of RANTES production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:0001219.label: epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 1 production by T cells
OBI:0001219.definition: A process of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 1 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:0001334.label: epitope specific granulocyte colony stimulating factor production by T cells
OBI:0001334.definition: A process of granulocyte colony stimulating factor production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:0001462.label: epitope specific IP-10 production by T cells
OBI:0001462.definition: A process of IP-10 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:0001371.label: epitope specific granzyme B production by T cells
OBI:0001371.definition: A process of granzyme B production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:0001351.label: epitope specific tumor necrosis factor superfamily cytokine production by T cells
OBI:0001351.definition: A process of tumor necrosis factor superfamily cytokine production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

GO:0032641.label: lymphotoxin A production
GO:0032641.definition: The appearance of lymphotoxin A due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0072535.label: tumor necrosis factor (ligand) superfamily member 11 production
GO:0072535.definition: The appearance of tumor necrosis factor superfamily member 11 (TNFSF11; RANKL) due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

GO:0032640.label: tumor necrosis factor production
GO:0032640.definition: The appearance of tumor necrosis factor due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

OBI:0001819.label: epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 22 production by T cells
OBI:0001819.definition: A process of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 22 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:0001518.label: epitope specific tumor necrosis factor (ligand) superfamily member 11 production by T cells
OBI:0001518.definition: A process of tumor necrosis factor (ligand) superfamily member 11 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:0001526.label: epitope specific interleukin-17A production by T cells
OBI:0001526.definition: A process of interleukin-17A production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:0001470.label: epitope specific interleukin-17F production by T cells
OBI:0001470.definition: A process of interleukin-17F production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:0001716.label: B cell epitope specific complement-dependent cytotoxicity
OBI:0001716.definition: complement-dependent cytotoxicity resulting from antibody binding to epitope

OBI:0001725.label: B cell epitope specific histamine secretion mediated by immunoglobulin
OBI:0001725.definition: histamine secretion mediated by immunoglobulin resulting from antibody binding to epitope

OBI:0001720.label: B cell epitope specific immune complex formation
OBI:0001720.definition: immune complex formation resulting from antibody binding to epitope

OBI:0001714.label: B cell epitope specific immunoglobulin-mediated neutralization
OBI:0001714.definition: immunoglobulin-mediated neutralization resulting from antibody binding to epitope

OBI:0001825.label: epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 19 production by T cells
OBI:0001825.definition: A process of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 19 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:0001823.label: epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 21 production by T cells
OBI:0001823.definition: A process of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 21 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:0001818.label: epitope specific chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 12 production by T cells
OBI:0001818.definition: A process of chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 12 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:0001816.label: epitope specific chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 13 production by T cells
OBI:0001816.definition: A process of chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 13 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

OBI:0001820.label: epitope specific chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 16 production by T cells
OBI:0001820.definition: A process of chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 16 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

IAO:0000055.label: rule
IAO:0000055.definition: a rule is an executable which guides, defines, restricts actions

UO:0000051.label: concentration unit
UO:0000051.definition: A unit which represents a standard measurement of how much of a given substance there is mixed with another substance.

UO:0000105.label: frequency unit
UO:0000105.definition: A unit which is a standard measure of the number of repetitive actions in a particular time.

UO:0000001.label: length unit
UO:0000001.definition: A unit which is a standard measure of the distance between two points.

UO:0000002.label: mass unit
UO:0000002.definition: A unit which is a standard measure of the amount of matter/energy of a physical object.

UO:0000109.label: pressure unit
UO:0000109.definition: A unit which is a standard measure of the force applied to a given area.

UO:0000280.label: rate unit
UO:0000280.definition: A unit which represents a standard measurement occurrence of a process per unit time.

UO:0000006.label: substance unit
UO:0000006.definition: A unit which is a standardised quantity of an element or compound with uniform composition.

UO:0000005.label: temperature unit
UO:0000005.definition: A unit which is a standard measure of the average kinetic energy of the particles in a sample of matter.

UO:0000003.label: time unit
UO:0000003.definition: A unit which is a standard measure of the dimension in which events occur in sequence.

UO:0000095.label: volume unit
UO:0000095.definition: A unit which is a standard measure of the amount of space occupied by any substance, whether solid, liquid, or gas.

UO:0000270.label: volumetric flow rate unit
UO:0000270.definition: A unit which is a standard measure of the volume of fluid which passes through a given surface per unit time .

OBI:0001964.label: decision-theoretic analysis objective
OBI:0001964.definition: An objective specification which what includes a description of two or more alternative actions to take in a particular situation and a metric that enables comparisons of the two actions. The objective specified is achieved in a planned process which includes a data transformation, the output of which is an identification of the 'best' choice according to the metric.

OBI:0000806.label: material maintenance objective
OBI:0000806.definition: An objective specification maintains some or all of the qualities of a material over time.

OBI:0000993.label: service provision objective
OBI:0000993.definition: An objective which is fulfilled by the provision of some service e.g. a training service

OBI:0000684.label: specimen collection objective
OBI:0000684.definition: A objective specification to obtain a material entity for potential use as an input during an investigation.

OBI:0000962.label: training objective
OBI:0000962.definition: An objective specification which is fulfilled by the provision of some training.

OBI:0000441.label: assay objective
OBI:0000441.definition: an objective specification to determine a specified type of information about an evaluated entity (the material entity bearing evaluant role)

OBI:0001160.label: assay validation objective
OBI:0001160.definition: an objective specification to check the accuracy or the quality of the results of an assay by comparison with independent results

OBI:0000015.label: biological feature identification objective
OBI:0000015.definition: Biological_feature_identification_objective is an objective role carried out by the proposition defining the aim of a study designed to examine or characterize a particular biological feature.

OBI:0200166.label: data transformation objective
OBI:0200166.definition: An objective specification to transformation input data into output data

OBI:0000456.label: material transformation objective
OBI:0000456.definition: an objective specifiction that creates an specific output object from input materials.

OBI:0000208.label: methodology testing objective
OBI:0000208.definition: Methodology_testing_objective is an objective role carried out by a proposition defining the aim of the study is to examine the effect of using different methodologies.

OBI:0001175.label: selective organism creation objective
OBI:0001175.definition: an objective specification to generate a population or type of organism within species that have some uniform behavioral, morphological, physiological, or genetic characteristics with similarly bred organisms.

OBI:0001892.label: specification of data to be generated in an investigation
OBI:0001892.definition: An objective specification which indicates the type of data that will be generated and submitted to a database.

OBI:0000963.label: categorical label
OBI:0000963.definition: A label that is part of a categorical datum and that indicates the value of the data item on the categorical scale.

IAO:0000003.label: measurement unit label
IAO:0000003.definition: A measurement unit label is as a label that is part of a scalar measurement datum and denotes a unit of measure.

OBI:0000713.label: GenePattern software
OBI:0000713.definition: a software that provides access to more than 100 tools for gene expression analysis, proteomics, SNP analysis and common data processing tasks.

IAO:0000594.label: software application
IAO:0000594.definition: A software application is software that can be directly executed by some processing unit.

IAO:0000593.label: software library
IAO:0000593.definition: A software library is software composed of a collection of software modules and/or software methods in a form that can be statically or dynamically linked to some software application.

IAO:0000591.label: software method
IAO:0000591.definition: A software method (also called subroutine, subprogram, procedure, method, function, or routine) is software designed to execute a specific task.

IAO:0000592.label: software module
IAO:0000592.definition: A software module is software composed of a collection of software methods.

IAO:0000595.label: software script
IAO:0000595.definition:
A software script is software whose instructions can be executed using a software 
interpreter.

OBI:0001181.label: binding datum
OBI:0001181.definition: A data item that states if two or more material entities have the disposition to form a complex, and if so, how strong that disposition is.

OGMS:0000073.label: diagnosis
OGMS:0000073.definition: The representation of a conclusion of a diagnostic process.

OBI:0001939.label: genome coverage
OBI:0001939.definition: A data item that is the total number of bases in reads, divided by genome size, assumed to be the reference size (for instance of 3.10 Gb for human and 2.73 Gb for mouse) and refers to the percentage of the genome that is contained in the assembly based on size estimates; these are usually based on cytological techniques. Genome coverage of 90–95% is generally considered to be good, as most genomes contain a considerable fraction of repetitive regions that are difficult to sequence. So it is not a cause for concern if the genome coverage of an assembly is a bit less than 100%.

OBI:0000679.label: average value
OBI:0000679.definition: A  data item that is produced as the output of an averaging data transformation and represents the average value of the input data.

IAO:0000400.label: cartesian spatial coordinate datum
IAO:0000400.definition: A cartesian spatial coordinate datum is a representation of a point in a spatial region, in which equal changes in the magnitude of a coordinate value denote length qualities with the same magnitude

OBI:0000674.label: center value
OBI:0000674.definition: A data item that is produced as the output of a center calculation data transformation and represents the center value of the input data.

IAO:0000102.label: data about an ontology part
IAO:0000102.definition: data about an ontology part is a data item about a part of an ontology, for example a term

IAO:0000100.label: data set
IAO:0000100.definition: A data item that is an aggregate of other data items of the same type that have something in common. Averages and distributions can be determined for data sets.

OBI:0002471.label: date process started
OBI:0002471.definition: A data item that is the date when a process was initiated.

OBI:0001404.label: genetic characteristics information
OBI:0001404.definition: a data item that is about genetic material including polymorphisms, disease alleles, and haplotypes.

IAO:0000109.label: measurement datum
IAO:0000109.definition: A measurement datum is an information content entity that is a recording of the output of a measurement such as produced by a device.

OBI:0002475.label: number of PCR cycles during library construction
OBI:0002475.definition: A data item that is the number of PCR cycles used during the construction of a sequencing library.

OBI:0001873.label: number of errors
OBI:0001873.definition: a data item that is the number of times that a given process failed, as an integer

OBI:0002476.label: number of rounds of amplification
OBI:0002476.definition: A data item that is the number of times an amplification reaction happened.

OBI:0001968.label: operational taxonomic unit matrix
OBI:0001968.definition: Operational Taxonomic Unit matrix  is a data item, organized as a table, where organismal taxonomic units, computed by sequence analysis and genetic distance calculation, are counted in a set of biological or environmental samples. The table is  used to appraise biodiversity of a population or community of living organism.

OBI:0302867.label: predicted data item
OBI:0302867.definition: A data item that was generated on the basis of a calculation or logical reasoning

OBI:0000071.label: quantitative confidence value
OBI:0000071.definition: A data item which is used to indicate the degree of uncertainty about a measurement.

IAO:0000140.label: setting datum
IAO:0000140.definition: A settings datum is a datum that denotes some configuration of an instrument.

OBI:0002483.label: spike-in dilution factor
OBI:0002483.definition: A data item that indicates the dilution of spike-in added to a specimen.

IAO:0000577.label: centrally registered identifier symbol
IAO:0000577.definition: A symbol that is part of a CRID and that is sufficient to look up a record from the CRID's registry.

IAO:0000132.label: lot number
IAO:0000132.definition: A lot number is an information content entity which is an identical sequence of character borne by part of manufactured product or its packaging for each instances of a product class in a discrete batch of an item. Lot numbers are usually assigned to each separate production run of an item. Manufacturing as a lot might be due to a variety of reasons, for example,  a single process during which many individuals are made from the same portion of source material. Lot numbers can be encoded in a pattern  of other information objects, such as bar codes, numerals, or patterns of dots.

IAO:0000017.label: model number
IAO:0000017.definition: A model number is an information content entity specifically borne by catalogs, design specifications, advertising materials, inventory systems and similar  that is about manufactured objects of the same class. The model number is an alternative term for the class. The manufactered objects may or may not also bear the model number. Model numbers can be encoded in a variety of other information objects, such as bar codes, numerals, or patterns of dots.

IAO:0000029.label: numeral
IAO:0000029.definition: A symbol that denotes a number.

IAO:0000131.label: serial number
IAO:0000131.definition: A serial number is an information content entity which is a unique sequence of characters borne by part of manufactured product or its packaging that is assigned to each individual in some class of products, and so can serve as a way to identify an individual product within the class. Serial numbers can be encoded in a variety of other information objects, such as bar codes, numerals, or patterns of dots.

IAO:0000129.label: version number
IAO:0000129.definition: A version number is an information content entity which is a sequence of characters borne by part of each of a class of manufactured products or its packaging and indicates its order within a set of other products having the same name.

IAO:0000031.label: integer numeral
IAO:0000031.definition: a numeral that denotes an integer

OGMS:0000015.label: clinical history
OGMS:0000015.definition: A series of statements representing health-relevant qualities of a patient and of a patient's family.

OBI:0001909.label: conclusion based on data
OBI:0001909.definition: An information content entity that is inferred from data.

OBI:0002415.label: exposure to environmental and workplace carcinogens history
OBI:0002415.definition: A information content entity that indicates the exposure of an individual to carcinogens in the workplace or environment.

OBI:0002401.label: hormonal birth control use history
OBI:0002401.definition: An information content entity that indicates whether a woman has ever used oral contraceptives in order to block ovulation and prevent the occurrence of pregnancy.

OBI:0002422.label: indicator of whether all inclusion criteria were met
OBI:0002422.definition: An information content entity  that indicates whether or not  an entity  has met all specific requirements in order to take part in a given process.

OBI:0002421.label: indicator of whether an inclusion criterion was met
OBI:0002421.definition: An information content entity that indicates whether or not  an entity has met a specific requirement in order to take part in a given process.

OBI:0002410.label: menopausal status
OBI:0002410.definition: An information content entity that indicates the state of a female's cessation of menstruation.

OBI:0001934.label: predicted value
OBI:0001934.definition: an information content entity that has been generated by a prediction process in which an estimate of a value of an entity is made which can be measured but without performing such a measurement. The value specification is intended to be close to the value a measurement process would produce modulo a prediction error.

OBI:0002199.label: reason for lack of data item
OBI:0002199.definition: An information content entity that provides an explanation why a data item is not provided.

OBI:0000852.label: record of missing knowledge
OBI:0000852.definition: a information content entity created to indicate that information about something is not available to the person recording it.

OBI:0001908.label: testable hypothesis
OBI:0001908.definition: An information content entity that expresses an assertion that is intended to be tested.

OBI:0001933.label: value specification
OBI:0001933.definition: An information content entity that specifies a value within a classification scheme or on a quantitative scale.

OBI:0000210.label: analytical cytology data file
OBI:0000210.definition: A digital entity intended to capture data in analytical cytology domain.

IAO:0000578.label: centrally registered identifier
IAO:0000578.definition: An information content entity that consists of a CRID symbol and additional information about the CRID registry to which it belongs.

OBI:0302840.label: curated information
OBI:0302840.definition: A information content entity that has undergone a digital curation performed by a curator for accuracy checks and compliance with curation requirements. Information which has been assessed for accuracy by domain experts.

IAO:0000027.label: data item
IAO:0000027.definition: a data item is an information content entity that is intended to be a truthful statement about something (modulo, e.g., measurement precision or other systematic errors) and is constructed/acquired by a method which reliably tends to produce (approximately) truthful statements.

IAO:0000009.label: datum label
IAO:0000009.definition: A label is a symbol that is part of some other datum and is used to either partially define  the denotation of that datum or to provide a means for identifying the datum as a member of the set of data with the same label

IAO:0000033.label: directive information entity
IAO:0000033.definition: An information content entity whose concretizations indicate to their bearer how to realize them in a process.

IAO:0000310.label: document
IAO:0000310.definition: A collection of information content entities intended to be understood together as a whole

IAO:0000314.label: document part
IAO:0000314.definition: an information content entity that is part of a document

OBI:0000078.label: eMedical record
OBI:0000078.definition: An eMedical record is a digital document derived from a computer system used primarily for patient care in a clinical setting.  Not required to be compliant with requirements of 21 CFR Part 11.

OBI:0000158.label: eSource document
OBI:0000158.definition: an eSource document is a digital document consisting of a logical collection of Source data and other eSource documents that can be presented in an ordered way and capture the time of completion, change, and any signatures

OBI:0000167.label: electronic case report form
OBI:0000167.definition: An electronic case report form is a digital document used to record all of the protocol required information to be reported for each trial subject. An eCRF has the property that it can be audited and compliant with requirements of 21 CFR Part 11.

OBI:0000083.label: electronic case report tabulation
OBI:0000083.definition: An electronic case report tabulation is a digital document containing tabular data about multiple trial participants which is part of a clinical regulatory submission.  An eCRT has the property that it can be audited and compliant with requirements of 21 CFR Part 11  and has format suited to review by regulators.

IAO:0000308.label: figure
IAO:0000308.definition: An information content entity consisting of a two dimensional arrangement of information content entities such that the arrangement itself is about something.

OBI:0000213.label: fluorescence compensation matrix
OBI:0000213.definition: A fluorescence compensation matrix is a square matrix which is used as the left multiplier of the vector of fluorescence values while performing digital fluorescence compensation. Also, fluorescence compensation matrix is the inverse of the fluorescence spillover matrix.

OBI:0000021.label: list-mode data file
OBI:0000021.definition: A list-mode data file is a binary digital entity where events are stored sequentially, parameter by parameter.

IAO:0000006.label: narrative object
IAO:0000006.definition: A narrative object is an information content entity that is a set of propositions.

IAO:0000028.label: symbol
IAO:0000028.definition: An information content entity that is a mark(s) or character(s) used as a conventional representation of another entity.

IAO:0000300.label: textual entity
IAO:0000300.definition: A textual entity is a part of a manifestation (FRBR sense), a generically dependent continuant whose concretizations are patterns of glyphs intended to be interpreted as words, formulas, etc.

OBI:0302838.label: validated information
OBI:0302838.definition: an information content entity which results from a validation process aimed at confirming a claim, a finding or a predicted information entity about a material entity or a process by experimental means.

OBI:0001180.label: half maximal effective concentration (EC50)
OBI:0001180.definition: half maximal effective concentration (EC50) is a scalar measurement datum corresponding to the concentration of a compound which induces a response halfway between the baseline and maximum after some specified exposure time.

OBI:0001191.label: half maximal inhibitory concentration (IC50)
OBI:0001191.definition: Half maximal inhibitory concentration (IC50) is a scalar measurement datum that measures the effectiveness of a compound to competitively inhibit a given process, and corresponds to the concentration of the compound at which it reaches half of its maximum inhibitory effect.

OBI:0001514.label: minimal inhibitory concentration
OBI:0001514.definition: A scalar measurement datum that indicates the lowest concentration at which a specific compound significantly inhibits a process from occurring compared to in the absence of the compound.

OBI:0001554.label: rate measurement datum
OBI:0001554.definition: A scalar measurement datum that represents the number of events occuring over a time interval

OBI:0000970.label: scalar score from composite inputs
OBI:0000970.definition: A measurement datum which is the result of combining multiple datum. For example, a mean or summary score.

OBI:0001940.label: N50
OBI:0001940.definition: the weighted median item size or N50 is a weighted median of the lengths of items, equal to the length of the longest item i such that the sum of the lengths of items greater than or equal in length to i is greater than or equal to half the length of all of the items. With regard to assemblies the items are typically contigs or scaffolds. It therefore denotes the ability of the software to create contigs and provides information about the resulting sequence assembly

IAO:0000408.label: length measurement datum
IAO:0000408.definition: A scalar measurement datum that is the result of measurement of length quality

IAO:0000414.label: mass measurement datum
IAO:0000414.definition: A scalar measurement datum that is the result of measurement of mass quality

OBI:0001874.label: random access memory size
OBI:0001874.definition: random access memory size is a scalar measurement datum which denotes the amount of physical memory know as random access memory present of a computer or required by a computational process or data transformation

OBI:0002480.label: sequencing library input quantity measurement datum
OBI:0002480.definition: A scalar measurement datum that indicates the amount of sequencing library used as input for a sequencer.

IAO:0000416.label: time measurement datum
IAO:0000416.definition: A scalar measurement datum that is the result of measuring a temporal interval

OBI:0000658.label: data representational model
OBI:0000658.definition: Data representational model is an information content entity of the  relationships between data items. A data representational model is encoded in a data format specification such as for cytoscape or biopax.

OBI:0000969.label: dose specification
OBI:0000969.definition: a directive information entity that describes the dose that will be administered to a target

IAO:0000007.label: action specification
IAO:0000007.definition: a directive information entity that describes an action the bearer will take

IAO:0000001.label: conditional specification
IAO:0000001.definition: a directive information entity that specifies what should happen if the trigger condition is fulfilled

IAO:0000098.label: data format specification
IAO:0000098.definition:
A data format specification is the information content borne by the document published defining the specification.
Example: The ISO document specifying what encompasses an XML document; The instructions in a XSD file

IAO:0000005.label: objective specification
IAO:0000005.definition: a directive information entity that describes an intended process endpoint. When part of a plan specification the concretization is realized in a planned process in which the bearer tries to effect the world so that the process endpoint is achieved.

IAO:0000104.label: plan specification
IAO:0000104.definition: A directive information entity with action specifications and objective specifications as parts that, when concretized, is realized in a process in which the bearer tries to achieve the objectives by taking the actions specified.

OBI:0001755.label: selection criterion
OBI:0001755.definition: A directive information entity which defines and states a principle of standard by which selection process may take place.

IAO:0000096.label: source code module
IAO:0000096.definition: A source code module is a directive information entity that specifies, using a programming language, some algorithm.

OBI:0000785.label: study design controlled variable
OBI:0000785.definition: Controlled variable specification  is a part of a study design. They are the entities that could vary, but are kept constant to prevent their influence on the effect of the independent variable on the dependent.

OBI:0000751.label: study design dependent variable
OBI:0000751.definition: dependent variable specification is part of a study design. The dependent variable is the event studied and expected to change when the independent variable varies.

OBI:0000750.label: study design independent variable
OBI:0000750.definition: a directive information entity that is part of a study design. Independent variables are entities whose values are selected to determine its relationship to an observed phenomenon (the dependent variable). In such an experiment, an attempt is made to find evidence that the values of the independent variable determine the values of the dependent variable (that which is being measured). The independent variable can be changed as required, and its values do not represent a problem requiring explanation in an analysis, but are taken simply as given. The dependent variable on the other hand, usually cannot be directly controlled

OBI:0001962.label: target gene specification
OBI:0001962.definition: is a directive information specifying a coding genomic region which is the focus of a planned process such as an assay, for instance in a environmental gene survey

OBI:0001963.label: target subfragment specification
OBI:0001963.definition: is a directive information specifying a genomic region, possibly located in a coding genomic region, which is the focus of a planned process such as an assay, for instance in a environmental gene survey

OBI:0000714.label: graph of vertices
OBI:0000714.definition: A construct that consists of many nodes connected with edges. The edges represent a relationship between the objects represented by the nodes.  A graph can be equivalently represented as a matrix.

IAO:0000181.label: Venn diagram
IAO:0000181.definition:
A Venn diagram is a report graph showing all hypothetically possible
logical relations between a finite collection of sets.

IAO:0000183.label: dendrogram
IAO:0000183.definition:
A dendrogram is a report graph which is a tree diagram
frequently used to illustrate the arrangement of the clusters produced by a
clustering algorithm.

IAO:0000079.label: density plot
IAO:0000079.definition: A density plot is a report graph which is a graphical representation of data where the tint of a particular pixel corresponds to some kind of function corresponding the the amount of data points relativelly with their distance from the the pixel.

IAO:0000037.label: dot plot
IAO:0000037.definition: A dot plot is a report graph which is a graphical representation of data where each data point is represented by a single dot placed on coordinates corresponding to data point values in particular dimensions.

IAO:0000180.label: heatmap
IAO:0000180.definition:
A heatmap is a report graph which is a graphical representation of data
where the values taken by a variable(s) are shown as colors in a
two-dimensional map.

IAO:0000179.label: histogram
IAO:0000179.definition:
A histogram is a report graph which is a statistical description of a
distribution in terms of occurrence frequencies of different event classes.

IAO:0000573.label: line graph
IAO:0000573.definition:
A line graph is a type of graph created by connecting a series of data
points together with a line.

IAO:0000184.label: scatter plot
IAO:0000184.definition: A scatterplot is a graph which uses Cartesian coordinates to display values for two variables for a set of data. The data is displayed as a collection of points, each having the value of one variable determining the position on the horizontal axis and the value of the other variable determining the position on the vertical axis.

OBI:0500023.label: compliance rule
OBI:0500023.definition: a compliance rule is a rule which ensures a compliance process occurs

OBI:0500022.label: stopping rule
OBI:0500022.definition: a stopping rule (criterion) is_a *rule* which causes a *stopping process* to happen

OBI:0002466.label: alignment counting algorithm
OBI:0002466.definition: An algorithm used to assign aligned sequence reads, resulting from a reference genome transcriptome alignment algorithm, to sequence features (e.g. genes or transcripts).

OBI:0002468.label: base calling algorithm
OBI:0002468.definition: An algorithm that assigns nucleotides to temporal or spatial peaks generated by a detector, such as peaks of light intensities generated by a DNA sequencer

OBI:0002478.label: reference genome-transcriptome alignment algorithm
OBI:0002478.definition: An algorithm that attempts to align a nucleic acid sequence to a reference genome and transcriptome.

OBI:0001625.label: sequence annotation algorithm
OBI:0001625.definition: An algorithm used to identify sequence features (e.g. protein coding regions) in the assembled contig sequence.  This may also include a description of any manual curation that may have generated or validated the annotation.

OBI:0001522.label: sequence assembly algorithm
OBI:0001522.definition: An algorithm used to assemble individual sequence reads into larger contiguous sequences (contigs).  Assembly details include but are not limited to assembler type (overlap-layout-consensus, deBruijn), assembler version, and any relevant quality control information such as per cent known genes/ESTs captured.

IAO:0000065.label: software interpreter
IAO:0000065.definition: A software interpreter is a software application that executes some specified input software.

OBI:1110300.label: direct submission to IEDB
OBI:1110300.definition: A report about experiments in an investigation that characterize immune epitopes, and was submitted directly by the authors to the Immune Epitope Database (IEDB)

OBI:0000218.label: investigation results report
OBI:0000218.definition: An investigation report is a report on the results of an investigation.

IAO:0000013.label: journal article
IAO:0000013.definition: a report that is published in a journal

OBI:0002461.label: BCL format
OBI:0002461.definition: A data format specification that is a binary file containing base calling data. These files are created by sequencing machines during the act of sequencing, and contain data about each of the nucleotide clusters on a sequencing flow cell.

OBI:0002584.label: differential expression analysis data
OBI:0002584.definition: The results of a differential expression analysis.

OBI:0002582.label: sequence library feature count data
OBI:0002582.definition: The results of a sequence data feature count tabulation.

OBI:0000660.label: background corrected data set
OBI:0000660.definition: A data set that is produced as the output of a background correction data transformation.

IAO:0000579.label: centrally registered identifier registry
IAO:0000579.definition: A CRID registry is a dataset of CRID records, each consisting of a CRID symbol and additional information which was recorded in the dataset through a assigning a centrally registered identifier process.

OBI:0000023.label: classified data set
OBI:0000023.definition: A data set that is produced as the output of a class prediction data transformation and consists of a data set with assigned class labels.
alternative_term: data set with assigned class labels

OBI:0000251.label: cluster
OBI:0000251.definition: A data set which is a subset of data that are a similar to each other in some way.

OBI:0000648.label: clustered data set
OBI:0000648.definition: A data set that is produced as the output of a class discovery data transformation and consists of a data set with assigned discovered class labels.
alternative_term: data set with assigned discovered class labels

OBI:0000649.label: data set of features
OBI:0000649.definition: A data set that is produced as the output of a descriptive statistical calculation data transformation and consists of producing a data set that represents one or more features of interest about the input data set.

OBI:0000656.label: data set of predicted values according to fitted curve
OBI:0000656.definition: A data set which is the output of a curve fitting data transformation in which the aim is to find a curve which matches a series of data points and possibly other constraints.

OBI:0000662.label: error corrected data set
OBI:0000662.definition: A data set that is produced as the output of an error correction data transformation and consists of producing a data set which has had erroneous contributions from the input to the data transformation removed (corrected for).

OBI:0000118.label: gene list
OBI:0000118.definition: A data set of the names or identifiers of genes that are the outcome of an analysis or have been put together for the purpose of an analysis.

OBI:0000451.label: normalized data set
OBI:0000451.definition: A data set that is produced as the output of a normalization data transformation.

OBI:0000676.label: reduced dimension data set
OBI:0000676.definition: A data set that is produced as the output of a data vector reduction data transformation and consists of producing a data set which has fewer vectors than the input data set.

IAO:0000584.label: time sampled measurement data set
IAO:0000584.definition: A data set that is an aggregate of data recording some measurement at a number of time points. The time series data set is an ordered list of pairs of time measurement data and the corresponding measurement data acquired at that time.

IAO:0000185.label: photograph
IAO:0000185.definition: A photograph is created by projecting an image onto a photosensitive surface such as a chemically treated plate or film, CCD receptor, etc.

IAO:0000409.label: denotator type
IAO:0000409.definition: A denotator type indicates how a term should be interpreted from an ontological perspective.

IAO:0000078.label: curation status specification
IAO:0000078.definition: The curation status of the term. The allowed values come from an enumerated list of predefined terms. See the specification of these instances for more detailed definitions of each enumerated value.

IAO:0000225.label: obsolescence reason specification
IAO:0000225.definition: The reason for which a term has been deprecated. The allowed values come from an enumerated list of predefined terms. See the specification of these instances for more detailed definitions of each enumerated value.

OBI:0001961.label: PCR program
OBI:0001961.definition: a PCR program is a plan specification which is executed during a polymerase chain reaction (PCR) by a thermocycler instrument that will iterate through the changes in temperature and duration of each of the annealing, denaturation, elongation steps for as many times as specified by the program.

IAO:0000064.label: algorithm
IAO:0000064.definition: A plan specification which describes the inputs and output of mathematical functions as well as workflow of execution for achieving an predefined objective. Algorithms are realized usually by means of implementation as computer programs for execution by automata.

OBI:0001636.label: grant
OBI:0001636.definition: A plan specification of organization A to give money to organization B so that B conducts investigations. Organization A has funder role and Organization B has research organization role.

OBI:0001896.label: investigation assay specification
OBI:0001896.definition: A plan specification which indicates the assay type used to obtain data.

IAO:0000025.label: programming language
IAO:0000025.definition: A language in which source code is written that is intended to be executed/run by a software interpreter. Programming languages are ways to write instructions that specify what to do, and sometimes, how to do it.

OBI:0000272.label: protocol
OBI:0000272.definition: A plan specification which has sufficient level of detail and quantitative information to communicate it between investigation agents, so that different investigation agents will reliably be able to independently reproduce the process.

IAO:0000010.label: software
IAO:0000010.definition:
Software is a plan specification composed of a series of instructions that can be 
interpreted by or directly executed by a processing unit.

OBI:0001943.label: software pipeline
OBI:0001943.definition: A plan specification that specifies a chain encoded in software of processing elements (processes, threads, coroutines, etc.), arranged so that the output of each element is the input of the next. Usually some amount of buffering is provided between consecutive elements.

OBI:0001884.label: specimen-based scope of investigation specification
OBI:0001884.definition: A plan specification which specifies the scope of an investigation based on the heterogeneity of organisms or type of material that are the specified input of specimen collection.

OBI:0500000.label: study design
OBI:0500000.definition: A plan specification comprised of protocols (which may specify how and what kinds of data will be gathered) that are executed as part of an investigation and is realized during a study design execution.

OBI:0001899.label: target capture specification
OBI:0001899.definition: A plan specification which specifies how the material enrichment procedure will influence the scale, or type of material that will be assayed in the specimen.

OBI:0001882.label: target material in specimen specification
OBI:0001882.definition: A plan specification which specifies the type of material that will be assayed in an investigation.

OBI:0001155.label: 3D structural organization datum
OBI:0001155.definition: A measurement datum that describes the structural orientation of a material entity in 3D space.

OBI:0000938.label: categorical measurement datum
OBI:0000938.definition: A measurement datum that is reported on a categorical scale

OBI:0000984.label: dose
OBI:0000984.definition: A measurement datum that measures the quantity of something that may be administered to an organism or that an organism may be exposed to. Quantities of nutrients, drugs, vaccines and toxins are referred to as doses.

OBI:0002395.label: number of live births
OBI:0002395.definition: A measurement datum of the total number of live births a female has had.

OBI:0002394.label: number of pregnancies
OBI:0002394.definition: A measurement datum of the total number of pregnancies a woman has had.

OBI:0000801.label: spike train datum
OBI:0000801.definition: A measurement datum which represents information about an ordered series of action potentials in an organism's CNS measured over time.

OBI:0000789.label: survival rate
OBI:0000789.definition: A measurement data that represents the percentage of people or animals in a study or treatment group who are alive for a given period of time after diagnosis or initiation of monitoring.

OBI:0000010.label: fluorescent reporter intensity
OBI:0000010.definition: A measurement datum that represents the output of a scanner measuring the intensity value for each fluorescent reporter.

OBI:0001620.label: latitude coordinate measurement datum
OBI:0001620.definition: A measurement datum that is the measure of the latitude coordinate of a site.

OBI:0001621.label: longitude coordinate measurement datum
OBI:0001621.definition: A measurement datum that is the measure of the longitude coordinate of a site.

OBI:0000101.label: measured expression level
OBI:0000101.definition: A measurement datum that is the outcome of the quantification of an assay for the activity of a gene, or the number of RNA transcripts.

OBI:0000269.label: number of lost events computer
OBI:0000269.definition: A measurement datum recording the number of measurement events lost due to overloading of the analysis chip in a flow cytometer instrument. The datum has a qualitative role

OBI:0000125.label: number of lost events electronic
OBI:0000125.definition: A measurement datum measuring the number of analysis events lost due to errors in data acquisition electronic coincidence in a flow cytometer instrument. The datum has a qualitative role.

OBI:0000119.label: number of particles in subset
OBI:0000119.definition: A measurement datum measuring the number of subjects in a defined subset in a flow cytometer instrument. The datum has a qualitative role

OBI:0000172.label: parameter threshold
OBI:0000172.definition: A measurement datum measuring the minimal signal that must be detected to generate an electrical event, as compared to the maximal detected signal in a flow cytometer instrument. The datum has a qualitative role

OBI:0000054.label: ratio of collected to emitted light
OBI:0000054.definition: A measurement datum measuring the amount of light collected s compared to the total amount of emitted light in the detector component of a flow cytometer instrument. The datum has a qualitative role

IAO:0000032.label: scalar measurement datum
IAO:0000032.definition: a scalar measurement datum is a measurement datum that is composed of two parts, numerals and a unit label.

OBI:0000973.label: sequence data
OBI:0000973.definition: A measurement datum that representing the primary structure of a macromolecule(it's sequence) sometimes associated with an indicator of confidence of that measurement.

OBI:0002479.label: sequence read length measurement datum
OBI:0002479.definition: A measurement datum that is the result of the measurement of the number of bases in a DNA or RNA sequence.

OBI:0002482.label: specimen harvest quantity
OBI:0002482.definition: A scalar measurement datum that indicates the amount of specimen collected.

IAO:0000186.label: photographic print
IAO:0000186.definition: A photographic print is a material entity upon which a photograph generically depends.

OBI:0001877.label: random access memory
OBI:0001877.definition: Random-access memory (RAM) is a form of computer data storage. A random-access device allows stored data to be accessed directly in any random order. In contrast, other data storage media such as hard disks, CDs, DVDs and magnetic tape, as well as early primary memory types such as drum memory, read and write data only in a predetermined order, consecutively, because of mechanical design limitations. Therefore, the time to access a given data location varies significantly depending on its physical location

IAO:0000605.label: abbreviation textual entity
IAO:0000605.definition: A textual entity listing abbreviations and their expansions that are used in a document.

IAO:0000608.label: author information textual entity
IAO:0000608.definition: A textual entity expression information about an author of a document. This information may include biographical information and may discuss how the authors' professional experiences are relevant to the work described in the document.

IAO:0000610.label: author summary textual entity
IAO:0000610.definition: A textual entity, distinct from the abstract, that describes the significance and broader context of the document content. The author summary is often written in a non-technical manner and is aimed at both scientists and non-scientist readers, e.g as described in the article submission guidelines for PLoS Genetics (http://journals.plos.org/plosgenetics/s/submission-guidelines).

IAO:0000612.label: availability textual entity
IAO:0000612.definition: A textual entity expressing the location of a resource, e.g. software, or the manner in which a resource can be obtained.

IAO:0000304.label: caption
IAO:0000304.definition: A textual entity that describes a figure

IAO:0000614.label: case report textual entity
IAO:0000614.definition: A textual entity that expresses a detailed account of a portion of the medical history for a specific patient.

IAO:0000301.label: citation
IAO:0000301.definition: a textual entity intended to identify a particular publication

OBI:0001898.label: comment on investigation
OBI:0001898.definition: A textual entity that is about any of the aspects of an investigation worth noting

IAO:0000144.label: conclusion textual entity
IAO:0000144.definition: A textual entity that expresses the results of reasoning about a problem, for instance as typically found towards the end of scientific papers.

IAO:0000617.label: conflict of interest textual entity
IAO:0000617.definition: A textual entity that expresses a situation involving one or more of the authors, or the funding source of a document whereby the authors or funding source stand to potentially gain (typically financially) from the results reported in the document.

IAO:0000619.label: consent textual entity
IAO:0000619.definition: A textual entity that documents the consenting process used to enroll patients in a study.

OBI:0001627.label: country name
OBI:0001627.definition: A textual entity that denotes a geographic location that is a site or part of a site that is identified as a country in the political geography.

OBI:0000075.label: diagnosis textual entity
OBI:0000075.definition: diagnosis is an assessment of a disease or injury, its likely prognosis and treatment.

IAO:0000305.label: document title
IAO:0000305.definition: A textual entity that names a document

IAO:0000621.label: ethical approval textual entity
IAO:0000621.definition: A textual entity that documents the ethical approval of some study design.

IAO:0000624.label: funding source declaration textual entity
IAO:0000624.definition: A textual entity documenting the source of funding that supported some study.

IAO:0000626.label: future directions textual entity
IAO:0000626.definition: A textual entity expressing ideas regarding future work relevant to work described in a document that could be done.

IAO:0000628.label: genome announcement textual entity
IAO:0000628.definition: A textual entity that describes the generation and public release of a novel, draft genome sequence.

IAO:0000415.label: hypothesis textual entity
IAO:0000415.definition: A textual entity that expresses an assertion that is intended to be tested.

IAO:0000303.label: institutional identification
IAO:0000303.definition: A textual entity intended to identify a particular institution

OBI:0001615.label: investigation description
OBI:0001615.definition: A textual entity that describes an investigation.

OBI:0001622.label: investigation title
OBI:0001622.definition: A textual entity that denotes an investigation.

IAO:0000629.label: keyword textual entity
IAO:0000629.definition: A textual entity listing keywords indicating the major theme(s) of a document.

IAO:0000636.label: patients textual entity
IAO:0000636.definition: A textual entity expressing information regarding the patients used in a study.

IAO:0000422.label: postal address
IAO:0000422.definition: A textual entity that is used as directive to deliver something to a person, or organization

IAO:0000638.label: pre-publication history textual entity
IAO:0000638.definition: A textual entity that expresses the pre-publication history (submission dates, reviewer comments, etc) for a document, often including a hyperlink to a web page detailing the information.

IAO:0000640.label: related work textual entity
IAO:0000640.definition: A textual entity that discusses work from other publications and expresses their relevancy to the content of a document.

IAO:0000642.label: requirements textual entity
IAO:0000642.definition: A textual entity that expresses the requirements necessary to use a resource, e.g. software.

OBI:0001948.label: sequence assembly name
OBI:0001948.definition: A textual entity that is used to denote a sequence assembly.

IAO:0000643.label: statistical analysis textual entity
IAO:0000643.definition: A textual entity documenting statistical analysis tools and techniques employed.

IAO:0000632.label: study limitations textual entity
IAO:0000632.definition: A textual entity addressing a shortcoming or bias of a study design or execution.

IAO:0000306.label: table
IAO:0000306.definition: A textual entity that contains a two-dimensional arrangement of texts repeated at regular intervals across a spatial range, such that the spatial relationships among the constituent texts expresses propositions

IAO:0000590.label: written name
IAO:0000590.definition: A textual entity that denotes a particular in reality.

IAO:0000329.label: running title
IAO:0000329.definition: A shorter version of a document title

IAO:0000307.label: table of abbreviations
IAO:0000307.definition: A table where the constituent texts are abbreviations and their expansions

IAO:0000327.label: table of contents
IAO:0000327.definition: A table that relates document parts to specific locations in a document (usually page numbers).  This is also a document part (subsumption there should be inferred).

IAO:0000328.label: table of figures
IAO:0000328.definition: A table that relates figures in a document to specific locations in that document (usually page numbers).  This is also a document part (subsumption there should be inferred).

IAO:0000309.label: diagram
IAO:0000309.definition: A figure that expresses one or more propositions

IAO:0000101.label: image
IAO:0000101.definition: An image is an affine projection to a two dimensional surface, of measurements of some quality of an entity or entities repeated at regular intervals across a spatial range, where the measurements are represented as color and luminosity on the projected on surface.

IAO:0000038.label: graph
IAO:0000038.definition: A diagram that presents one or more tuples of information by mapping those tuples in to a two dimensional space in a non arbitrary way.

OBI:0001000.label: questionnaire
OBI:0001000.definition: A document with a set of printed or written questions with a choice of answers, devised for the purposes of a survey or statistical study.

OBI:0302874.label: edited document
OBI:0302874.definition: A document which is the output of a document editing process

IAO:0000313.label: patent
IAO:0000313.definition: A document that has been accepted by a patent authority

IAO:0000311.label: publication
IAO:0000311.definition: A document that has been accepted by a publisher

IAO:0000088.label: report
