IAO:0000088.definition: a document assembled by an author for the purpose of providing information for the audience. A report is the output of a documenting process and has the objective to be consumed by a specific audience. Topic of the report is on something that has completed. A report is not a single figure. Examples of reports are journal article, patent application, grant progress report, case report (not patient record)

IAO:0000312.label: publication about an investigation
IAO:0000312.definition: A publication that is about an investigation

IAO:0000606.label: abbreviations section
IAO:0000606.definition: A part of a document where abbreviations and their long-forms used within the document are listed.

IAO:0000315.label: abstract
IAO:0000315.definition: A summary of the entire document that is substantially smaller than the document it summarizes.  It is about the document it summarizes.

IAO:0000324.label: acknowledgements section
IAO:0000324.definition: Part of a publication that is about the contributions of people or institutions other than the authors.

IAO:0000323.label: author contributions section
IAO:0000323.definition: A part of a publication that is about the specific contributions of each author

IAO:0000607.label: author information section
IAO:0000607.definition: A part of a document about the authors that provides biographical information and may discuss how the authors' professional experiences are relevant to the work described in the document.

IAO:0000321.label: author list
IAO:0000321.definition: part of a document that enumerates the authors of the document

IAO:0000609.label: author summary section
IAO:0000609.definition: A part of a document, distinct from the abstract, that describes the significance and broader context of the document content. The author summary is often written in a non-technical manner and is aimed at both scientists and non-scientist readers.

IAO:0000611.label: availability section
IAO:0000611.definition: A part of a document about a resource described in the document, e.g. software, that describes where and/or how that resource can be obtained.

IAO:0000613.label: case report section
IAO:0000613.definition: A part of a document about the medical history of a specific patient as it relates to the topic of the document.

IAO:0000615.label: conclusion section
IAO:0000615.definition: A part of a document used to summarize the findings discussed in the document. The conclusion section is typically found near the end of a document.

IAO:0000616.label: conflict of interest section
IAO:0000616.definition: A part of a document used to declare any competing interests regarding the authors and/or funding organization for the work described in the document.
alternative_term: disclosure of potential conflicts of interest

IAO:0000618.label: consent section
IAO:0000618.definition: A part of a document about the consent process that was used to enroll patients in a study.

IAO:0000330.label: copyright section
IAO:0000330.definition: A document part that describes  legal restrictions on making or distributing copies of the document

IAO:0000319.label: discussion section of a publication about an investigation
IAO:0000319.definition: A part of a publication about an investigation that is about the study interpretation of the investigation

IAO:0000620.label: ethical approval section
IAO:0000620.definition: A part of a document about the governance body responsible for approving the work discussed in a document on an ethical basis.

IAO:0000622.label: figures section
IAO:0000622.definition: A part of a document that contains one or more figures.

IAO:0000325.label: footnote
IAO:0000325.definition: A part of a document that is about a specific other part of the document.  Usually footnotes are spatially segregated from the rest of the document.

IAO:0000623.label: funding source declaration section
IAO:0000623.definition: A part of a document used to detail information regarding the source of funding used in support of the generation of the document content.

IAO:0000625.label: future directions section
IAO:0000625.definition: A part of a document detailing extensions of the described work that may be implemented at some future point in time.

IAO:0000627.label: genome announcement section
IAO:0000627.definition: A document part announcing the publication of a novel draft genome sequence.

IAO:0000322.label: institution list
IAO:0000322.definition: part of a document that has parts that are institution identifications associated with the authors of the document

IAO:0000316.label: introduction to a publication about an investigation
IAO:0000316.definition: A part of a publication about an investigation that is about the objective specification (why the investigation is being done)

IAO:0000630.label: keywords section
IAO:0000630.definition: A part of a document where keywords selected by the author to categorize the major theme(s) of a document are listed.

IAO:0000633.label: materials section
IAO:0000633.definition: A part of a document about the materials required to reproduce the content of the document.

IAO:0000317.label: methods section
IAO:0000317.definition: A part of a publication about an investigation that is about the study design of the investigation

IAO:0000634.label: notes section
IAO:0000634.definition: A part of a document containing typically short notes about the document itself and/or the authors. Often the notes section contains subsections related to funding, competing interests, ethical approval, etc.

IAO:0000635.label: patients section
IAO:0000635.definition: A part of a document about the patients that participated in a study.

IAO:0000637.label: pre-publication history section
IAO:0000637.definition: A part of the document about the publication history of a document. This section typically details dates of document submission to a journal and dates of any re-submissions as well as reviewer comments and responses to reviewers by the authors.

IAO:0000320.label: references section
IAO:0000320.definition: A part of a document that has citations as parts

IAO:0000639.label: related work section
IAO:0000639.definition: A part of a document about work in other publications that is relevant to the content of the document.

IAO:0000641.label: requirements section
IAO:0000641.definition: A part of a document about a resource described in the document, e.g. software, that describes the requirements necessary to use the resource, e.g. operating systems, hardware, etc. in the case of a software resource.

IAO:0000318.label: results section
IAO:0000318.definition: A part of a publication about an investigation that is about a study design execution

IAO:0000644.label: statistical analysis section
IAO:0000644.definition: A part of the document used to describe the statistical methodologies employed in the work presented in the document.

IAO:0000631.label: study limitations section
IAO:0000631.definition: A part of a document about biases or short comings related to the study design and execution.

IAO:0000326.label: supplementary material to a document
IAO:0000326.definition: part of a document that is segregated from the rest of the document due to its size

IAO:0000645.label: tables section
IAO:0000645.definition: A part of a document that contains one or more tables.

IAO:0000401.label: one dimensional cartesian spatial coordinate datum
IAO:0000401.definition: A cartesion spatial coordinate datum that  uses one value to specify a position along a one dimensional spatial region

IAO:0000403.label: three dimensional cartesian spatial coordinate datum
IAO:0000403.definition: A cartesion spatial coordinate datum that  uses three values to specify a position within a three dimensional spatial region

IAO:0000402.label: two dimensional cartesian spatial coordinate datum
IAO:0000402.definition: A cartesion spatial coordinate datum that  uses two values to specify a position within a two dimensional spatial region

OBI:0002197.label: tissue section thickness
OBI:0002197.definition: A length measurement datum that is the result of an assay measuring the thickness of a tissue section.

OBI:0001171.label: half life datum (t 1/2)
OBI:0001171.definition: The time it takes for 50% of a class of stochastic processes to occur.

OBI:0001167.label: age measurement datum
OBI:0001167.definition: A time measurement datum that is the result of measurement of age of an organism

OBI:0001913.label: computation run time
OBI:0001913.definition: computation run time is a time measurement datum which corresponds the time expressed in second, minute, hour necessary for a computer program to complete a process execution, for example genome assembly. It is an important metrics as it indicates the resource occupancy and computer program efficiency.

OBI:0001508.label: sampling time measurement datum
OBI:0001508.definition: A time measurement datum when an observation is made or a sample is taken from a material as measured from some reference point.

OBI:0001619.label: specimen collection time measurement datum
OBI:0001619.definition: A time measurement datum that is the measure of the time when the specimens are collected.

OBI:0001887.label: email address of Bioinformatics Resource Center contact person
OBI:0001887.definition: An email address of the person who is contact representative of a Bioinformatics Resource Center

OBI:0001894.label: email address of sequencing facility contact person
OBI:0001894.definition: An email address of the contact representative at the sequencing facility

OBI:0001890.label: email address of specimen collector
OBI:0001890.definition: An email address of the person collecting the specimen

OBI:0001903.label: email address of specimen provider principal investigator
OBI:0001903.definition: An email address of the principal investigator providing the specimens for the investigation

OBI:0000227.label: data encoding
OBI:0000227.definition: a documenting process to encode an information entity into a digital document

OBI:0302914.label: digital curation
OBI:0302914.definition: Digital curation is the process of establishing and developing long term repositories of digital assets for current and future reference by researchers, scientists, and historians, and scholars generally.

OBI:0001172.label: dose response curve
OBI:0001172.definition: A data item of paired values, one indicating the dose of a material, the other quantitating a measured effect at that dose. The dosing intervals are chosen so that effect values be interpolated by a plotting a curve.

OBI:0000889.label: survival curve
OBI:0000889.definition: A survival curve is a report graph which is a graphical representation of data where the percentage of survival is plotted as a function of time.

OBI:0001614.label: GenBank ID
OBI:0001614.definition: A CRID symbol uniquely indentifies the submitted GeneBank sequence record.

OBI:0001617.label: PubMed ID
OBI:0001617.definition: A CRID symbol that is sufficient to look up a citation from the PubMed, a literature database of life sciences and biomedical information.

OBI:0002464.label: SRS identifier
OBI:0002464.definition: An accession number that applies to a database record for an individual sample object in an NCBI Sequence Read Archive (SRA) submission. These records are imported from the NCBI BioSample database.

OBI:0002191.label: courier tracking number
OBI:0002191.definition: A centrally registered identifier symbol assigned by a courier organization in order to track the delivery of an item.

OBI:0002472.label: dbGaP study identifier
OBI:0002472.definition: A central registered identifier symbol that denotes a specific study in dbGaP.

OBI:0002110.label: digital object identifier
OBI:0002110.definition: A centrally registered identifier symbol used to uniquely identify objects given by International DOI Foundation. The DOI system is particularly used for electronic documents such as journal articles.

OBI:0001629.label: grant identifier
OBI:0001629.definition: A CRID symbol used to identify a grant.

OBI:0001141.label: individual organism identifier
OBI:0001141.definition: a CRID symbol used to distinguish one individual organism from another.

OBI:0001628.label: investigation identifier
OBI:0001628.definition: A CRID symbol used to identify an investigation.

OBI:0001616.label: specimen identifier
OBI:0001616.definition: A CRID symbol denotes a specimen and used to distinguish one specimen from another in an investigation.

IAO:0000302.label: author identification
IAO:0000302.definition: A textual entity intended to identify a particular author

OBI:0002467.label: alignment counting application
OBI:0002467.definition: A software application that implements an alignment counting algorithm, used to count the overlap of aligned sequencing reads with genes.

OBI:0002469.label: base calling application
OBI:0002469.definition: A base-calling application that implments a base-calling algorithm to convert BCL (binary base call) files, (e.g., those generated by Illumina sequencing systems) to standard FASTQ file formats for downstream analysis.

OBI:0001883.label: Bioinformatics Resource Center contact person
OBI:0001883.definition: A person who is the contact representative of a Bioinformatics Resource Center

OBI:0001888.label: sequencing facility contact person
OBI:0001888.definition: A person who is the contact representative at the sequencing facility

OBI:0001895.label: specimen collector
OBI:0001895.definition: A person who collects the specimen

OBI:0001889.label: specimen provider principal investigator
OBI:0001889.definition: A person who is a principal investigator and provides the specimen

OBI:0000694.label: animal feeding
OBI:0000694.definition: animal feeding is a process in which animals are provided with food

OBI:0000818.label: calibration
OBI:0000818.definition: A planned process with the objective to establish the relationship between data produced by a measurement device and physical qualities. This is done by using the measurement device under defined conditions, and either tuning it to adjust the measured output, or record the output and use it as a reference in future measurements.

OBI:0001932.label: comparing prediction to measurement
OBI:0001932.definition: A planned process in which predicted values for some thing are compared to measured values for that thing.

IAO:0000443.label: data item extraction from journal article
IAO:0000443.definition: a planned process in which journal articles are read or processed and data items are extracted, typically for further analysis or indexing

OBI:0002201.label: determination if assay will provide reliable results
OBI:0002201.definition: A planned process that is used to assess whether an assay will provide reliable results based on the conditions or qualities of the inputs, devices, and other participants of the assay.

OBI:0001834.label: drawing a conclusion
OBI:0001834.definition: A planned process in which new information is inferred from existing information.

OBI:0001007.label: image creation
OBI:0001007.definition: A planned process that captures an image of an object.

OBI:0000810.label: informed consent process
OBI:0000810.definition: A planned process in which a person or their legal representative is informed about key facts about potential risks and benefits of a process and makes a documented decision as to whether the person in question will participate.

OBI:0000804.label: informing investigator of subject study arm
OBI:0000804.definition: A process in which an investigator is made aware of which study arm that a patient is participating in, for example whether they are receiving a placebo or a treatment with an investigational compound.

OBI:0000842.label: informing subject of study arm
OBI:0000842.definition: A process in which the subject is made aware of which study arm they are participating in, for example whether they are receiving a placebo or a treatment with an investigational compound.

OBI:0000708.label: laboratory animal care
OBI:0000708.definition: a process that realizes an animal care protocol that specifies how animals are kept and maintained

OBI:0002587.label: machine learning
OBI:0002587.definition: A planned process in which statistical techniques are used to give computers the ability to learn about patterns in data, without being explicitly programmed.  Learning is defined in this case as progressively improving performance on a specific task.

OBI:0000838.label: material maintenance
OBI:0000838.definition: a process with that achieves the objective to maintain some or all of the characteristics of an input material over time

OBI:0600003.label: performing a clinical assessment
OBI:0600003.definition: A protocol application during which a series of tests are made of a patient leading to determination of disease state, or condition.

OBI:0000807.label: presentation of stimulus
OBI:0000807.definition: a planned process in which an organism is exposed to some stimulus with the intent to invoke an action

OBI:0001173.label: service
OBI:0001173.definition: A planned process in which a service provider performs a task (i.e. a planned process) for a service consumer.

OBI:0000659.label: specimen collection process
OBI:0000659.definition: A planned process with the objective of collecting a specimen.

OBI:0000471.label: study design execution
OBI:0000471.definition: a planned process that carries out a study design

OBI:0000931.label: study intervention
OBI:0000931.definition: the part of the execution of an intervention design study which is varied between two or more subjects in the study

OBI:0000841.label: subject agrees they understand informed consent document
OBI:0000841.definition: A process in which a subject receives an informed consent document and agrees that they have understood it

OBI:0000907.label: supplying
OBI:0000907.definition:
The planned process of providing material entities
to be used in an investigation.

OBI:0000939.label: training process
OBI:0000939.definition: a process that achieves a training objective

OGMS:0000090.label: treatment
OGMS:0000090.definition: A processual entity whose completion is hypothesized (by a healthcare provider) to alleviate the signs and symptoms associated with a disorder

OBI:0000826.label: treatment portion of study execution
OBI:0000826.definition: A planned process, part of a study design execution, during which the treatment of subjects is ongoing

OBI:0000840.label: unblinding process
OBI:0000840.definition: The part of the study execution in which the subjects are told what study arm they are in and in which the investigators are told which subjects are in which trials

OBI:0000070.label: assay
OBI:0000070.definition: A planned process with the objective to produce information about the material entity that is the evaluant, by physically examining it or its proxies.

IAO:0000574.label: assigning a centrally registered identifier
IAO:0000574.definition: a planned process in which a new CRID is created, associated with an entity, and stored in the CRID registry thereby registering it as being associated with some entity

IAO:0000575.label: associating information with a centrally registered identifier in its registry
IAO:0000575.definition: A planned process in which a CRID registry associates an information content entity with a CRID symbol
alternative_term: associating information with a CRID in the CRID registry

OBI:0200000.label: data transformation
OBI:0200000.definition: A planned process that produces output data from input data.

OBI:0200111.label: data visualization
OBI:0200111.definition: An planned process that creates images, diagrams or animations from the input data.

IAO:0000650.label: database extract, transform, and load process
IAO:0000650.definition: A planned process which takes as input a database and fills another database by extracting concretizations of information entities from the first, transforming them, and loading the transformed concretizations into the second.

OBI:0302908.label: document editing
OBI:0302908.definition: is a planned process with specified input original document and specified output edited document

IAO:0000572.label: documenting
IAO:0000572.definition: a planned process in which a document is created or added to by including the specified input in it.

OBI:0000338.label: drawing a conclusion based on data
OBI:0000338.definition: A planned process in which data gathered in an investigation is evaluated in the context of existing knowledge with the objective to generate more general conclusions or to conclude that the data does not allow one to draw general conclusion

OBI:0600009.label: exposure of material to environment
OBI:0600009.definition: a planned process in which an input material is exposed to a defined set of conditions in a controlled environment. The environment is a specified input.

OBI:0001953.label: freezing
OBI:0001953.definition: A planned process in which a material entity has it's temperature lowered to below the freezing point in order to bring it to a state in which it can be maintained at this lower temperature in order to preserve some of its qualities.

OBI:0600015.label: group assignment
OBI:0600015.definition: group assignment is a process which has an organism as specified input and during which a role is assigned

OBI:0000066.label: investigation
OBI:0000066.definition: a planned process that consists of parts: planning, study design execution, documentation and which produce conclusion(s).

IAO:0000580.label: looking up a centrally registered identifier
IAO:0000580.definition: A planned process in which a request to a CRID registry is made to return the information associated with a CRID symbol

OBI:0000094.label: material processing
OBI:0000094.definition: A planned process which results in physical changes in a specified input material

OBI:0302910.label: prediction
OBI:0302910.definition: a process by which an  event or an entity is described before it actually happens or is being discovered and identified.

OBI:0001928.label: selection
OBI:0001928.definition: A planned process which results in the creation of group of entity from a larger group by the application of predefined criteria.

OBI:0001944.label: sequence annotation
OBI:0001944.definition: A planned process that identifies and reports sequence features (e.g. protein coding regions) in sequence data.

OBI:0302911.label: validation
OBI:0302911.definition: a planned process with objective to check that the accuracy or the quality of a claim or prediction  satisfies some criteria and which is assessed by comparing with independent results

OBI:0000154.label: role of Institutional Review Board
OBI:0000154.definition: the role of a organization that is realized by members reviewing study designs for their agreement with regulations

OBI:0000089.label: role of regulator of chemical manufacturer
OBI:0000089.definition: a regulator involved with making and enforcing legislation and governmental orders relevant to chemical manufacture

OBI:0000273.label: role of regulator of consumables and medical devices
OBI:0000273.definition: a regulator involved with making and enforcing legislation and governmental orders relevant to the development, testing, manufacture and use of food, drugs and medical devices

OBI:0001969.label: biodiversity assessment objective
OBI:0001969.definition: biodiversity assessment objective is an objective of a planned process aimed at producing data item whose interpretation should provide insight about variety of biological species found in a biological sample at macroscopic or microscopic level

OBI:0000219.label: cellular feature identification objective
OBI:0000219.definition: Cellular_feature_identification_objective is a biological_feature_identification_objective role describing a study designed to examine or characterize a biological feature monitored at the cellular level, e.g. stage of cell cycle, stage of differentiation.

OBI:0001691.label: cellular structure feature identification objective
OBI:0001691.definition: is an objective specification which aims to discover cellular structure properties

OBI:0000131.label: molecular feature identification objective
OBI:0000131.definition: Molecular_feature_identification_objective is a biological_feature_identification_objective role describing a study designed to examine or characterize molecular features of a biological system, e.g. expression profiling, copy number of molecular components, epigenetic modifications.

OBI:0001690.label: molecular function identification objective
OBI:0001690.definition: is an objective specification which aims to discover molecular function realized by a molecular entity

OBI:0000268.label: organism feature identification objective
OBI:0000268.definition: Organism_feature_identification_objective is a biological_feature_identification_objective role describing a study designed to examine or characterize a biological feature monitored at the level of the organism, e.g. height, weight, stage of development, stage of life cycle.

OBI:0001623.label: organism identification objective
OBI:0001623.definition: A biological feature identification objective to identify the organism species in a specimen.

OBI:0000113.label: sequence feature identification objective
OBI:0000113.definition: Sequence_feature_identification_objective is a biological_feature_identification_objective role describing a study designed to examine or characterize molecular features exhibited at the level of a macromolecular sequence, e.g. nucleic acid, protein, polysaccharide.

OBI:0000092.label: role of certified IRB professional
OBI:0000092.definition: a role of which inheres in a Homo sapiens and realized during administration and oversight of the daily activities of Institutional Review Boards (IRBs) in the USA

OBI:0000196.label: role of impartial witness
OBI:0000196.definition: a role which inheres in a Homo sapiens and is realized during a clinical trial - the impartial witness is independent of the trial and cannot be unfairly influenced by people involved with the trial

OBI:0000215.label: role of legally acceptable representative
OBI:0000215.definition: a role which inheres in a human or organization who are able subject to applicable law to consent, on behalf of a prospective subject, to the subject`s participation in as clinical trial.

OBI:0000016.label: regulation-assigned role
OBI:0000016.definition: Regulation-assigned role is a regulatory role defined by legislation or governmental orders

OBI:0000014.label: regulator role
OBI:0000014.definition: a regulatory role involved with making and/or enforcing relevant legislation and governmental orders

OBI:0000129.label: calibration substance role
OBI:0000129.definition: A reference substance role that is realized when characteristics or responses elicited by the bearer are used to ensure an instrument is within protocol specification of accuracy or performance

OBI:0001142.label: dye swap quality control role
OBI:0001142.definition: a reference substance role that is borne by a material entity used in a dye swap design experiment for quality control or data normalization purposes

OBI:0000214.label: negative reference substance role
OBI:0000214.definition: a reference role in which the characteristics or responses elicited by the substance playing the reference substance role are used to establish a "no effect" response

OBI:0000409.label: nucleic acid template role
OBI:0000409.definition: a reference substance role which inheres in nucleic acid material entity and is realized in the process of using the nucleic acid bearing the template role as a reference during synthesis of a reverse copy.

OBI:0000064.label: positive reference substance role
OBI:0000064.definition: a reference role in which the characteristics or responses elicited by the substance playing the reference substance role are used to establish a "100%" response

OBI:0002477.label: reference genome role
OBI:0002477.definition: A reference substance role that is played by a reference genome when used during sequence alignment.

OBI:0001140.label: spike-in quality control role
OBI:0001140.definition: a reference substance role that is borne by a material entity with a known amount which is mixed into the evaluant of assays for quality control or data normalization purposes

OBI:0000533.label: affinity column
OBI:0000533.definition: An affinity column is a chromatography column that is used in affinity chromatography. Differences in the affinity of molecules to be separated to a stationary phase are used for discriminate retention.

OBI:0000496.label: capillary column
OBI:0000496.definition: A capillary column is a thin tube with a small inner diameter, usually around 0.5 mm.

OBI:0000628.label: carbon nanotube column
OBI:0000628.definition: Carbon nanotubes (CNTs) are known to have high thermal and mechanical stability and have the potential to be high-performance separation media that utilize the nanoscale interactions. CNT can be applied in long capillary tubes for the development of gas chromatography columns. A film of CNTs can be deposited by chemical vapor deposition (CVD) to form the stationary phase in the open tubular format. Altering the CVD conditions can vary the thickness and the morphology of the CNT film, which opens the possibility of selectivity tuning. The ability to fabricate long tubes coated with CNTs can be readily employed in other gas- and liquid-phase separations as well.

OBI:0000515.label: chromatofocusing column
OBI:0000515.definition: A chromatofocusing column is a chromatography column in which a resin is equilibrated at one pH and eluted at a second pH. The use of a weak ion-exchange resin causes a pH gradient to be formed at the solvent front owing to the buffering action of the resin. This pH gradient in turn leads to an ordering of proteins by isoelectric point. Molecules of charge sign opposite the resin bind; those of charge sign like the resin do not bind.

OBI:0000621.label: custom made column
OBI:0000621.definition: A custom made column ia a chromatography column which is specifically tailored according to the needs of the separation as requested by a scientist or working group.

OBI:0000622.label: gel permeation column
OBI:0000622.definition: A gel permeation column is a chromatography column which is used in gel permeation chromatography and which employs as the stationary phase a swollen gel made by polymerizing and cross-linking styrene in the presence of a diluent which is a nonsolvent for the styrene polymer. The polymer to be analyzed is introduced at the top of the column and then is elutriated with a solvent. The polymer molecules diffuse through the gel at rates depending on their molecular size.

OBI:0000609.label: glass column
OBI:0000609.definition: A glass column is a chromatography column made out of glass that is usually used for larger scale and preparative liquid chromatography separations.

OBI:0000574.label: high temperature column
OBI:0000574.definition: A high temperature column is a chromatography column which is suitable for and withstands very high temperatures in chromatography ovens.

OBI:0000560.label: ion exchange column
OBI:0000560.definition: An ion exchange column is a chromatography column that is used in ion exchange chromatography and anion or cation exchange resins to enable separation.

OBI:0000603.label: liquid chromatography column
OBI:0000603.definition: A liquid chromatography column is a chromatography column that is used in liquid chromatography, i.e. a column that is provided with a liquid sample mix.

OBI:0000482.label: normal phase column
OBI:0000482.definition: A normal phase column is a chromatography column in which the stationary phase is more polar than the mobile phase. Its counterpart is the reversed phase column.

OBI:0000606.label: open tubular column
OBI:0000606.definition: An open tubular column is a chromatography column in which the particles of the solid stationary phase or the support coated with a liquid stationary phase are concentrated on or along the inside tube wall leaving an open, unrestricted path for the mobile phase in the middle part of the tube.

OBI:0000465.label: organic acid column
OBI:0000465.definition: An organic acid column is a chromatography column which enables (reversed-phase) separation of hydrophilic aliphatic and aromatic organic acids with UV detection. Organic acid columns allow retention of polar and apolar organic acids and are hydrolysis resistant.

OBI:0000448.label: packed column
OBI:0000448.definition: A packed column is a chromatography column where the particles of the solid stationary phase or the support coated with a liquid stationary phase may fill the whole inside volume of the tube.

OBI:0000586.label: plunger column
OBI:0000586.definition: A plunger column is a chromatography column with adjustable heigth control. By means of an adjustable endpiece (plunger) the user can adjust the column length without disturbing the packed bed. Plunger columns can equalize volume changes and thus avoids dead volumes within the column.

OBI:0000468.label: protein column
OBI:0000468.definition: A protein column is a chromatography column used for the separation of complex protein mixtures. Protein columns enable sample desalting, followed by chromatographic separation or fractionation of complex protein samples, e.g. immunodepleted serum or plasma proteins.

OBI:0000510.label: reversed phase column
OBI:0000510.definition: A reversed phase column is a chromatography column in which the mobile phase is more polar than the stationary phase. Its counterpart is the normal phase column.

OBI:0000618.label: size exclusion column
OBI:0000618.definition: A size exclusion column is a chromatography column as used in size exclusion chromatography and which enables the separation of mixtures according to differrences in molecular size.

OBI:0000570.label: spin column
OBI:0000570.definition: A spin column is a chromatography column which is suitable for putting it into a centrifuge. A spin column enforces separation through increased G-forces while spinning the column in a centrifuge. It is often used in DNA gel extraction kits.

OBI:0000518.label: trap column
OBI:0000518.definition: A trap column is a chromatography column which is used prior to a, e.g. mass spectrometry, separation to clean up or concentrate controlled amounts of samples prior to elution to a detector.

OBI:0000815.label: Berichrom(r) Antithrombin III (A) Kit
OBI:0000815.definition: For the chromogenic determination of antithrombin III. Autoanalyzer method for undiluted samples. For the quantitative chromogenic determination of the functional activity of antithrombin III in plasma on autoanalyzers for the diagnosis of diminished AT III synthesis, increased consumption, and for monitoring substitution therapy. Berichrom(r) Antithrombin III (A) is used for the rapid determination of the physiologically active antithrombin III and permits the diagnosis of congenital and acquired antithrombin III deficiency, a condition frequently associated with an increased risk of thrombosis. Acquired antithrombin III deficiencies frequently occur due to consumption following major operations or due to disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC) in cases of septicaemia, nephroses, liver parenchymal damage (hepatitis, drug intoxication, alcoholism) and estrogen-containing contraceptives. The test permits early detection of patients at increased risk for thrombosis. Kit contains: 6 x for 5.0 mL Thrombin (bovine), 3 x for 3.0 mL Substrate Reagent, 1 x 30.0 mL Buffer Solution

OBI:0002462.label: ERCC RNA spike-in
OBI:0002462.definition: A processed material developed by the External RNA Controls Consortium (ERCC) that  consists of 92 transcripts, derived and traceable from NIST-certified DNA plasmids.

OBI:0000735.label: NTP-2000
OBI:0000735.definition: a material consisting of 14.5% protein, 8.5% fat and 9.5% fiber produced to feed rodents

OBI:0001876.label: cell culture
OBI:0001876.definition: A material entity comprised of cultured cells and the media in which they are being propagated or stored.

OBI:0000737.label: cloning vector
OBI:0000737.definition: A cloning vector is an engineered material that is used as an input material for a recombinant vector cloning process to carry inserted nucleic acids. It contains an origin of replication for a specific destination host organism, encodes for a selectable gene product and contains a cloning site.

OBI:0100060.label: cultured cell population
OBI:0100060.definition: A processed material comprised of a collection of cultured cells that has been continuously maintained together in culture and shares a common propagation history.

OBI:0002406.label: delivery form for hormonal replacement therapy
OBI:0002406.definition: A processed material used for delivery of hormones in hormone replacement therapy.

OBI:0000968.label: device
OBI:0000968.definition: A material entity that is designed to perform a function in a scientific investigation, but is not a reagent.

OBI:0002047.label: enzyme-linked antibody
OBI:0002047.definition: A processed material that is comprised of an antibody that is covalently linked to an enzyme through bioconjugation. The enzyme can be used as a detection method when the enzyme's reaction produces a detectable signal, for example a color change when the substrate is added.

OBI:0001936.label: molecular-labeled material
OBI:0001936.definition: a material entity that is the specified output of an addition of molecular label process that aims to label some molecular target to allow for its detection in a detection of molecular label assay

OBI:0000722.label: paired-end library
OBI:0000722.definition: is a collection of short paired tags from the two ends of DNA fragments are extracted and covalently linked as ditag constructs

OBI:0000827.label: pill
OBI:0000827.definition: A dose of medicine or placebo in the form of a small pellet.

OBI:0000953.label: processed specimen
OBI:0000953.definition: A specimen that has been intentionally physically modified.

OBI:0001633.label: purified material
OBI:0001633.definition: A material entity that is generated by a purification process in which an input material is separated to obtain a fraction with a higher concentration of a desired component

OBI:0000731.label: recombinant vector
OBI:0000731.definition: A recombinant vector is created by a recombinant vector cloning process, and contains nucleic acids that can be amplified. It retains functions of the original cloning vector.

OBI:0000736.label: single fragment library
OBI:0000736.definition: is a collection of short tags from DNA fragments, are extracted and covalently linked as single tag constructs

OBI:0100010.label: Epstein Barr virus transformed B cell
OBI:0100010.definition: A material entity which results from viral transformation process using EBV as transformation agent when applied to B-cell entity

OBI:0002463.label: SIRV RNA spike-in
OBI:0002463.definition: A processed material that consists of transcript isoforms of 7 spike-in RNA variant (SIRV) genes and possibly the 92 External RNA Controls Consortium (ERCC) RNA spike-in genes.

OBI:0000439.label: agarose gel
OBI:0000439.definition: a material entity resulting from the polymerization of agarose after heating agarose suspended in some buffer solution

OBI:1000207.label: assay bead
OBI:1000207.definition: A globular or round particle of defined physicochemical properties and size which can be exploited as either the primary substance for detection or as a secondary solid platform for the attachment of bioactive molecules.

OBI:1000023.label: cell culture supernatant
OBI:1000023.definition: Supernatant of a cell culture is a material entity which contains media, supplements, and secreted products of the cells and becomes the environment of cultivated cell.

OBI:0001912.label: cell freezing medium
OBI:0001912.definition: A processed material that serves as a liquid vehicle for freezing cells for long term quiescent stroage, which contains chemicls needed to sustain cell viability across freeze-thaw cycles.

OBI:1000036.label: cell lysate
OBI:1000036.definition: a cell lysate is a material entity which is output of a cell lysis process

OBI:1000024.label: cell pellet
OBI:1000024.definition: A material entity which results from the aggregation of cells produced by the application of centrifugal force to a liquid containing cells in suspension

OBI:0000079.label: culture medium
OBI:0000079.definition: a processed material that provides the needed nourishment for microorganisms or cells grown in vitro.

OBI:0302837.label: decapitated organism
OBI:0302837.definition: decapitated organism is an organism which has had it's head removed

OBI:0000318.label: eluate
OBI:0000318.definition: a eluate is a material entity which results from an elution, e.g. from a chromatography column. it has as part a material entity with role mobile phase

OBI:0000423.label: extract
OBI:0000423.definition: an extract is a material entity which results from an extraction process

OBI:0001151.label: genetically modified material
OBI:0001151.definition: a material entity, organism or cell,  that is the output of a genetic transformation process.

OBI:0001970.label: multiplexed sequencing library
OBI:0001970.definition: a multiplexed library is a material entity which is the output of a library preparation process that uses a ligation step to attach a unique multiplexing sequence identifier to a specific sample, then mixes several such tagged samples prior to the library amplification process proper. A multiplexed library allows the sequencing of several samples in one sequencing run.

OBI:0100066.label: organ section
OBI:0100066.definition: A processed material which derives from an organ and results from a process of dissection or histological sample preparation a portion(formerly an organ section is portion of an organ removed from the context of the organ)

OBI:0400081.label: particle delivery vessel
OBI:0400081.definition: Part of the fluidics subsystem. A particle delivery vessel is used to introduce either a single sample or multiple samples to a flow cytometer. The most common particle delivery vessel is a sample tube.

OBI:1000042.label: peptide construct
OBI:1000042.definition: a material entity synthesized to contain a number of peptides conjugated together in a non-linear fashion

OBI:0000044.label: physical document
OBI:0000044.definition: A physical document is an object serving as a record of information by means of symbolic marks.

OBI:0000432.label: polyacrylamide gel
OBI:0000432.definition: a material entity resulting from the polymerization of acrylamide with TEMED in some buffer solution

OBI:0000286.label: precipitate
OBI:0000286.definition: a precipitate is a material entity which is output of a precipitation process

OBI:0001879.label: reagent
OBI:0001879.definition: A biological or chemical entity that bears a reagent role in virtue of it being intended for application in a scientific technique  to participate in (or have molecular parts that participate in) a chemical reaction that facilitates the generation of data about some distinct entity, or the generation of some distinct material specified output.

OBI:0100064.label: screening library
OBI:0100064.definition: a screening library is a collection of materials engineered to identify qualities of a subset of its members during a screening process?

OBI:0100058.label: xenograft
OBI:0100058.definition: A material entity which results from the transplantation of living cells, tissues or organs  from on organism of one species to an organism of another species.

OBI:0001139.label: liquid chromatography instrument
OBI:0001139.definition: A chromatography device that dissolves a mixture in liquid mobile phase to separate the analyte to be measured from other molecules in the mixture and allows it to be isolated

OBI:0000605.label: chart recorder
OBI:0000605.definition: The chart recorder is a device that transduces signal-intensities into a graphical peak output: As the separated components of the gas sample emerge into the detector, the change in voltage in the detecting bridge circuit causes a representative peak to be drawn on a chart recorder. The position of the peak along the time axis of the chart measures the component's retention time, which identifies the component. This is directly related to carrier gas flow rate, temperature and column packing and dimensions. The area under each peak is proportional to the concentration of the component of the sample. The area of the peaks inscribed on the chart recorder can be determined by multiplying the height of the peak in mm, by the width of the peak in mm at 1/2 the peak height. The calibration curves for use with the chart recorder are therefore peak area plotted against concentration.

OBI:0000601.label: chromatography consumable
OBI:0000601.definition: A chromatography consumable is a consumable that is used in a chromatography experiment.

OBI:0000619.label: chromatography splitter
OBI:0000619.definition: An adjustable restriction that is placed in the waste outlet to allow the necessary pressure to develop at the column inlet to force a flow (q ml/min) through the column. If the flow of mobile phase is Q ml/min then the waste flow will be (Q-q) ml/min. by adjusting the waste flow, the proportion of the sample entering the capillary column can be varied over a wide range of values and the necessary minimum permissible volume for the particular column in use can be selected for analysis. Unfortunately, the fraction taken in this way may not be representative of the original sample. This is due to the individual solutes in the mixture having different diffusivities and, thus, they distribute themselves across the sampling tube in an irregular manner. In general, the components with higher diffusivities (e.g., those solutes of lower molecular weight) will diffuse away from the bulk sample more quickly than those having lower diffusivities.

OBI:0000594.label: column adapter
OBI:0000594.definition: An Adapter that enabled the connection of a column to additional devices.

OBI:0000532.label: column cartridge
OBI:0000532.definition: A device that binds the chromatography column and additional connector elements and / or valves or syringes into one physical unity for further processing.

OBI:0000545.label: column compartment
OBI:0000545.definition: For chromatography analyses, the ability to maintain a stable column environment regardless of ambient temperature fluctuations is critical for maintaining retention time precision. In order to ensure such stable conditions at different chromatography steps a column compartment can be installed that ensures e.g. stable temperature of the column in a given step.

OBI:0000478.label: column connector
OBI:0000478.definition: A device that connects two or more columns together in a functional way with leak-tight connection, low dead volume, low thermal mass and high inertness.

OBI:0000602.label: column frit
OBI:0000602.definition: A part of the column content that separates column packing compartments. In radial columns the packing is supported between two cylindrical frits and the gap between represents the bed height or column length. The outer frit is the column inlet and consequently the sample initially has a large area of stationary phase with which to interact. Frits are porous metal products to prevent unwanted particles from entering the chromatography system. These particles may come from the sample, the solvent or debris generated by the chromatography system itself. Such particles entering the system may lead to clogging of capillaries, interference with the chromatography by changing chromatographic parameters or disturbance of the detector function. Characteristics of a frit, besides the diameter and the thickness, is the porosity (pore distribution, density).

OBI:0000508.label: column jacket
OBI:0000508.definition: A column jacket is a piece of column chromatography equipment that covers a column in order to ensure thermoisolation and create a controllable thermostatic microenvironment.

OBI:0000542.label: gas chromatography equipment
OBI:0000542.definition: Any device used in a gas chromatography experiment.

OBI:0000614.label: guard column
OBI:0000614.definition: Guard columns are installed between the injection valve and the analytical or preparative column and here will remove contaminants and prolong the lifetime of the columns.

OBI:0000528.label: liquid chromatography valve
OBI:0000528.definition: A sample valve that must be able to sustain pressures up to 10,000 p.s.i., although it is most likely to operate on a continuous basis, at pressures of 3,000 p.s.i. or less. The higher the operating pressure the tighter the valve seating surfaces must be forced together to eliminate any leak. It follows that any abrasive material, however fine, that passes into the valve can cause the valve seating to become scored each time it is rotated which will ultimately lead to leaks. This will cause the sample size to vary between samples and eventually affect the accuracy of the analysis. It follows that any solid material must be carefully removed from any sample before filling the valve. The sample volume of an internal loop valve is situated in the connecting slot of the valve rotor and can be used only for relatively small sample volumes. Internal sample loop valves provide samples with volumes ranging from 0.1 ml to about 0.5 ml. Valve operation is shown in figure 6. The left-hand side diagram shows the load position. The sample occupies the rotor slot and has been filled by passing the sample from an appropriate syringe through the rotor slot to waste. While loading the sample, the mobile phase supply is passed through the valve directly to the column. To place the sample onto the column, the valve is then rotated and the valve slot containing the sample is now placed between the solvent supply and the column. As a result, the sample is passed into the column by the flow of solvent.

OBI:0000551.label: needle assembly
OBI:0000551.definition: The needle assembly attached to the autosampler, comprises the injector needle that feeds a sample or carrier gas into the inlet

OBI:0000504.label: sample injection system
OBI:0000504.definition: An automated chromatography system that injects the sample into the chromatography columns in order to increase speed and minimize human involvement in the purification process for  better reproducibility.

OBI:0000497.label: sample inlet
OBI:0000497.definition: The column inlet (or injector) provides the means to introduce a sample into a continuous flow of carrier gas. The inlet is a piece of hardware attached to the column head.

OBI:0000572.label: transfer line
OBI:0000572.definition: A combination of devices that are used in connection with a sampling head for transferring components of an applied sample to the analyzing part of a chromatography system.

OBI:0001088.label: tandem mass spectrometer
OBI:0001088.definition: A mass spectrometer in which ions are subjected to two or more sequential stages of analysis (which may be separated spatially or temporally) according to the quotient mass/charge.

OBI:0000144.label: role of independent data monitoring committee
OBI:0000144.definition: a trial monitor role charged recommending whether to continue, modify, or end the trial

OBI:0001955.label: competitive binding reference ligand role
OBI:0001955.definition: A positive reference substance role that inheres in a material entity that is known to bind to a target entity, and that is realized in a competitive binding assay that has as specified input the target entity, an evaluant and the positive reference substance, where the binding of the evaluant to the target is measured based on the evaluant's ability to compete with the positive reference substance for binding to the target.

OBI:0000355.label: hypothesis driven investigation
OBI:0000355.definition: is an investigation with the goal to test one or more hypothesis

OBI:0000356.label: hypothesis generating investigation
OBI:0000356.definition: is an investigation in which data is generated and analyzed with the purpose of generating new hypothesis

OBI:0001949.label: sequence annotation reporting role
OBI:0001949.definition: A reporting party role that is realized by a person or organization who reports the feature annotation results from the analysis of a macromolecular sequence.

OBI:0600045.label: 3D structure determination assay
OBI:0600045.definition: An assay that determines the 3-dimensional configuration of an input material.

OBI:0000117.label: Bernoulli trial
OBI:0000117.definition: An assay where the output data is a datum with one of two values denoting success and failure.

OBI:0001954.label: ChIP assay
OBI:0001954.definition: An assay in which portions of chromatin, the ordered and organized complex of DNA and its interaction partners that make up a chormosome, is extracted and purified by immunoprecipitation with antibodies or tags, and subsequently analyzed

OBI:0001915.label: DNA replication timing by array assay
OBI:0001915.definition: An assay which quantifies the timing of DNA replication as a function of genome position using array technology.

OBI:0000433.label: DNA sequence feature detection assay
OBI:0000433.definition: An assay with the objective to determine a sequence feature of DNA

OBI:0000438.label: DNA sequence variation detection assay
OBI:0000438.definition: An assay that measures changes (expansion, amplification, deletion, mutation) in the sequence of a DNA molecule.

OBI:0000623.label: NMR spectroscopy assay
OBI:0000623.definition: An assay that exploits the magnetic properties of certain nuclei (those with a spin) to resonate when placed in particular magnetic field conditions. Instruments recording NMR spectrum and sets of analysis can be used to deduce identity of chemical as well as composition of complex chemical mixtures.

OBI:0002436.label: RNA interactome capture
OBI:0002436.definition: An assay that identifies RNA binding proteins by cross-linking RNA and proteins with UV light, then purifying the bound complexes by oligo(dT) capture. Finally, the complexes are analyzed by mass spectrometry.

OBI:0001670.label: RNA protection assay
OBI:0001670.definition: An assay that determines the presence and estimates abundance of transcript species by first creating an homo or heteroduplex by adding a specific, complementary sequence to the sequence of interest and then exposing the mixture of ribonuclease, which will degrade only single stranded molecules. A detection step will reveal if the sample contained a sequence of interest.

OBI:0000820.label: activated partial thromboplastin time assay
OBI:0000820.definition: An assay that evaluates blood coagulation by measuring the time required for the appearance of fibrin strands following the mixing blood or plasma with phospholipid platelet substitute (e.g., crude cephalins, soybean phosphatides). It is a test of the intrinsic pathway (factors VIII, IX, XI, and XII) and the common pathway (fibrinogen, prothrombin, factors V and X) of blood coaguation . It is used as a screening test and to monitor heparin therapy.

OBI:0001158.label: age determination assay
OBI:0001158.definition: An assay that determines the duration of part of the life of an organism, where the initial time point is the beginning of some transitional state (such as birth or when planted).

OBI:0000443.label: analyte assay
OBI:0000443.definition: An assay with the objective to capture information about the presence, concentration, or amount of an analyte in an evaluant.

OBI:0002036.label: array based nucleic acid structure mapping assay
OBI:0002036.definition: An assay which aims to provide information about the in vivo organization/structure of nucleic acids using chemical or enzymatic probes using a microarray.

OBI:1110207.label: assay detecting IFN-gamma production
OBI:1110207.definition: An assay that determines information about the production of the cytokine interferon gamma

OBI:0600017.label: assay detecting a molecular label
OBI:0600017.definition: An assay that detects the presence or a quality of a molecular label which is a proxy for the detection of the molecular target to which the label is attached

OBI:0002039.label: assay for transposase-accessible chromatin using sequencing
OBI:0002039.definition: An assay to capture the location of open chromatin, DNA-binding proteins, individual nucleosomes and chromatin compaction at nucleotide resolution by Tn5 transposase insertion.

OBI:0001146.label: binding assay
OBI:0001146.definition: An assay with the objective to characterize the disposition of two or more material entities to form a complex.

OBI:0000537.label: copy number variation profiling assay
OBI:0000537.definition: An assay that determines lost or amplified genomic regions of DNA by comparing genomic DNA originating from tissues from the same or different individuals using specific techniques such as CGH, array CGH, SNP genotyping

OBI:0001689.label: cytochalasin-induced inhibition of actin polymerization assay
OBI:0001689.definition: An assay which uses compound cytochalasin (CHEBI: 23528) to block actin polymerization-dependent cell motility (GO:0070358) and actin filament polymerization (GO:0030041).

OBI:0001977.label: cytometry assay
OBI:0001977.definition: An assay that measures properties of cells.

OBI:0001178.label: efficacy of epitope intervention experiment
OBI:0001178.definition: An assay that tests  if inducing an epitope specific immune response in an organism has an effect, such as the ability to prevent, treat or excarbate diseases in the organism.

OBI:0002176.label: electrophysiology assay
OBI:0002176.definition: An assay that measures the electrical properties of biological cells or tissues. Typically, this assay will generate measurements of voltage changes or electric current (or other associated variables such as impedence or capacitance).

OBI:0002020.label: epigenetic modification assay
OBI:0002020.definition: An assay that identifies epigenetic modifications including histone modifications, open chromatin, and DNA methylation.

OBI:0000454.label: extracellular electrophysiology recording assay
OBI:0000454.definition: An electrophysiology recording assay where the recording location of the electrode is extracellular

OBI:0002144.label: extrachromosomal circular DNA sequencing assay
OBI:0002144.definition: An assay which aims at identifying the endogenous population of extrachromosomal circular DNA originating from a subset of genomic loci and potentially having profound consequences on the regulatory and coding capabilities of these regions. The assay includes creation of a library out of the circular DNA molecules and subsequent sequencing using parallelized sequencing methods.

OBI:0001501.label: fluorescence detection assay
OBI:0001501.definition: An assay in which a material's fluorescence is determined.

OBI:0002162.label: footprinting assay
OBI:0002162.definition: An assay that measures ligand binding and conformational changes by the solvent accessibility of the backbone, bases, or side-chain structures of macromolecules through their sensitivity to chemical or enzymatic cleavage or modification reactions.

OBI:0001022.label: gene dosage assay
OBI:0001022.definition: An assay that measures changes in phenotype due to increased or decreased dosage of a single allele of a gene.

OBI:0001672.label: gene knock-down assay
OBI:0001672.definition: An assay which transiently disrupts gene transcripts by expressing antisense RNA constructs or delivering RNA interfering molecules in cells.

OBI:0000721.label: glucose tolerance test
OBI:0000721.definition: An assay that measures glucose clearance from blood over time by repeated glucose measurement in blood serum or plasma after the administration of a glucose bolus in-vivo. This assay can be used to evaluate the severity of insulin resistance or the efficiency of glucose clearance.

OBI:0000944.label: handedness assay
OBI:0000944.definition: An assay that measures the unequal distribution of fine motor skill between the left and right hands typically in human subjects by means of some questionnaire and scoring procedure.

OBI:0000630.label: hematology assay
OBI:0000630.definition: An assay that studies blood and blood producing organs using a variety of techniques and instruments

OBI:0600020.label: histological assay
OBI:0600020.definition: An assay that uses visual examination of cells or tissue (or images of them) to make an assessment regarding a quality of the cells or tissue. This assay can include steps of staining, imaging, and judgement.

OBI:0000185.label: imaging assay
OBI:0000185.definition: An assay that produces a picture of an entity.

OBI:1110128.label: immune epitope assay
OBI:1110128.definition: An assay that detects the binding of an epitope to an adaptive immune receptor or a immune response process resulting from such a binding event

OBI:0000743.label: immune response assay
OBI:0000743.definition: An assay that determines information about an immune response

OBI:0000978.label: in container assay
OBI:0000978.definition: An assay in which a measurement is made by observing entities located in a container.

OBI:0000964.label: in live cell assay
OBI:0000964.definition: An assay in which a measurement is made by observing entities located in a live cell.

OBI:0000966.label: in live organism assay
OBI:0000966.definition: An assay in which a measurement is made by observing entities located in an organism.

OBI:0001980.label: in vivo intervention experiment
OBI:0001980.definition: An assay in which the effect of a targeted process (the intervention) on an organism is tested.

OBI:0001686.label: in-situ hybridization assay
OBI:0001686.definition: An assay that localizes a specific DNA or RNA sequence within a portion or section of tissue using artificially induced nucleic hybridization.

OBI:0001187.label: infectious agent detection assay
OBI:0001187.definition: An assay that measures the presence or amount of an infectious agent in an evaluant

OBI:0000447.label: intra cellular electrophysiology recording assay
OBI:0000447.definition: An electrophysiology recording assay where the recording location of the electrode is intracellular

OBI:0600026.label: longitudinal mass measurement assay
OBI:0600026.definition: An assay that measures the mass of a material at two or more time points

OBI:0000445.label: mass measurement assay
OBI:0000445.definition: An assay that determines the mass of an evaluant

OBI:0000470.label: mass spectrometry assay
OBI:0000470.definition: An assay that identifies the amount and type of material entities present in a sample by fragmenting the sample and measuring the mass-to-charge ratio of the resulting particles.

OBI:0000366.label: metabolite profiling assay
OBI:0000366.definition: An assay that detects and identifies chemical entities resulting from biochemical and cellular metabolism

OBI:0001684.label: methylation-specific polymerase chain reaction assay
OBI:0001684.definition: An assay that uses initial modification of DNA by sodium bisulfite, converting all unmethylated, but not methylated, cytosines to uracil, and subsequent amplification with primers specific for methylated versus unmethylated DNA.

OBI:0002438.label: nuclear ligation assay
OBI:0002438.definition: An assay that detects the proximity of chromosomal DNA through the use of a ligation reaction in isolated nuclei.

OBI:0001624.label: organism identification assay
OBI:0001624.definition: An assay that identifies the organism species in a specimen.

OBI:0002441.label: physical examination of individual
OBI:0002441.definition: An assay that produces a description of the qualities of an entity that has not been transformed, through observation and physical, non-invasive techniques.

OBI:0000913.label: promoter activity detection by reporter gene assay
OBI:0000913.definition: An assay in which the activity of a promoter in a cell is monitored by using a reporter gene that was inserted in a genomic location under control of the promoter and whose expression can be easily detected based on qualities or functions of the gene.

OBI:0000615.label: protein expression profiling assay
OBI:0000615.definition: An assay that determines protein expression and translation activity using protein extracts collected from a material entity.

OBI:0002165.label: protein localization assay
OBI:0002165.definition: An assay that determines the specific location of a protein. Subcellular localization is distinguished from tissue-based localization based on the type of microscopy applied.

OBI:0000288.label: protein-protein interaction detection assay
OBI:0000288.definition: An assay that determines interactions between proteins, such as protein-protein binding.

OBI:0000802.label: prothrombin time assay
OBI:0000802.definition: An assay that measures the prothrombin ratio, which is the prothrombin time for a patient, divided by the result for control plasma. Most commonly the test is preformed using blood plasma. Blood is drawn into a test tube containing liquid citrate, which acts as an anticoagulant. An excess of calcium is added to enable the blood to clot again.Tissue factor (also known as factor III or thromboplastin) is added, and the time the sample takes to clot is measured optically as the prothrombin time, which is compared to a control sample.

OBI:0002132.label: pulse stable isotope labeling by amino acids in cell culture
OBI:0002132.definition: An assay that detects differences in protein abundance using samples that have been metabolically labeled in vivo with a stable non-radioactive heavy isotope containing amino acid for a short period of time. After diluting the pulsed cells into growth media without label, high resolution mass spectrometry-based proteomics is used to analyze the time-dependent decay and determine protein stability.

OBI:0000910.label: radio immuno assay
OBI:0000910.definition: An assay in which a radioactive labeled antigen or antibody is used to determine the interaction between an antigen and its receptor. This can be used to detect the presence of an antigen of interest in an input sample or determine the specificity of an input antibody.

OBI:0000201.label: radioactivity detection
OBI:0000201.definition: An assay that measures the amount of radiation in the radioactive spectrum (alpha, beta or gamma rays) emitted from an input material.

OBI:0000893.label: real time polymerase chain reaction assay
OBI:0000893.definition: An assay, based on the PCR, that amplifies and simultaneously quantifies a specific DNA molecule based on the use of complementary probes/primers. It enables both detection and quantification (as absolute number of copies or relative amount when normalized to DNA input or additional normalizing genes) of one or more specific sequences in a DNA sample.
alternative_term: quantitative real time polymerase chain reaction

OBI:0000911.label: real time reverse-transcription polymerase chain reaction assay
OBI:0000911.definition: An assay that uses a reverse transcription step (an RNA strand is reverse transcribed into its DNA complement using the enzyme reverse transcriptase) before a PCR assay.

OBI:0002082.label: reporter gene assay
OBI:0002082.definition: An assay that detects expression of a reporter gene that was inserted under the control of a regulatory sequence of interest.

OBI:0001170.label: reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction assay
OBI:0001170.definition: An assay that determines the concentration of RNA in a sample in which an RNA strand is first reverse transcribed into its DNA complement (complementary DNA, or cDNA) using the enzyme reverse transcriptase, and the resulting cDNA is amplified using traditional or real-time PCR.

OBI:0600047.label: sequencing assay
OBI:0600047.definition: An assay the uses chemical or biochemical means to infer the sequence of a biomaterial

OBI:0000870.label: single-nucleotide-resolution nucleic acid structure mapping assay
OBI:0000870.definition: An assay that provides information about the secondary structure of nucleic acids using chemical or enzymatic probing to establish the extent of base-pairing or solvent accessiblity.

OBI:0000808.label: spectrolyse heparin antifactor-Xa assay
OBI:0000808.definition: An assay that quantitatively measures heparin in human plasma using Factor Xa and Antithrombin III in excess, where the rate of Factor Xa inhibition is directly proportional to the heparin concentration. The residual Factor Xa activity, measured with a Factor Xa-specific chromogenic substrate, is inversely proportional to the heparin concentration.

OBI:0600025.label: substance detection assay
OBI:0600025.definition: An assay that detects a specified substance

OBI:0000699.label: survival assessment assay
OBI:0000699.definition: An assay that measures the occurrence of death events in one or more organisms over time

OBI:0002140.label: temperature measurement assay
OBI:0002140.definition: An assay to determine the temperature of an evaluant.

OBI:0000823.label: thrombin time assay
OBI:0000823.definition: An assay that measures the time between the addition of the thrombin and the clot formation in plasma.

OBI:0000424.label: transcription profiling assay
OBI:0000424.definition: An assay that determines gene expression and transcription activity using ribonucleic acids collected from a material entity.

OBI:0600002.label: tumor grading
OBI:0600002.definition: An assay that determines the grade (severity/stage) of a tumor sample, used in cancer biology to describe abnormalities/qualities of tumor cells or tissues. Values can be described by terms from NCI Thesaurus.

OBI:0000875.label: viral hemagglutination inhibition assay
OBI:0000875.definition: An assay that measures the ability of an evaluant to inhibit hemagglutination by a virus. Hemagglutinin is a viral protein which binds to sialic acid receptors on cells or to erythrocytes, causing the cells to clump. Loss of clumping indicates hemagglutination inhibition by the evaluant.

OBI:0002141.label: volume measurement assay
OBI:0002141.definition: An assay to determine the volume of an evaluant.

OBI:0001265.label: FWER adjusted p-value
OBI:0001265.definition: A quantitative confidence value resulting from a multiple testing error correction method which adjusts the p-value used as input to control for Type I error in the context of multiple pairwise tests

OBI:0001442.label: q-value
OBI:0001442.definition:
A quantitative confidence value that measures the minimum false discovery rate that is incurred when calling that test significant. 
To compute q-values, it is necessary to know the p-value produced by a test and possibly set a false discovery rate level.

OBI:0000175.label: p-value
OBI:0000175.definition: A quantitative confidence value that represents the probability of obtaining a result at least as extreme as that actually obtained, assuming that the actual value was the result of chance alone.

OBI:0000235.label: standard error
OBI:0000235.definition: A quantitative confidence value which is the standard deviations of the sample in a frequency distribution, obtained by dividing the standard deviation by the total number of cases in the frequency distribution.

OBI:0001902.label: sample preparation for sequencing assay
OBI:0001902.definition: A sample preparation for assay that preparation of nucleic acids for a sequencing assay

OBI:0000918.label: Dulbecco's modified Eagle medium
OBI:0000918.definition: A culture medium containing iron, phenol red, amino acids, salts, glucose and vitamins.

OBI:0000943.label: chemical cleavage
OBI:0000943.definition: chemical cleavage is a protocol application relying on a chemical compound to cause the fragmentation of an input material that is susceptible to that chemical agent

OBI:0000800.label: cross linking
OBI:0000800.definition: A process in which bonds are created that link one polymer to another

OBI:0000803.label: denaturing
OBI:0000803.definition: Is a process in which the tertiary or secondary structure of a polymer is disrupted

OBI:0600036.label: establishing cell culture
OBI:0600036.definition: a process through which a new type of cell culture or cell line is created, either through the isolation and culture of one or more cells from a fresh source, or the deliberate experimental modification of an existing cell culture (e.g passaging a primary culture to become a secondary culture or line, or the immortalization or stable genetic modification of an existing culture or line).

OBI:0000906.label: induced hemagglutination
OBI:0000906.definition: The clumping or clustering of red blood cells caused by certain viruses, antibodies, or other substances

OBI:0000711.label: library preparation
OBI:0000711.definition: is a process which results in the creation of a library from fragments of DNA using cloning vectors or oligonucleotides with the role of adaptors.

OBI:0000652.label: material combination
OBI:0000652.definition: is a material processing with the objective to combine two or more material entities as input into a single material entity as output.

OBI:0001480.label: phage display library panning
OBI:0001480.definition: Phage display library panning is a process in which a diverse collection of phages encoding peptides or proteins are screened and the ones encoding active peptides/proteins are selected in an iterative process similar to natural selection.

OBI:0000719.label: vaccine preparation
OBI:0000719.definition: vaccine preparation is a planned  process with specified output a vaccine

OBI:1110020.label: Immunization in vitro
OBI:1110020.definition: Process of administering an object playing the role of immunogen to a cell culture

OBI:0600038.label: addition of molecular label
OBI:0600038.definition: a material processing technique intended to add a molecular label to some input material entity, to allow detection of the molecular target of this label in a detection of molecular label assay

OBI:0600032.label: artificially induced DNA repair
OBI:0600032.definition: a protocol application to repair damaged DNA molecules

OBI:0600027.label: artificially induced cell membrane lysis
OBI:0600027.definition: a material transformation to break the membranes of cells, releasing the cells contents; input=>cells; output=>cell_lysate

OBI:0600039.label: artificially induced methylation
OBI:0600039.definition: A planned process of adding methyl groups to polymers

OBI:0000253.label: artificially induced nucleic acid hybridization
OBI:0000253.definition: Is a material transformation in which strands of nucleic acids that are (somewhat) complementary form a double-stranded molecule. Has input at least two single stranded molecules of nucleic acid molecules.

OBI:0600028.label: artificially induced reverse transcription
OBI:0600028.definition: a protocol with the objective to transcribe single-stranded RNA into complementary DNA (cDNA)

OBI:0000153.label: cell co-culturing
OBI:0000153.definition: A material combination in which cell cultures of two or more different types are are combined and allowed to culture as one.

OBI:0001147.label: cell culture expansion
OBI:0001147.definition: a processual entity that results in the increase of cell numbers

OBI:0000413.label: cell cycle synchronization
OBI:0000413.definition: a process with the objective to obtain a cell culture in which all cells are in the same stage of the cell cycle

OBI:0600021.label: cell fixation
OBI:0600021.definition: a protocol application to preserve defined  qualities of cells or tissues (sample) which may otherwise change over time

OBI:0600033.label: cell permeabilization
OBI:0600033.definition: A protocol application to permeabilize cell membranes, allowing molecules to more easily pass through the membrane than was possible prior to the protocol application

OBI:0001504.label: dissection
OBI:0001504.definition: A planned process that separates and isolates tissues for surgical purposes, or for the analysis or study of their structures.

OBI:0302905.label: elution
OBI:0302905.definition: the process of extracting one material from another by washing with a solvent to remove adsorbed material from an adsorbent (as in washing of loaded ion-exchange resins to remove captured ions)

OBI:0600058.label: enzymatic amplification
OBI:0600058.definition: the use of enzymes to increase the number of molecules of a biomaterial

OBI:0000231.label: enzymatic cleavage
OBI:0000231.definition: enzymatic cleavage is a protocol application to digest the fraction of input material that is susceptible to that enzyme

OBI:0302892.label: enzymatic ligation
OBI:0302892.definition: An enzymatic ligation is a planned process in which molecules  are joined by covalent bonds through the action of an material entity with a ligase activity

OBI:0600030.label: experimental disease induction
OBI:0600030.definition: a protocol application to induce a specific disease in an organism

OBI:0600043.label: genetic transformation
OBI:0600043.definition: the introduction. alteration or integration of genetic material into a cell or organism

OBI:0000341.label: histological sample preparation
OBI:0000341.definition: histological sample preparation is the preparation of an input tissue via slicing and labeling to make tissue microstructure of interest visible in a future histology assay

OBI:0302902.label: immobilization
OBI:0302902.definition: immbolization is a process by which material entity become (possibly covalently but not necessarily) attached to the surface of another material entity used a substratum.

OBI:0000373.label: ionize process
OBI:0000373.definition: a physical process of converting an atom or molecule into an ion by adding or removing charged particles such as electrons or other ions. This excludes chemical processes of dissociation.

OBI:0302889.label: irradiation
OBI:0302889.definition: irradiation is a process by which a material entity is exposed to radiative energy, which could be ionizing radiation (such as gamma rays or X-rays)  or not such as UV light or microwaves

OBI:0600006.label: killing
OBI:0600006.definition: A protocol application in which an organism is intentionally put to death

OBI:0000457.label: manufacturing
OBI:0000457.definition: Manufacturing is a process with the intent to produce a processed material which will have a function for future use. A person or organization (having manufacturer role) is a participant in this process

OBI:0600014.label: material component separation
OBI:0600014.definition: a material processing in which components of an input material become segregated in space

OBI:0302903.label: nucleic acid hybridization
OBI:0302903.definition: a planned process by which totally or partially complementary, single-stranded nucleic acids are  combined into a single molecule called heteroduplex or homoduplex to an extent depending on the amount of complementarity.

OBI:0302890.label: polymerization
OBI:0302890.definition: polymerization is process by which molecular entity of small mass are aggregated in motifs over the course of a chemical reaction catalyzed by enzymes or other molecular entities acting as catalyst. polymerization results in molecular entity of high molecular weight

OBI:0600064.label: recombinant vector cloning
OBI:0600064.definition: a planned process with the objective to insert genetic material into a cloning vector for future replication of the inserted material

OBI:0000073.label: sample preparation for assay
