An ion semiconductor chip manufactured by Life Technologies which detects polymerase-driven base incorporation to translate into digital form. The 314 chip is compatible with the Ion Torrent PGM and has a run time of:

2.3 hours for 200 bp reads with an output of 30-50 Mb,
3.7 hours for 400 bp reads with an output of 60-100 Mb.

OBI:0001971.label: Ion 316 Chip v2
OBI:0001971.definition:
An ion semiconductor chip manufactured by Life Technologies which detects polymerase-driven base incorporation to translate into digital form. The 316 chip is compatible with the Ion Torrent PGM and has a run time of:

3.0 hours for 200 bp reads with an output of 30-50 Mb,
4.9 hours for 400 bp reads with an output of 60 Mb-1 Gb.

OBI:0001972.label: Ion 318 Chip v2
OBI:0001972.definition:
An ion semiconductor chip manufactured by Life Technologies which detects polymerase-driven base incorporation to translate into digital form. The 318 chip is compatible with the Ion Torrent PGM and has a run time of:

4.4 hours for 200 bp reads with an output of 60 Mb-1 Gb,
7.3 hours for 400 bp reads with an output of 1.2 Gb-2 Gb.

OBI:0000891.label: cell proliferation assay
OBI:0000891.definition: A cytometry assay which measures the degreee to which input cells are replicating.

OBI:0000975.label: cell-cell binding detection by flow cytometry assay
OBI:0000975.definition: A binding assay which uses a flow cytometer to detect pairs of cells that are bound to each other by staining them with different fluorescent labels.

OBI:0000882.label: cell-cell killing assay
OBI:0000882.definition: A cytometry assay that monitors a cell population to track how many are killed by other cells.

OBI:0302736.label: comet assay
OBI:0302736.definition: An assay that measures DNA damage (DNA breakage) in eucaryotic cells exposed to a challenge by determining the size and shape of DNA migration by detecting fluorescently labeled DNA from a cell placed in an electric field using gel electrophoresis

OBI:0002115.label: cytometry time of flight assay
OBI:0002115.definition: A cytometry assay in which the presence of molecules of interest on or in cells is indicated by binding of antibodies labeled with rare earth element tags which are detected by time-of-flight mass spectrometry.

OBI:0600031.label: enzyme-linked immunospot assay
OBI:0600031.definition: A cytometry assay in which cells are cultured on a surface coated with a capture antibody binding a secretory material of interest which subsequently gets stained resulting in a spot for each cell producing the secretory material of interest.

OBI:0000916.label: flow cytometry assay
OBI:0000916.definition: A cytometry assay in which an input cell population is put in solution, is passed by a laser, and optical sensors are used to detect scattering of the laser light and/or fluorescence of specific markers to count and characterize the particles in solution.

OBI:0002120.label: mixed lymphocyte reaction assay
OBI:0002120.definition: A cytometry assay where lymphocytes from two individuals are co-cultured with the lymphocytes from one of the allogeneic individuals (Responders) being labeled (with 3H Thymidine or BrdU) and the proliferation of the labeled cells is measured, which is thought to reflect recognition of histocompatibility antigens on the unlabeled cells (stimulators).

OBI:0000854.label: western blot analysis
OBI:0000854.definition: An analyte assay that detects specific peptides in an input material by separating it using gel electrophoresis, transfering the separated molecules to a membrane, and staining them with_ antibodies specific to the analyte molecules.

OBI:0001635.label: antibody binding detection by fluorescence quenching
OBI:0001635.definition: A binding assay in which affinity is measured by detecting a change in fluorescence (usually quenching) that occurs upon binding of the antibody to the ligand. The fluorescent signal that is affected by binding is either from an exogenous fluorophore attached to the ligand, or is the intrisic fluorescence of aromatic (tryptophan) residues on the binding site of the antibody (no conjugated fluorophore necessary) or, less commonly, on the ligand binding region (epitope).

OBI:0001981.label: disease exacerbation in vivo intervention experiment
OBI:0001981.definition: An in vivo intervention experiment that tests the ability of the intervention to increase the severity of a disease in the host.

OBI:0001982.label: protection from challenge in vivo intervention experiment
OBI:0001982.definition: An in vivo intervention experiment that tests the ability of the intervention to prevent occurrence of a disease in a host.

OBI:0001983.label: tolerance induction intervention experiment
OBI:0001983.definition: An in vivo intervention experiment that tests the ability of the intervention to decrease an immune response.

OBI:0001984.label: treatment intervention experiment
OBI:0001984.definition: An in vivo intervention experiment in which the ability of the intervention to reduce or cure the effects of a disease are tested.

OBI:0001918.label: RNA-binding protein immunoprecipitation array profiling assay
OBI:0001918.definition: An assay that combines immunoprecipitation of an RNA-binding protein and array technology to identify mRNAs associated with selected RNA binding proteins (RBPs).

OBI:0001304.label: RNAi profiling by array assay
OBI:0001304.definition: An assay in which double stranded RNA is synthesized with a sequence complementary to a gene(s) of interest and introduced into a cell or organism, where it is recognized as exogenous genetic material and activates the RNAi pathway resulting in knockdown of the transcripts and providing a means to study downstream changes in gene expression.

OBI:0001318.label: proteomic profiling by array assay
OBI:0001318.definition: An assay that detects proteins in a sample (quantified or otherwise analyzed), e.g. antibody profiling using an array based technology.

OBI:0002168.label: subcellular protein immunohistochemistry assay
OBI:0002168.definition: An immunohistochemistry assay that uses antibodies to display the specific subcellular location of proteins.

OBI:0001524.label: cell bound MHC direct binding assay measuring equilibrium association constant [KA] of a MHC:ligand complex using fluorescence detection
OBI:0001524.definition: A cell bound MHC ligand binding equilibrium association constant (KA) determination assay that uses fluorescence detection to detect direct binding.

OBI:0001539.label: cell bound MHC competitive binding assay measuring equilibrium dissociation constant [KD] of a MHC:ligand complex using fluorescence detection
OBI:0001539.definition: A cell bound MHC ligand binding equilibrium dissociation constant (KD) determination assay that uses fluorescence detection to detect loss of binding of a known reference ligand due to competition by the ligand under investigation.

OBI:0001549.label: cell bound MHC competitive binding assay measuring equilibrium dissociation constant [KD] of a MHC:ligand complex using radioactivity detection
OBI:0001549.definition: A cell bound MHC ligand binding equilibrium dissociation constant (KD) determination assay that uses radioactivity detection to detect loss of binding of a known reference ligand due to competition by the ligand under investigation.

OBI:0001544.label: cell lysate MHC competitive binding assay measuring equilibrium dissociation constant [KD] of a MHC:ligand complex using radioactivity detection
OBI:0001544.definition: A cell lysate MHC ligand binding equilibrium dissociation constant (KD) determination assay that uses radioactivity detection to detect loss of binding of a known reference ligand due to competition by the ligand under investigation.

OBI:0001537.label: purified MHC competitive binding assay measuring equilibrium dissociation constant [KD] of a MHC:ligand complex using fluorescence detection
OBI:0001537.definition: A purified MHC ligand binding equilibrium dissociation constant (KD) determination assay that uses fluorescence detection to detect loss of binding of a known reference ligand due to competition by the ligand under investigation.

OBI:0001989.label: purified MHC competitive binding assay measuring equilibrium dissociation constant [KD] of a MHC:ligand complex using radioactivity detection
OBI:0001989.definition: A purified MHC ligand binding equilibrium dissociation constant (KD) determination assay that uses radioactivity detection to detect loss of binding of a known reference ligand due to competition by the ligand under investigation.

OBI:0001543.label: purified MHC direct binding assay measuring equilibrium dissociation constant [KD] of a MHC:ligand complex approximated by EC50 using fluorescence detection
OBI:0001543.definition: A purified MHC ligand binding equilibrium dissociation constant (KD) determination assay that uses fluorescence detection to measure direct ligand binding and provides EC50 values determined under assay conditions where the EC50 approximates a KD value.

OBI:0001564.label: purified MHC competitive binding assay measuring equilibrium dissociation constant [KD] of a MHC:ligand complex approximated by IC50 using radioactivity detection
OBI:0001564.definition: A purified MHC ligand binding equilibrium dissociation constant (KD) determination assay that uses radioactivity detection to detect loss of binding of a known reference ligand due to competition by the ligand under investigation and provides IC50 values determined under assay conditions where the IC50 approximates a KD value.

OBI:0001559.label: cell bound MHC direct binding assay measuring half life of a MHC:ligand complex using fluorescence detection
OBI:0001559.definition: A cell bound MHC ligand half life of binding determination assay that uses fluorescence detection to measure direct ligand binding.

OBI:0001558.label: cell bound MHC direct binding assay measuring half life of a MHC:ligand complex using radioactivity detection
OBI:0001558.definition: A cell bound MHC ligand half life of binding determination assay that uses radioactivity detection to measure direct ligand binding.

OBI:0001565.label: cell lysate MHC direct binding assay measuring half life of a MHC:ligand complex using radioactivity detection
OBI:0001565.definition: A cell lysate MHC ligand half life of binding determination assay that uses radioactivity detection to measure direct ligand binding.

OBI:0001531.label: purified MHC direct binding assay measuring half life of a MHC:ligand complex using fluorescence detection
OBI:0001531.definition: A purified MHC ligand half life of binding determination assay that uses fluorescence detection to measure direct ligand binding.

OBI:0001586.label: purified MHC direct binding assay measuring half life of a MHC:ligand complex using radioactivity detection
OBI:0001586.definition: A purified MHC ligand half life of binding determination assay that uses radioactivity detection to measure direct ligand binding.

OBI:0001561.label: cell bound MHC direct binding assay measuring half maximal effective concentration [EC50] of a MHC:ligand complex using fluorescence detection
OBI:0001561.definition: A cell bound MHC ligand binding half maximal effective concentration (EC50) determination assay that uses fluorescence detection to measure direct ligand binding.

OBI:0001516.label: cell lysate MHC direct binding assay measuring half maximal effective concentration [EC50] of a MHC:ligand complex using radioactivity detection
OBI:0001516.definition: A cell lysate MHC ligand binding half maximal effective concentration (EC50) determination assay that uses radioactivity detection to measure direct ligand binding.

OBI:0001592.label: purified MHC direct binding assay measuring half maximal effective concentration [EC50] of a MHC:ligand complex using fluorescence detection
OBI:0001592.definition: A purified MHC ligand binding half maximal effective concentration (EC50) determination assay that uses fluorescence detection to measure direct ligand binding.

OBI:0001597.label: cell bound MHC competitive binding assay measuring half maximal inhibitory concentration [IC50] of a MHC:ligand complex using T cell epitope recognition
OBI:0001597.definition: A cell bound MHC ligand binding half maximal inhibitory concentration (IC50) determination assay that uses a T cell epitope recognition assay to measure ligand binding.

OBI:0001520.label: cell bound MHC competitive binding assay measuring half maximal inhibitory concentration [IC50] of a MHC:ligand complex using fluorescence detection
OBI:0001520.definition: A cell bound MHC ligand binding half maximal inhibitory concentration (IC50) determination assay that uses fluorescence detection to detect loss of binding of a known reference ligand due to competition by the ligand under investigation.

OBI:0001517.label: cell bound MHC competitive binding assay measuring half maximal inhibitory concentration [IC50] of a MHC:ligand complex using radioactivity detection
OBI:0001517.definition: A cell bound MHC ligand binding half maximal inhibitory concentration (IC50) determination assay that uses radioactivity detection to detect loss of binding of a known reference ligand due to competition by the ligand under investigation.

OBI:0001613.label: purified MHC competitive binding assay measuring half maximal inhibitory concentration [IC50] of a MHC:ligand complex using fluorescence detection
OBI:0001613.definition: A purified MHC ligand binding half maximal inhibitory concentration (IC50) determination assay that uses fluorescence detection to detect loss of binding of a known reference ligand due to competition by the ligand under investigation.

OBI:0001568.label: purified MHC competitive binding assay measuring half maximal inhibitory concentration [IC50] of a MHC:ligand complex using radioactivity detection
OBI:0001568.definition: A purified MHC ligand binding half maximal inhibitory concentration (IC50) determination assay that uses radioactivity detection to detect loss of binding of a known reference ligand due to competition by the ligand under investigation.

OBI:0001665.label: cell bound MHC direct binding assay measuring the off rate [koff] of a MHC:ligand complex using fluorescence detection
OBI:0001665.definition: A cell bound MHC ligand binding off rate measurement (koff) determination assay that uses fluorescence detection to measure direct ligand binding.

OBI:0001567.label: cell lysate MHC direct binding assay measuring binding off rate [koff] of a MHC:ligand complex using radioactivity detection
OBI:0001567.definition: A cell lysate MHC ligand binding off rate measurement (koff) determination assay that uses radioactivity detection to measure direct ligand binding.

OBI:0001569.label: purified MHC direct binding assay measuring binding off rate [koff] of a MHC:ligand complex using fluorescence detection
OBI:0001569.definition: A purified MHC ligand binding off rate measurement (koff) determination assay that uses fluorescence detection to measure direct ligand binding.

OBI:0001666.label: cell bound MHC direct binding assay measuring binding on rate [kon] of a MHC:ligand complex using fluorescence detection
OBI:0001666.definition: A cell bound MHC ligand binding on rate (kon) determination assay that uses fluorescence detection to measure direct ligand binding.

OBI:0001541.label: purified MHC direct binding assay measuring binding on rate [kon] of a MHC:ligand complex using fluorescence detection
OBI:0001541.definition: A purified MHC ligand binding on rate (kon) determination assay that uses fluorescence detection to measure direct ligand binding.

OBI:0001311.label: X-ray crystallography assay determining the 3D structure of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex
OBI:0001311.definition: A T cell epitope 3D structure determination assay that uses an X-ray crystallography assay.

OBI:0000634.label: DNA methylation profiling assay
OBI:0000634.definition: An assay that measures the state of methylation of DNA molecules using genomic DNA collected from a material entity using a range of techniques and instrument such as DNA sequencers and often relying on treatment with bisulfites to ensure cytosine conversion.

OBI:0002037.label: micrococcal nuclease digestion followed by tiling array assay
OBI:0002037.definition: An array based nucleic acid structure mapping assay that identifies nucleosome positions genome wide, by detection of regions protected by nucleosomes from digestion by micrococal nuclease using tiling array assays

OBI:0002111.label: enhanced cross-linking immunoprecipitation high-throughput sequencing assay
OBI:0002111.definition: An iCLIP assay that is enhanced to robustly identify protein-RNA interactions with high efficiency through improvements in library preparation of RNA fragments.

OBI:0001595.label: X-ray crystallography assay determining the 3D structure of a MHC:ligand complex
OBI:0001595.definition: A MHC binding 3D structure determination of MHC molecule:epitope complex assay that uses an X-ray crystallography assay.

OBI:0001484.label: biological activity assay measuring T cell epitope specific in vivo activity
OBI:0001484.definition: A T cell epitope dependent biological activity determination assay that uses an in vivo intervention experiment.

OBI:0001407.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific T cell activation
OBI:0001407.definition: A T cell epitope dependent biological activity assay that detects T cell activation.

OBI:0001495.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific T cell helper activity
OBI:0001495.definition: A T cell epitope dependent biological activity assay that detects the ability of epitope specific helper T cells to enhance either B cell or T cell adaptive immune response function.

OBI:1110130.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific T cell killing
OBI:1110130.definition: A T cell epitope dependent biological activity assay that detects the killing of an antigen presenting cell (APC) by a T cell whose TCR recognizes an epitope presented by the APC.

OBI:1110129.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific cytokine production by T cells
OBI:1110129.definition: A T cell epitope dependent biological activity assay that detects cytokine production.

OBI:0001269.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific cytotoxic T cell degranulation
OBI:0001269.definition: A T cell epitope dependent biological activity assay that detects cytotoxic T cell degranulation.

OBI:1110131.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific proliferation of T cells
OBI:1110131.definition: A T cell epitope dependent biological activity assay that detects T cell proliferation.

OBI:0002074.label: in vitro assay measuring T cell epitope specific suppression
OBI:0002074.definition: T cell epitope dependent biological activity assay that detects suppression of an in vitro response.

OBI:0002060.label: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 17 production by T cells
OBI:0002060.definition: An assay of epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 17 production by T cells that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.

OBI:0002067.label: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific macrophage migration inhibitory factor (MIF) production by T cells
OBI:0002067.definition: An assay of epitope specific macrophage migration inhibitory factor (MIF) production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.

OBI:0002068.label: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific oncostatin M production by T cells
OBI:0002068.definition: An assay of epitope specific oncostatin M production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.

OBI:0002100.label: assay measuring the association constant [KA] of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex
OBI:0002100.definition: A T cell epitope binding constant determination assay that measures the association constant KA.

OBI:0002097.label: assay measuring the dissociation constant [KD] of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex
OBI:0002097.definition: A T cell epitope binding constant determination assay that measures the dissociation constant KD.

OBI:0002099.label: assay measuring the off rate [koff] of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex
OBI:0002099.definition: A T cell epitope binding constant determination assay that measures the off rate.

OBI:0002098.label: assay measuring the on rate [kon] of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex
OBI:0002098.definition: A T cell epitope binding constant determination assay that measures the on rate.

OBI:1110150.label: 51 chromium assay measuring epitope specific T cell killing
OBI:1110150.definition: A T cell epitope specific killing assay performed in vitro that uses a chromium release assay.

OBI:1110180.label: 3H-thymidine assay measuring epitope specific proliferation of T cells
OBI:1110180.definition: A T cell epitope specific proliferation assay performed on cells in vitro that uses a tritiated thymidine incorporation assay.

OBI:1110181.label: BrdU assay measuring epitope specific proliferation of T cells
OBI:1110181.definition: A T cell epitope specific proliferation assay performed on cells in vitro that uses a BrdU incorporation assay.

OBI:0002096.label: carboxyfluorescein succinimidyl ester staining assay measuring epitope specific proliferation of T cells
OBI:0002096.definition: A T cell epitope specific proliferation assay performed on cells in vitro that uses a CFSE assay.

OBI:0001550.label: cell bound MHC binding assay measuring binding of a MHC:ligand complex
OBI:0001550.definition: A MHC binding qualitative binding to ligand assay measuring MHC ligand binding using MHC present on cells.

OBI:0001579.label: cell lysate MHC binding assay measuring binding of a MHC:ligand complex
OBI:0001579.definition: A MHC binding qualitative binding to ligand assay using MHC in a cell lysate.

OBI:0001555.label: purified MHC binding assay measuring binding of a MHC:ligand complex
OBI:0001555.definition: A MHC binding qualitative binding to ligand assay using MHC in a purified MHC molecule preparation.

OBI:0001492.label: in vivo assay measuring T cell epitope specific protection based on survival
OBI:0001492.definition: A T cell epitope in vivo intervention experiment that uses a protection from challenge in vivo intervention experiment based on survival.

OBI:0001475.label: in vivo assay measuring T cell epitope specific protection from infectious challenge based on pathogen burden
OBI:0001475.definition: A T cell epitope in vivo intervention experiment that uses a protection from challenge in vivo intervention experiment based on pathogen burden.

OBI:0001473.label: in vivo assay measuring T cell epitope specific protection from tumor challenge
OBI:0001473.definition: A T cell epitope in vivo intervention experiment that uses a protection from challenge in vivo intervention experiment based on tumor burden.

OBI:1110125.label: assay measuring MHC ligand processing and presentation
OBI:1110125.definition: A MHC ligand assay that determines what ligands are processed and loaded onto MHC molecules by eluting ligands and identifying them.

OBI:1110126.label: assay measuring binding of a MHC:ligand complex
OBI:1110126.definition: A MHC ligand assay that detects the binding of a ligand to an MHC molecule.

OBI:0002079.label: specimens collected in one encounter
OBI:0002079.definition: A collection of specimens that is collected from one source (e.g. one organism) during a time period which for the purpose of the study can be considered to be taken at the same sampling time.

OBI:0002081.label: specimens collected longitudinally
OBI:0002081.definition: A collection of specimens that was derived from the same source material entity at different time points in order to observe changes in that entity.

OBI:0002077.label: specimens derived from shared ancestor
OBI:0002077.definition: A collection of specimens derived from one common specimen via one or more material processing process(es).

OBI:0002080.label: human specimen set
OBI:0002080.definition: A specimen set that is collected from one person during a time period which for the purpose of the study can be considered to be taken at the same sampling time.

OBI:0002083.label: enhancer activity detection by reporter gene assay
OBI:0002083.definition: A reporter gene assay that detects expression of a reporter gene that was inserted under the control of an enhancer of interest.

OBI:0001002.label: Faraday cage
OBI:0001002.definition: A device formed by conducting material or by a mesh of such material, that blocks out external static electric fields.

OBI:0001046.label: bioreactor
OBI:0001046.definition: A device or system that supports a biologically active environment. ALAN SAYS NOT AN INSTRUMENT

OBI:0001076.label: incubator shaker
OBI:0001076.definition: An incubating device that provides shaking motion for biomedical applications (e.g., cell cultures).

OBI:0000945.label: vibration isolation table
OBI:0000945.definition: A device  that supports another device such as a precision instrument by isolating it from vibration that is transmitted from the floor.

OBI:0000404.label: gel dryer
OBI:0000404.definition: A gel dryer is a device which has the function to contain and to control the contained environment to facilitate the drying of gels

OBI:0400140.label: gel tank
OBI:0400140.definition: a device which holds a gel and running buffers to allow electrophoresis to be performed. A gel tank has the function to contain and to control the contained environment and transfer energy from an energy supply through the running buffers to the gel matrix and the material with charged molecules in an electric field across a porous matrix or medium with the objective to separate the charged molecules.

OBI:0400110.label: hybridization chamber
OBI:0400110.definition: A device which is used to maintain constant contact of a liquid on an array.  This can be either a glass vial or slide.

OBI:0400111.label: hybridization station
OBI:0400111.definition: A device which is used to maintain the temperature of one or more hybridization_chamber(s) at a defined, constant temperature.

OBI:0000136.label: incubator
OBI:0000136.definition: a device in which environmental conditions (light, photoperiod, temperature, humidity, etc.) can be controlled

OBI:0000389.label: isoelectric focusing device
OBI:0000389.definition: An isoelectric focusing device is a device in which isoelectric focusing can be performed. An isoelectric focussing device had the function to contain and control the contained environment and transfer electrical energy from a power supply to a separation medium and the charged material to be separated.

OBI:0000052.label: microarray platform
OBI:0000052.definition: A microarray platform is a platform that contains the instruments, software and reagents needed to perform a microarray protocol. definition_source: OBI.

OBI:0400119.label: microarray wash station
OBI:0400119.definition: a device that is used to wash Affymetrix-type arrays.

OBI:0400113.label: oligonucleotide synthesizer
OBI:0400113.definition: An instrument used to chemically synthesize oligonucleotides.

OBI:0400094.label: sheath tank
OBI:0400094.definition: Part of the fluidics system. The sheath tank is the vessel that holds the sheath fluid at a constant pressure, allowing for it to be pushed into the flow chamber at a constant rate. The sheath tank holds the pressurized sheath fluid.

OBI:0400120.label: temperature control bath
OBI:0400120.definition: A temperature_control_bath is a device that has the function to regulate the temperature of a material, the function to contain fluid and the function to vary and maintain the temperature of the contained fluid. Heat exchange (energy transfer) between the material and the heating element is facilitated via the contained fluid. A temperature_control_bath is composed of a container, a heating element and/or a cooling element and a means to adjust the needed temperature. In most cases also a timer and a means to stir the fluid is provided as well.

OBI:0400116.label: thermal cycler
OBI:0400116.definition: An instrument that is capable of repeatedly altering and maintaining specific temperatures for defined periods of time.

OBI:0000390.label: thermostatic circulator
OBI:0000390.definition: A thermostatic circulator is a device which cools or heats a circulating liquid. It has the function to contain control the contained environment and transfer energy from or to the circulating liquid

OBI:0400117.label: vacuum dryer
OBI:0400117.definition: An instrument which removes liquid by the application of negative pressure,  i.e. vacuum.

OBI:0002092.label: 3' rapid amplification of cDNA ends
OBI:0002092.definition: A rapid amplication of cDNA ends to amplify a mRNA sequence between a defined internal site and the 3' end of the mRNA.

OBI:0002091.label: 5' rapid amplification of cDNA ends
OBI:0002091.definition: A rapid amplication of cDNA ends to amplify a mRNA sequence between a defined internal site and the 5' end of the mRNA.

OBI:0002093.label: 5' RNA ligase mediated rapid amplification of cDNA ends
OBI:0002093.definition: A 5' rapid amplification pf cDNA ends that uses RNA ligase to add an RNA adapter oligonucleotide to intact 5' mRNA ends, allowing the amplification of cDNA only from full-length, capped mRNA.

OBI:0001229.label: plasmon resonance assay measuring the dissociation constant [KD] of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex
OBI:0001229.definition: A T cell epitope equilibrium dissociation constant (KD) determination assay that uses a surface plasmon resonance assay.

CHMO:0000089.label: confocal fluorescence microscopy
CHMO:0000089.definition: Microscopy where the specimen can be made to fluoresce (emit energy as visible light) by scanning a gas (Ar or Kr) laser spot of specific wavelength over its surface and using a spatial pinhole to eliminate out-of-focus fluorescence.

OBI:0001631.label: electron microscopy imaging assay
OBI:0001631.definition: An imaging assay in which an electrons are used to probe the density, shape and composition of an input material which are detected in an electron microscope and utilized to produce an image of the material.

CHMO:0000087.label: fluorescence microscopy
CHMO:0000087.definition: Any type of microscopy where the specimen can be made to fluoresce (emit energy as visible light) by illuminating it with light of specific wavelengths. These specimens are called fluorophores.

CHMO:0000102.label: light microscopy
CHMO:0000102.definition: Microscopy where the specimen is illuminated with visible light and a system of lenses is used to produce an image.

OBI:0002133.label: cytometric bead array assay measuring  epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 20 production by T cells
OBI:0002133.definition: An assay of epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 20 production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.

OBI:0002154.label: CMV antibody assay
OBI:0002154.definition: An antigen specific antibodies assay that is meant to detect antibodies that bind to cytomegalovirus (CMV) antigens.

OBI:0002152.label: EBV IgG antibody assay
OBI:0002152.definition: An antigen specific antibodies assay that is meant to detect immunoglobulin G (IgG) antibodies that bind to Epstein-Barr virus (EBV) antigens.

OBI:0002153.label: EBV IgM antibody assay
OBI:0002153.definition: An antigen specific antibodies assay that is meant to detect immunoglobulin M (IgM) antibodies that bind to Epstein-Barr virus (EBV) antigens.

OBI:0002151.label: HCV antibody assay
OBI:0002151.definition: An antigen specific antibodies assay that is meant to detect antibodies that bind to Hepatitis C virus (HCV) antigens.

OBI:0002146.label: HIV antibody assay
OBI:0002146.definition: An antigen specific antibodies assay that is meant to detect antibodies that bind to human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) antigens.

OBI:0002147.label: HIV group O antibody assay
OBI:0002147.definition: An antigen specific antibodies assay that is meant to detect antibodies that bind to human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) group O antigens.

OBI:0002150.label: core HBV IgM antibody assay
OBI:0002150.definition: An antigen specific antibodies assay that is meant to detectimmunoglobulin M (IgM) antibodies that bind to hepatitis B virus (HBV) core antigens.

OBI:0002149.label: core HBV antibody assay
OBI:0002149.definition: An antigen specific antibodies assay that is meant to detect antibodies that bind to hepatitis B virus (HBV) core antigens.

OBI:0002148.label: surface HBV antibody assay
OBI:0002148.definition: An antigen specific antibodies assay that is meant to detect antibodies that bind to hepatitis B virus (HBV) surface antigens.

OBI:0002170.label: genomic SELEX
OBI:0002170.definition: A systematic evolution of ligands by exponential enrichment assay that starts with a library derived from genomic DNA instead of synthetically derived random DNA molecules.

OBI:0002163.label: DNAse footprinting assay
OBI:0002163.definition: An enzymatic footprinting assay that determines protein-binding sites on DNA by identifying bound fragments that are protected from DNAse I-catalyzed hydrolysis

OBI:0001976.label: hydrogen/deuterium exchange footprinting assay
OBI:0001976.definition: A footprinting assay that uses a chemical reaction whereby a covalently bonded hydrogen atom is replaced by a deuterium atom, or vice versa in order to gather information about the solvent accessibility of parts of a molecule and thus its tertiary structure.

OBI:0002442.label: hydroxyl-radical footprinting assay
OBI:0002442.definition: A footprinting assay that uses the reaction of hydroxyl radicals with side-chain sites in molecules (proteins, DNA, etc)_ with the resultant mass shift demonstrating the site of modification, used to_ to asses the accessibility of that site.

OBI:0002443.label: methidiumpropyl-EDTA-iron(II) footprinting assay
OBI:0002443.definition: A footprinting assay that determines protein-binding sites on DNA by partial cleavage of ligand-protected DNA restriction fragments with methidium-propyl-EDTA (MPE). MPE-Fe(II) in the presence of oxygen efficiently catalyzes the non-specific clevage of DNA.

OBI:0002167.label: subcellular protein localization assay
OBI:0002167.definition: A protein localization assay that determines the specific subcellular location of a protein. The location is visualized through electron microscopy.

OBI:0002166.label: tissue-based protein localization assay
OBI:0002166.definition: A protein localization assay that determines the specific location of a protein in a living tissue sample.

OBI:0002179.label: cell-attached patch clamp assay
OBI:0002179.definition: A patch-clamp assay where the electrode is left in place on the cell, and the membrane patch has been left intact been perforated. This maintains the separation of the interior of the pipette to the intracellular space of the cell. Measurements made with this technique involve recording currents through multiple channels simultaneously, over the membrane of the entire cell.

OBI:0002180.label: inside-out patch clamp assay
OBI:0002180.definition: A patch-clamp assay where a patch of the membrane is attached to the patch pipette, detached from the rest of the cell, and the cytosolic surface of the membrane is exposed to the external media, or bath. This provides the experimenter has access to the intracellular surface of the membrane via the bath and can manipulate the environment at the intracellular surface of single ion channels. For example, channels that are activated by intracellular ligands can then be studied through a range of ligand concentrations.

OBI:0002181.label: outside-out patch clamp assay
OBI:0002181.definition: A patch-clamp assay where a patch of the membrane is attached to the patch pipette. In this configuration, the external surface of the cell membrane is exposed as the outside of the membrane patch relative to the patch electrode. An outside-out patch starts with a gigaohm seal in a whole-cell recording configuration. The electrode is slowly withdrawn from the cell, until a fragment of membrane bulges away from the cell, which detaches and reforms as a convex membrane on the end of the electrode, with the original external surface of the membrane facing outward from the electrode. This provides the experimenter with access to the extracellular surface of the membrane via the bath and can manipulate the environment at the extracellular surface of single ion channels.

OBI:0002178.label: whole-cell patch clamp assay
OBI:0002178.definition: A patch-clamp assay where the electrode is left in place on the cell, as in cell-attached recordings, but the membrane patch has been perforated, providing access from the interior of the pipette to the intracellular space of the cell. Measurements made with this technique involve recording currents through multiple channels simultaneously, over the membrane of the entire cell.

OBI:0002184.label: cut open oocyte voltage clamp assay
OBI:0002184.definition: The cut-open oocyte Vaseline gap (COVG) voltage-clamp technique is designed to solve weaknesses in the two elextrode voltage clamp by maximizing the benefits of the Xenopus oocyte expression system by improving on clamp speed, signal-to-noise ratio, and ability to effectively perfuse the oocyte. In this way, it was possible to combine the most popular transient expression system, and the associated benefits of molecular cloning and site-directed mutagenesis, with the superior voltage-clamp properties of cut-open cell techniques.

OBI:0002183.label: two electrode voltage clamp assay
OBI:0002183.definition: The two electrode voltage clamp (TEVC) method utilizes two low-resistance pipettes, one sensing voltage and the other injecting current. The microelectrodes are filled with conductive solution and inserted into the cell to artificially control membrane potential. The membrane acts as a dielectric as well as a resistor, while the fluids on either side of the membrane function as capacitors.[9] The microelectrodes compare the membrane potential against a command voltage, giving an accurate reproduction of the currents flowing across the membrane. Current readings can be used to analyze the electrical response of the cell to different applications. This technique is mainly used in the Oocyte preparation.

OBI:0002196.label: Sakura Low profile Accu-Edge microtome blade
OBI:0002196.definition: A microtome blade that is manufactured by Feather and is disposable. The ultra-sharp blades section specimens without striations, distortion or chattering.

OBI:0001891.label: sequencing facility organization
OBI:0001891.definition: An organization that provides sequence determination service

OBI:0002200.label: cannot be assessed determination
OBI:0002200.definition: A reason for lack of data item that is the negative output of a determination if assay will provide reliable results.

OBI:0002202.label: GX
OBI:0002202.definition: A cannot be assessed determination for histologic tumor grade.

OBI:0002204.label: pNX
OBI:0002204.definition: A cannot be assessed determination of pathologic staging of lymph nodes.

OBI:0002203.label: pTX
OBI:0002203.definition: A cannot be assessed determination for pathologic primary tumor staging.

OBI:0002216.label: histologic grade for ovarian tumor according to a two-tier grading system
OBI:0002216.definition: A histologic grade for ovarian tumor that is from a two-tier histological classification of tumors.

OBI:0002219.label: histologic grade for ovarian tumor according to the World Health Organization
OBI:0002219.definition: A histologic grade for ovarian tumor that is from a histological classification by the World Health Organization (WHO).

OBI:0002357.label: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group score value specification
OBI:0002357.definition: A performance status value specification designed by the Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group to assess disease progression and its affect on the daily living abilities of the patient.

OBI:0002363.label: Karnofsky score vaue specification
OBI:0002363.definition: A performance status value specification designed for classifying patients 16 years of age or older by their functional impairment.

OBI:0002373.label: aunt clinical history of cancer
OBI:0002373.definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in the female sibling of a parent.

OBI:0002374.label: brother clinical history of cancer
OBI:0002374.definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a male sibling.

OBI:0002375.label: daughter clinical history of cancer
OBI:0002375.definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a person's female child.

OBI:0002376.label: father clinical history of cancer
OBI:0002376.definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a male parent.

OBI:0002382.label: grandfather clinical history of cancer
OBI:0002382.definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a male parent of a parent.

OBI:0002381.label: grandmother clinical history of cancer
OBI:0002381.definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a female parent of a parent.

OBI:0002377.label: mother clinical history of cancer
OBI:0002377.definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a female parent.

OBI:0002383.label: nephew clinical history of cancer
OBI:0002383.definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a male child of a sibling.

OBI:0002384.label: niece clinical history of cancer
OBI:0002384.definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a female child of a sibling.

OBI:0002378.label: sister clinical history of cancer
OBI:0002378.definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a female sibling.

OBI:0002379.label: son clinical history of cancer
OBI:0002379.definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a person's male child.

OBI:0002380.label: uncle clinical history of cancer
OBI:0002380.definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a male sibling of a parent.

OBI:0002388.label: diagnosis of HIV
OBI:0002388.definition: A diagnosis of infectious disease caused by the human immunodeficiency virus (1 or 2).

OBI:0002386.label: diagnosis of hepatitis B
OBI:0002386.definition: A diagnosis of infectious disease caused by the hepatitis B virus.

OBI:0002387.label: diagnosis of hepatitis C
OBI:0002387.definition: A diagnosis of infectious disease caused by the hepatitis C virus.

OBI:0002392.label: exposure to second hand smoke in current household
OBI:0002392.definition: An exposure to second hand smoke in person's current household.

OBI:0002391.label: exposure to second hand smoke in household during childhood
OBI:0002391.definition: An exposure to second hand smoke that occurred in the (patient's) household when the person was a child.

OBI:0002398.label: hysterectomy history
OBI:0002398.definition: A gynecologic surgery history in which a woman has had a hysterectomy.

OBI:0002400.label: neither hysterectomy nor oophorectomy history
OBI:0002400.definition: A gynecologic surgery history in which a woman has not had either a hysterectomy or an oophorectomy.

OBI:0002399.label: unilateral oophorectomy history
OBI:0002399.definition: A gynecologic surgery history in which a woman has had a unilateral oophorectomy.

OBI:0002403.label: hormonal birth control current use history
OBI:0002403.definition: A hormonal birth control use history that indicates an individual is currently a hormonal birth control user.

OBI:0002402.label: hormonal birth control former use history
OBI:0002402.definition: A hormonal birth control use history that indicates an individual has previously been a hormonal birth control user but is not a current user.

OBI:0002404.label: no hormonal birth control use history
OBI:0002404.definition: A hormonal birth control use history that indicates an individual has not ever been a hormonal birth control user.

OBI:0002409.label: cream delivery form for hormonal replacement therapy
OBI:0002409.definition: A delivery form for hormonal replacement therapy that is a cream for transdermal administration.

OBI:0002408.label: patch delivery form for hormonal replacement therapy
OBI:0002408.definition: A delivery form for hormonal replacement therapy that is a patch for transdermal administration.

OBI:0002407.label: pill delivery form for hormonal replacement therapy
OBI:0002407.definition: A delivery form for hormonal replacement therapy that is a pill for oral administration.

OBI:0002411.label: indeterminate menopausal status
OBI:0002411.definition: A menopausal status that is neither pre- nor post-menopausal.

OBI:0002413.label: perimenopausal status
OBI:0002413.definition: A menopausal status indicating that it has been 6-12 months since last menstrual period.

OBI:0002414.label: postmenopausal status
OBI:0002414.definition: A menopausal status indicating that it has been more than 12 months since the last menstrual period with no prior hysterectomy or that there has been a prior bilateral oophorectomy.

OBI:0002412.label: premenopausal status
OBI:0002412.definition: A menopausal status indicating that less than 6 months has passed since the last menstrual period and there has not been prior bilateral oophorectomy and not on estrogen replacement.

OBI:0002416.label: exposure to arsenic history
OBI:0002416.definition: An exposure to environmental and workplace carcinogens history where the carcinogen is arsenic.

OBI:0002417.label: exposure to asbestos history
OBI:0002417.definition: An exposure to environmental and workplace carcinogens history where the carcinogen is asbestos.

OBI:0002419.label: exposure to chromium history
OBI:0002419.definition: An exposure to environmental and workplace carcinogens history where the carcinogen is chromium.

OBI:0002418.label: exposure to diesel exhaust history
OBI:0002418.definition: An exposure to environmental and workplace carcinogens history where the carcinogen is diesel exhaust.

OBI:0002420.label: exposure to silica history
OBI:0002420.definition: An exposure to environmental and workplace carcinogens history where the carcinogen is silica.

OBI:0001848.label: chromatin interaction analysis by paired-end tag sequencing assay
OBI:0001848.definition: An assay that incorporates chromatin immunoprecipitation (ChIP)-based enrichment, chromatin proximity ligation, Paired-End Tags, and high-throughput sequencing to determine de novo long-range chromatin interactions genome-wide.

OBI:0002439.label: chromosome conformation capture assay
OBI:0002439.definition: A nuclear ligation assay that detects chromosomal interactions between any two genomic loci. Chromatin segments are cross-linked, cut by restriction enzymes, ligated, and finally analyzed by PCR.

OBI:0002458.label: chromosome conformation capture-on-chip assay
OBI:0002458.definition: A nuclear ligation assay which uses cross-linking of proteins to proteins and DNA, followed by two rounds of digestion and ligation, inverse PCR, and characterization by microarray or DNA sequencing. This enables unbiased genome-wide screens for DNA contacts made by single genomic sites of interest.

OBI:0002440.label: Hi-C assay
OBI:0002440.definition: A chromosome conformation capture assay that detects genome-wide chromosomal interactions. High-throughput techniques are used to sequence the ligated fragments after cross-linking and cutting with restriction enzymes.

OBI:0000275.label: analyte role
OBI:0000275.definition: A measurand role borne by a molecular entity or an atom and realized in an analyte assay which achieves the objective to measure the magnitude/concentration/amount of the analyte in the entity bearing evaluant role.

OBI:0001997.label: hydrogen/deuterium exchange assay measuring binding of a B cell epitope:antibody complex
OBI:0001997.definition: A footprinting assay that uses hydrogen/deuterium exchange to measure B cell epitope qualitative binding to antibody.

OBI:0002450.label: hydroxyl-radical footprinting assay measuring binding of a B cell epitope:antibody complex
OBI:0002450.definition: A footprinting assay that uses hydroxyl-radical footprinting to measure B cell epitope qualitative binding to antibody.

OBI:0002451.label: ELISA measuring epitope specific interferon-alpha production by T cells
OBI:0002451.definition: An assay of epitope specific interferon-alpha production by T cells that uses an ELISA.

OBI:0002486.label: verse algorithm
OBI:0002486.definition: An alignment counting algorithm that assigns gene features to genomic alignments using a hierarchical assignment scheme, which allows simultaneous quantification of multiple feature types or annotation levels without repeatedly assigning reads.

OBI:0002470.label: bcl2fastq software application
OBI:0002470.definition: A base calling application that implments a base calling algorithm to convert BCL (binary base call) files generated by Illumina sequencing systems to standard FASTQ file formats for downstream analysis.

OBI:0002484.label: star algorithm
OBI:0002484.definition: A reference genome transcriptome alignment algorithm that is a standalone RNA-seq alignment algorithm that uses uncompressed suffix arrays and a mapping algorithm similar to those used in large-scale genome alignment tools to align RNA-seq reads to a genomic reference.

OBI:0002565.label: adapter-sequence trimming
OBI:0002565.definition: A data transformation in which adapter sequences at the end of a molecular sequence are cut (removed).

OBI:0002588.label: supervised machine learning
OBI:0002588.definition: A machine learning process using a function that maps an input to an output based on example input-output pairs. It infers a function from labeled training data consisting of a set of training examples.

OBI:0002589.label: unsupervised machine learning
OBI:0002589.definition: A machine learning process that infers a function describing the structure of "unlabeled" data (i.e. data that has not been classified or categorized).

OBI:0100014.label: chimera
OBI:0100014.definition: An organism which contains cells or tissues with a different genotype

OBI:1110026.label: host of immune response
OBI:1110026.definition: An organism in which an immune response process occurs.

OBI:0000925.label: infectious agent
OBI:0000925.definition: is a material entity bearing the disposition to infect an organism

OBI:0001185.label: selectively maintained organism
OBI:0001185.definition: An organism that is bred to have some uniform behavioral, morphological, physiological, or genetic characteristics with similarly bred organisms

OBI:0000909.label: cloacal specimen
OBI:0000909.definition:
A specimen obtained by inserting a swab deeply into the vent of the cloaca of
an organism and vigorously swabbing the wall. The swab should be deeply
stained with fecal material and is then placed in transport medium.

OBI:0000747.label: material sample
OBI:0000747.definition: A material entity that has the material sample role

OBI:0000917.label: nasal swab specimen
OBI:0000917.definition:
A specimen obtained using a cotton swab on a stick, passed up the nostril to obtain a sample of
exudate and epithelial debris for microbiological or cellular examination.

OBI:0000914.label: nasopharyngeal aspirate specimen
OBI:0000914.definition:
A speciemn which derives from nasopharyngeal mucosa after
aspiration.

OBI:0000680.label: whole organism preparation
OBI:0000680.definition: A material entity which is the output of a process in which one or more whole organisms are prepared in a way to make it easier to study them, and in which the great majority of organismal parts are maintained

OBI:0100067.label: bronchial alveolar lavage
OBI:0100067.definition: Group of biomaterials present in the bronchial aveolar space of an organism which are collected through lavage including the reagents used to for the lavage process, organisms, cells, and cellular secretions present in the bronchial aveolar space.

OBI:0001468.label: cell specimen
OBI:0001468.definition: A specimen primarily composed of a cell or cells collected from a multicellular organism or a cell culture.

OBI:0001479.label: specimen from organism
OBI:0001479.definition: A specimen that derives from an anatomical part or substance arising from an organism. Examples of tissue specimen include tissue, organ, physiological system, blood, or body location (arm).

OBI:0001472.label: specimen with known storage state
OBI:0001472.definition: A specimen for which it is known whether it has been subjected to storage of a specified type.

OBI:0001506.label: specimen with pre- or post-mortem status
OBI:0001506.definition: A specimen that has been established to be taken from a live (pre-mortem) or dead (post-mortem) organism.

OBI:0001905.label: secondary cultured cell population
OBI:0001905.definition: A cultured cell population that is derived through one or more passages in culture.

OBI:1110043.label: cultured adherent cell populaiton
OBI:1110043.definition: A mixed cell population that is characterized by its ability to bind to tissue culture flasks or plates. This population typically contains macrophages and other cells capable of playing the antigen presenting cell role.

OBI:0100063.label: cultured clonal cell population
OBI:0100063.definition: A cultured cell population comprised of cells which can all be traced back to a single ancestor cell, and which therefore can be treated as identical.

OBI:0001875.label: cultured immune cell population
OBI:0001875.definition: a cultured cell population comprised of a single type of immune system cell

OBI:0100061.label: primary cultured cell population
OBI:0100061.definition: A cultured cell population comprised of cells expanded directly from living tissue prior to being passaged.

OBI:0200201.label: ANOVA
OBI:0200201.definition: ANOVA or analysis of variance is a data transformation in which a statistical test of whether the means of several groups are all equal.

OBI:0000861.label: Likelihood-ratio test
OBI:0000861.definition: Likelihood-ratio is a data transformation which tests whether there is evidence of the need to move from a simple model to a more complicated one (where the simple model is nested within the complicated one); tests of the goodness-of-fit between two models.

OBI:0200150.label: MA transformation
OBI:0200150.definition: An MA transformation is a data transformation which takes as input a collection of data points (g_1, r_1), (g_2, r_2), ..., (g_n, r_n)  with the r_i and g_i positive real numbers, and whose output is the collection of data points (A_1, M_1), (A_2, M_2), ..., (A_n, M_n) where, for each i, A_i=(log(g_i)+log(r_i))/2 and M_i=log(r_i)-log(g_i). Here log denotes a logarithmic transformation.

OBI:0001028.label: feature extraction
OBI:0001028.definition: A planed process with objective of obtaining quantified values from an image.

OBI:0002566.label: file merge
OBI:0002566.definition: A data transformation in which data contained in 2 or more files are merged into a single file.

OBI:0000726.label: peak matching
OBI:0000726.definition: Peak matching is a data transformation performed on a dataset of a graph of ordered data points (e.g. a spectrum) with the objective of pattern matching local maxima above a noise threshold

OBI:0000988.label: performing a diagnosis
OBI:0000988.definition: The interpretation of the information available about bodily features (clinical picture) of a patient resulting in a diagnosis

OBI:0002585.label: sequence trimming
OBI:0002585.definition: A data transformation in which subsequences of a molecular sequence are cut (removed).

OBI:0200194.label: survival analysis data transformation
OBI:0200194.definition: A data transformation which has the objective of performing survival analysis.

OBI:0002136.label: RNA Integrity Number calculation
OBI:0002136.definition: A data transformation using the RIN algorithm to generate a quality measure of RNA based on features from an electrophoretic trace.

OBI:0200170.label: averaging data transformation
OBI:0200170.definition: An averaging data transformation is a data transformation that has objective averaging.

OBI:0000666.label: background correction data transformation
OBI:0000666.definition: A background correction data transformation (sometimes called supervised classification) is a data transformation that has the objective background correction.

OBI:0200181.label: center calculation data transformation
OBI:0200181.definition: A center calculation data transformation is a data transformation that has objective of center calculation.

OBI:0200175.label: class discovery data transformation
OBI:0200175.definition: A class discovery data transformation (sometimes called unsupervised classification) is a data transformation that has objective class discovery.

OBI:0000663.label: class prediction data transformation
OBI:0000663.definition: A class prediction data transformation (sometimes called supervised classification) is a data transformation that has objective class prediction.

OBI:0200072.label: curve fitting data transformation
OBI:0200072.definition: A curve fitting is a data transformation that has objective curve fitting and that consists of finding a curve which matches a series of data points and possibly other constraints.

OBI:0200125.label: data combination
OBI:0200125.definition: A data transformation in which individual input data elements and values are merged together into a output set of data elements and values.

OBI:0200061.label: data imputation
OBI:0200061.definition: Imputation is a means of filling in missing data values from a predictive distribution of the missing values.  The predictive distribution can be created either based on a formal statistical model (i,e, a multivariate normal distribution) or an algorithm.

OBI:0200156.label: data partitioning
OBI:0200156.definition: Data partitioning is a data transformation with the objective of partitioning or separating input data into output subsets.

OBI:0000707.label: decision tree building data transformation
OBI:0000707.definition: A decision tree building data transformation is a data transformation that has objective decision tree induction.

OBI:0200184.label: descriptive statistical calculation data transformation
OBI:0200184.definition: A descriptive statistical calculation data transformation is a data transformation that has objective descriptive statistical calculation and which concerns any calculation intended to describe a feature of a data set, for example, its center or its variability.

OBI:0000650.label: differential expression analysis data transformation
OBI:0000650.definition: A differential expression analysis data transformation is a data transformation that has objective differential expression analysis and that consists of

OBI:0200106.label: discriminant analysis
OBI:0200106.definition: Discriminant function analysis is used to determine which variables discriminate between two or more naturally occurring groups. Analysis is used to determine which variable(s) are the best predictors of a particular outcome.

OBI:0000668.label: error correction data transformation
OBI:0000668.definition: An error correction data transformation is a data transformation that has the objective of error correction, where the aim is to remove (correct for) erroneous contributions from the input to the data transformation.

OBI:0200082.label: longitudinal data analysis
OBI:0200082.definition: Longitudinal analysis is a data transformation used to perform repeated observations of the same items over long periods of time.

OBI:0200085.label: mass spectrometry analysis
OBI:0200085.definition: A data transformation which has the objective of spectrum analysis.

OBI:0200140.label: mathematical feature
OBI:0200140.definition: feature is a (parent_class) that describes a characteristic, trait or quality of a data transformation

OBI:0200080.label: network analysis
OBI:0200080.definition: A data transformation that takes as input data that describes biological networks in terms of the node (a.k.a. vertex) and edge graph elements and their characteristics and generates as output properties of the constituent nodes and edges, the sub-graphs, and the entire network.

OBI:0200097.label: non-negative matrix factorization
OBI:0200097.definition: Non negative matrix factorization is a data transformation in which factorises a matrix and which forces that all elements must be equal to or greater than zero.

OBI:0200169.label: normalization data transformation
OBI:0200169.definition: A normalization data transformation is a data transformation that has objective normalization.

OBI:0200171.label: partitioning data transformation
OBI:0200171.definition: A partitioning data transformation is a data transformation that has objective partitioning.

OBI:0200093.label: polynomial transformation
OBI:0200093.definition: A polynomial transformation is a data transformation that is obtained through a polynomial, where a polynomial is a mathematical expression involving a sum of powers in one or more variables multiplied by coefficients (e.g. see http://mathworld.wolfram.com/Polynomial.html). The number of variables and the degree are properties of a polynomial. The degree of a polynomial is the highest power of its terms, where the terms of a polynomial are the individual summands with the coefficients omitted.

OBI:0200052.label: probabilistic algorithm
OBI:0200052.definition: A probabilistic algorithm is one which involves an element of probability or randomness in the transformation of the data.

OBI:0200102.label: regression analysis method
OBI:0200102.definition: Regression analysis is a descriptive statistics technique that examines the relation of a dependent variable (response variable) to specified independent variables (explanatory variables). Regression analysis can be used as a descriptive method of data analysis (such as curve fitting) without relying on any assumptions about underlying processes generating the data.

OBI:0200185.label: scaling data transformation
OBI:0200185.definition: A scaling data transformation is a data transformation that has objective scaling.

OBI:0200187.label: sequence analysis data transformation
OBI:0200187.definition: A sequence analysis data transformation is a data transformation that has objective sequence analysis and has the aim of analysing ordered biological data for sequential patterns.

OBI:0001872.label: sequence assembly process
OBI:0001872.definition: A data transformation that assembles two or more individual sequence reads into contiguous sequences (i.e., contigs).

OBI:0200014.label: split-scale transformation
OBI:0200014.definition: A split-scale transformation is a data transformation which is an application of a function f described as follows to a (one dimensional) real number input. f(x)=a*x+b if x=for x>t; where log denotes a logarithmic transformation and a, b, c, d, r, t are real constants, with a, c, d, r, t positive, chosen so that f is continuous with a continuous derivative at the transition point t.

OBI:0200086.label: spread calculation data transformation
OBI:0200086.definition: A spread calculation is a data transformation that has objective spread calculation.

OBI:0000673.label: statistical hypothesis test
OBI:0000673.definition: A statistical hypothesis test data transformation is a data transformation that has objective statistical hypothesis test.

OBI:0200013.label: loess global transformation one-channel
OBI:0200013.definition: A loess global transformation one-channel is a loess global transformation in the special case where the input is the result of an MA transformation applied to intensities from two related one-channel assays.

OBI:0200015.label: loess global transformation two-channel
OBI:0200015.definition: A loess global transformation two-channel is a loess global transformation in the special case where the input the result of an MA transformation applied to intensities from the two channels of a two-channel assay.

OBI:0200018.label: loess group transformation one-channel
OBI:0200018.definition: A loess group transformation one-channel is a loess group transformation in the special case where the input is the result of an MA transformation applied to intensities from two related one-channel assays.

OBI:0200019.label: loess group transformation two-channel
OBI:0200019.definition: A loess group transformation two-channel is a loess group transformation in the special case where the input is the result of an MA transformation applied to intensities from the two channels of a two-channel assay.

OBI:0200010.label: loess scale group transformation one-channel
OBI:0200010.definition: A loess scale group transformation one-channel is a loess scale group transformation consisting in the application of a scale adjustment following a loess group transformation one-channel, to render the M group variances similar.

OBI:0200012.label: loess scale group transformation two-channel
OBI:0200012.definition: A loess scale group transformation two-channel is a loess scale group transformation consisting in the application of a scale adjustment following a loess group transformation two-channel, to render the M group variances similar.

OBI:0200154.label: agglomerative hierarchical clustering
OBI:0200154.definition: An agglomerative hierarchical clustering is a hierarchical clustering which starts with separate clusters and then successively combines these clusters until there is only one cluster remaining.

OBI:0200155.label: divisive hierarchical clustering
OBI:0200155.definition: A divisive hierarchical clustering is a hierarchical clustering which starts with a single cluster and then successively splits resulting clusters until only clusters of individual objects remain.

OBI:0200051.label: principal components analysis dimensionality reduction
OBI:0200051.definition: A principal components analysis dimensionality reduction is a dimensionality reduction achieved by applying principal components analysis and by keeping low-order principal components and excluding higher-order ones.

OBI:0200074.label: submatrix extraction
OBI:0200074.definition: A submatrix extraction is a projection whose input is a matrix and whose output is a matrix obtained by selecting certain rows and columns from the input. (Note that, if one represents the input matrix as a vector obtained by concatenating its rows, then extracting a submatrix is equivalent to projecting this vector into that composed by the entries belonging to the rows and columns of interest from the input matrix.)

OBI:0200053.label: expectation maximization
OBI:0200053.definition: EM is a probabilistic algorithm used to estimate the maximum likelihood of parameters from existing data where the model involves unobserved latent variables. The input to this method is the data model for which the estimation is performed over and the output is an approximated probability function.

OBI:0200055.label: dye swap merge
OBI:0200055.definition: A dye swap merge is a replicate analysis which takes as input data from paired two-channel microarray assays where the sample labeled with one dye in the first assay is labeled with the other dye in the second assay and vice versa. The output for each reporter is obtained by combining its (raw or possibly pre-processed) M values in the two assays, where the M value in an assay is defined as the difference of the log intensities in the two channels. This can be used as a normalization step, when appropriate assumptions are met.

OBI:0200023.label: loess global transformation
OBI:0200023.definition: A loess global transformation is a loess transformation where only one loess fitting is performed, utilizing one subset of (or possibly all of) the data points in the input so that there is only one resulting loess curve y=f(x) which is used for the transformation.

OBI:0200024.label: loess group transformation
OBI:0200024.definition: A loess group transformation is a loess transformation where the input is partitioned into groups and for each group a loess fitting is performed, utilizing a subset of (or possibly all of) the data points in that group. Thus, a collection of loess curves y=f_i(x) is generated, one per group. Each (x, y) in the input is transformed into (x, y-f_i(x)), where f_i(x) is the curve corresponding to the group to which that data point belongs.

OBI:0200006.label: biexponential transformation
OBI:0200006.definition: A biexponential transformation is a data transformation that, for each (one dimensional) real number input x, outputs an approximation (found, e.g. with the Newton's method) to a solution y of the equation B(y)-x=0, where B denotes a b transformation.

OBI:0200116.label: loess fitting
OBI:0200116.definition: A loess fitting is a curve fitting obtained by localized regression. The latter refers to fitting a polynomial (straight line, quadratic, cubic, etc) to data values within a window covering a fraction of the total number of observations. As the window slides along the axis, a new polynomial is fit to the observations falling within the window. This continues until all points are fit with a local polynomial. The results are then smoothed together to form a curve. The smoothness of loess fits is controlled by a smoothing parameter (often denoted as alpha, usually between 1/4 and 1) and the degree of the polynomial that is fitted by the method (usually denoted by lambda).

OBI:0200004.label: log-log curve fitting
OBI:0200004.definition: A log-log curve fitting is a curve fitting where first a logarithmic transformation is applied both to the x and the y coordinates of the input data points (x_1, y_1), (x_2, y_2), ..., (x_n, y_n), and then coefficients a and b are determined to optimize the fit of log(y)=a+b*log(x) to these input data points.

OBI:0200002.label: logistic-log curve fitting
OBI:0200002.definition: A logistic-log curve fitting is a curve fitting where a curve of the form y=d+((a-d)/(1+(x/c)^b)) is obtained, where a, b, c, and d are determined so to optimize its fit to the input data points (x_1, y_1), (x_2, y_2), ..., (x_n, y_n).

OBI:0200003.label: logit-log curve fitting
OBI:0200003.definition: A logit-log curve fitting is a curve fitting where first the limits y_0 an y_infty of y when x->0 and x->infinity, respectively, are estimated from the input data points (x_1, y_1), (x_2,y_2), ..., (x_n, y_n). Then a curve with equation log((y-y_0)/(y_infty-y))=a+b log(x) is obtained, where a and b are determined to optimize its fit to the input data points.

OBI:0200066.label: Holm-Bonferroni family-wise error rate correction method
OBI:0200066.definition: a data transformation that performs more than one hypothesis test simultaneously, a closed-test procedure, that  controls the familywise error rate for all the k hypotheses at level α in the strong sense. Objective: multiple testing correction

OBI:0200092.label: Westfall and Young family wise error rate correction
OBI:0200092.definition: Is a data transformation process in which the Westfall and Young method is applied with the aim of controlling for multiple testing

OBI:0200076.label: column submatrix extraction
OBI:0200076.definition: A column submatrix extraction is a submatrix extraction where all the rows of the input matrix are retained and selection only occurs on the columns.

OBI:0200075.label: row submatrix extraction
OBI:0200075.definition: A row submatrix extraction is a submatrix extraction where all the columns of the input matrix are retained and selection only occurs on the rows.

OBI:0200135.label: edge quality calculation
OBI:0200135.definition: A network analysis in which an input data set describing node objects and edge relationships between node objects is used to determine the output quality of one of the edge relationships in the network.

OBI:0200070.label: edge weighting
OBI:0200070.definition: Edge weighting is the substitution or transformation of edge length using numerical data.  Data input include a symmetric adjacency matrix for a network and a second data set, for example a list of interactor pairs and a confidence score associated with the experimental detection of each pair's interaction.  Each element in the adjacency matrix is transformed or replaced with the corresponding number in the second data set.  Output data are a modified adjacency matrix reflecting the transformed state of the network.

OBI:0200040.label: modular decomposition
OBI:0200040.definition: Molecular decomposition is the partition of a network into distinct subgraphs for the purpose of identifying functional clusters. The network data is run through any of several existing algorithms designed to partition a network into distinct subgraphs for the purpose of isolating groups of functionally linked biological elements such as proteins.

OBI:0200126.label: network graph construction
OBI:0200126.definition: A network analysis in which an input data set describing objects and relationships between objects is transformed into an output representation of these objects as nodes and the relationships as edges of a network graph.

OBI:0200147.label: network graph quality calculation
OBI:0200147.definition: A network analysis in which an input data set describing node objects and edge relationships between node objects is used to determine the output quality of the network as a whole.

OBI:0200137.label: network subgraph quality calculation
OBI:0200137.definition: A network analysis in which an input data set describing node objects and edge relationships between node objects is used to determine the output quality of a subgraph partition of the network.

OBI:0200129.label: node quality calculation
OBI:0200129.definition: A network analysis in which an input data set describing node objects and edge relationships between node objects is used to determine the output quality of one of the node objects in the network.

OBI:0200199.label: gas chromatography mass spectrometry
OBI:0200199.definition:
Gas chromatography mass spectrometry is a data transformation combining mass spectrometry and  
gas chromatography for the qualitative as well as quantitative  
determinations of compounds.

OBI:0200198.label: tandem mass spectrometry
OBI:0200198.definition: Tandem mass spectrometry is a data transformation that uses two or more analyzers separated by a region in which ions can be induced to fragment by transfer of energy (frequently by collision with other molecules).

OBI:0200064.label: centroid mass spectrum
OBI:0200064.definition: A centroid mass spectrum is a data transformation in which many points are used to delineate a mass spectral peak, is converted into mass-centroided data by a data compression algorithm. The centroided mass peak is located at the weighted center of mass of the profile peak. The normalized area of the peak provides the mass intensity data.

OBI:0200063.label: characteristic path length calculation
OBI:0200063.definition: Quantifying subgraph navigability based on shortest-path length averaged over all pairs of subgraph vertices

OBI:0200062.label: continuum mass spectrum
OBI:0200062.definition: A continuum mass spectrum is a data transformation that contains the full profile of the detected signals for a given ion.

OBI:0200122.label: interquartile-range calculation
OBI:0200122.definition: The interquartile range is a descriptive statistics calculation defined as the difference between the 0.75 quantile and the 0.25 quantile for a set of data.

OBI:0200124.label: kurtosis calculation
OBI:0200124.definition: A kurtosis calculation is a descriptive statistics calculation defined as a parameter that measures how large or small the tails of a distribution are relative to the mean.  For details, see http://davidmlane.com/hyperstat/A53638.html

OBI:0200121.label: standard deviation calculation
OBI:0200121.definition: A standard deviation calculation is a descriptive statistics calculation defined as the square root of the variance.  Also thought of as the average distance of each value to the mean.

OBI:0200120.label: variance calculation
OBI:0200120.definition: A variance calculation is a descriptive statistics calculation in which the variance is defined as the average squared distance of each observation in the data set to the mean of the data set.  It is also known as the second central moment.

OBI:0200163.label: false discovery rate correction method
OBI:0200163.definition: The false discovery rate is a  data transformation used in multiple hypothesis testing to correct for multiple comparisons. It controls the expected proportion of incorrectly rejected null hypotheses (type I errors) in a list of rejected hypotheses. It is a less conservative comparison procedure with greater power than familywise error rate (FWER) control, at a cost of increasing the likelihood of obtaining type I errors. .

OBI:0200073.label: family wise error rate correction method
OBI:0200073.definition: A family wise error rate correction method is a multiple testing procedure that controls the probability of at least one false positive.

OBI:0200160.label: generalized family wise error rate correction method
OBI:0200160.definition: A generalized FWER correction method is a multiple testing procedure that controls the probability of at least k+1 false positives, where k is a user-supplied integer.

OBI:0200164.label: proportion of expected false positives correction method
OBI:0200164.definition: A proportion of expected false positives correction method is a multiple testing procedure that controls the ratio of the expected value of the numbers of false positives to the expected value of the numbers of rejected hypotheses.

OBI:0200161.label: quantile number of false positives correction method
OBI:0200161.definition: A quantile number of false positives correction method is a MTP that controls for the pth quantile of the distribution of the number of false positives out of the total number of tests performed'

OBI:0200165.label: quantile proportion of false positives correction method
OBI:0200165.definition: A quantile proportion of false positives correction method is a multiple testing procedure that controls the pth quantile of the distribution of the proportion of false positives among the rejected hypothesis (false discovery rate).

OBI:0200162.label: tail probability for the proportion of false positives correction method
OBI:0200162.definition: A TPPFP correction method is a MTP that controls the probability that the proportion of false positives among all rejected hypotheses is no greater than a constant q, where q is between 0 and 1.

OBI:0200020.label: homogeneous polynomial transformation
OBI:0200020.definition: A homogeneous polynomial transformation is a polynomial transformation where all the term of the polynomial have the same degree.

OBI:0200103.label: multiple linear regression analysis
OBI:0200103.definition:
multiple linear regression is a regression method that models the relationship between a dependent variable Y, independent variables Xi, i = 1, ..., p, and a random term epsilon. The model can be written as
    Y = \beta_0 + \beta_1 X_1 + \beta_2 X_2 + \cdots +\beta_p X_p + \varepsilon
where \beta_0 =  0 is the intercept ("constant" term), the \beta_i s  are the respective parameters of independent variables, and p is the number of parameters to be estimated in the linear regression.

OBI:0200105.label: partial least square regression analysis
OBI:0200105.definition:
