OBI:0001278.definition: A study design in which the methylation state of DNA is determined and is compared between samples using array technology.

OBI:0001435.label: DNA methylation profiling by high throughput sequencing design
OBI:0001435.definition: A study design in which the methylation state of DNA is determined and is compared between samples using high throughput sequencing technology.

OBI:0001306.label: RNA stability design
OBI:0001306.definition: A study design that examines the stability and/or decay of RNA transcripts.

OBI:0001286.label: RNAi profiling by array design
OBI:0001286.definition: A study design in which experiment double stranded RNA is synthesized with a sequence complementary to a gene(s) of interest and introduced into a cell or organism, where it is recognized as exogenous genetic material and activates the RNAi pathway resulting in knockdown of the transcripts and providing a means to study downstream changes in gene expression.

OBI:0001440.label: all pairs design
OBI:0001440.definition: A study design in which all specimens are compared to every other specimen.

OBI:0001252.label: array platform variation design
OBI:0001252.definition: A study design in which the array platform is compared, e.g. Agilent versus Affymetrix.

OBI:0001205.label: cell component comparison design
OBI:0001205.definition: A study design that compares samples from different cell components.

OBI:0001409.label: cell cycle design
OBI:0001409.definition: A study design that assays events that occur in relation to the cell cycle, which is the period between the formation of a cell, by division of its mother cell and the time when the cell itself divides to form two daughter cells.

OBI:0001429.label: cell differentiation design
OBI:0001429.definition: A study design that assays events associated with cell development or differentiation.

OBI:0001411.label: cell type comparison design
OBI:0001411.definition: A study design that compares cells of different type, for example different cell lines.

OBI:0001365.label: cellular process design
OBI:0001365.definition: A study design that aims to study the processes that are carried out at the cellular level, but are not necessarily restricted to a single cell. For example, cell communication occurs among more than one cell, but occurs at the cellular level.

OBI:0001337.label: clinical history design
OBI:0001337.definition: A study design that the organism's clinical history of diagnosis, treatments, e.g. vaccinations, surgery etc. is studied.

OBI:0500001.label: clinical study design
OBI:0500001.definition: Plan for the precise procedure to be followed in a clinical trial, including planned and actual timing of events, choice of control group, method of allocating treatments, blinding methods; assigns a subject to pass through one or more epochs in the course of a trial. Specific design elements, e.g., crossover, parallel; dose-escalation [Modified from Pocock, Clinical Trials: A Practical Approach]

OBI:0001197.label: comparative genome hybridization by array design
OBI:0001197.definition: A study design that detects genomic copy number variations using microarray technology.

OBI:0001293.label: disease state design
OBI:0001293.definition: A study design in which the pathological condition of a part, organ, or system of an organism is studied. The etiology may be from infection, genetic defect, or environmental stress.

OBI:0500017.label: dye swap design
OBI:0500017.definition: An experiment design type where the label orientations are reversed. exact synonym: flip dye, dye flip

OBI:0001226.label: environmental history design
OBI:0001226.definition: A study design in which some aspect of the organism's environmental history is studied, such as exposure to teratogen, radiation, climate etc.

OBI:0001211.label: ex vivo design
OBI:0001211.definition: A study design where all or part of an organism is removed and studied in vitro, e.g. part of a mouse is removed and cultured in vitro. A cell culture with an established cell line is an in vitro experiment.

OBI:0500014.label: factorial design
OBI:0500014.definition: factorial design is_a study design which is used to evaluate two or more factors simultaneously. The treatments are combinations of levels of the factors. The advantages of factorial designs over one-factor-at-a-time experiments is that they are more efficient and they allow interactions to be detected. In statistics, a factorial design experiment is an experiment whose design consists of two or more factors, each with discrete possible values or levels, and whose experimental units take on all possible combinations of these levels across all such factors. Such an experiment allows studying the effect of each factor on the response variable, as well as the effects of interactions between factors on the response variable.

OBI:0001329.label: family history design
OBI:0001329.definition: A study design in which the family history such as traits, characteristics, susceptibility to disease is studied.

OBI:0001444.label: genotyping design
OBI:0001444.definition: A study design that classifies an individual or group of individuals on the basis of alleles, haplotypes, SNPs.

OBI:0001957.label: hardware testing design
OBI:0001957.definition: A study design that aims to compare different types of hardware for performance, reproducibility, accuracy and precision.

OBI:0001408.label: imprinting design
OBI:0001408.definition: A study design where differences in genetic imprinting of maternally- and paternally-inherited chromosomes (e.g., due to in vivo differences in chemical modification and/or chromatin structure) are compared.

OBI:0001285.label: in vitro design
OBI:0001285.definition: A study design that is done in a test tube or a culture dish, e.g. A bacterial invasion assay in an established cell culture.

OBI:0001199.label: in vivo design
OBI:0001199.definition: A study design that is conducted entirely in a living organism, e.g. a compound treatment in a mouse model.

OBI:0001448.label: individual genetic characteristics comparison design
OBI:0001448.definition: A study design where genotype, haplotype, or other individual genetic characteristics are compared.

OBI:0001374.label: injury design
OBI:0001374.definition: A study design in which the response of an organism(s) to injury or damage is studied.

OBI:0001202.label: innate behavior design
OBI:0001202.definition: A study design in which the innate behavior of the organism is examined, e.g. path finding in bees.

OBI:0000115.label: intervention design
OBI:0000115.definition: An intervention design is a study design in which a controlled process applied to the subjects (the intervention) serves as the independent variable manipulated by the experimentalist. The treatment (perturbation or intervention) defined can be defined as a combination of values taken by independent variable manipulated by the experimentalists are applied to the recruited subjects assigned (possibly by applying specific methods) to treatment groups. The specificity of intervention design is the fact that independent variables are being manipulated and a response of the biological system is evaluated via response variables as monitored by possibly a series of assays.

OBI:0500009.label: loop design
OBI:0500009.definition: A loop experiment design is where labeled extracts are compared in consecutive pairs. synonym: circular design

OBI:0500005.label: matched pairs design
OBI:0500005.definition: A matched pair design is a study design which use groups of individuals associated (hence matched) to each other based on a set of criteria, one member going to one treatment, the other member receiving the other treatment.

OBI:0001323.label: microRNA profiling by array design
OBI:0001323.definition: A study design in which a microRNA array is used to analyse the microRNA component of the transcriptome.

OBI:0001214.label: normalization testing design
OBI:0001214.definition: A study design that tests different normalization procedures.

OBI:0300311.label: observation design
OBI:0300311.definition: observation design is a study design in which subjects are monitored in the absence of any active intervention by experimentalists.

OBI:0001195.label: operator variation design
OBI:0001195.definition: A study design that assesses the operator performance and relation to data consistency and quality.

OBI:0001432.label: operon identification design
OBI:0001432.definition: A study design that identifies locations and members of operons in a genome.

OBI:0001328.label: organism development design
OBI:0001328.definition: A study design that assays events associated with development. Development applies to organism(s) acquiring a mature state.

OBI:0001422.label: organism part comparison design
OBI:0001422.definition: A study design that compares tissues, regions, organs within or between organisms

OBI:0001377.label: organism status comparison design
OBI:0001377.definition: A study design that compares samples from live and dead organisms.

OBI:0500006.label: parallel group design
OBI:0500006.definition: A parallel group design or independent measure design is a study design which uses unique experimental unit each experimental group, in other word no two individuals are shared between experimental groups, hence also known as parallel group design. Subjects of a treatment group receive a unique combination of independent variable values making up a treatment

OBI:0001454.label: pathogenicity design
OBI:0001454.definition: A study design in which an infective agent such as a bacterium, virus, protozoan, fungus etc. infects a host organism(s) and the infective agent is assayed.

OBI:0001425.label: protein binding site identification design
OBI:0001425.definition: A study design that investigates protein binding sites on nucleic acids.

OBI:0001441.label: proteomic profiling by array design
OBI:0001441.definition: A study design in which proteins in a sample are detected, quantified or otherwise analysed, through an array-based technology.

OBI:0001401.label: protocol optimization design
OBI:0001401.definition: A study design where different protocols or protocol parameters are compared aims to find an optimized protocol

OBI:0001336.label: quality control testing design
OBI:0001336.definition: A study design in which some aspects of the experiment is quality controlled for the purposes of quality assurance.

OBI:0500010.label: reference design
OBI:0500010.definition: A reference experiment design type is where all samples are compared to a common reference.

OBI:0500018.label: replicate design
OBI:0500018.definition: A replicate experimental design type is where a series of replicates are performed to evaluate reproducibility or as a pilot study to determine the appropriate number of replicates for a subsequent experiments.

OBI:0500019.label: self vs self design
OBI:0500019.definition: A study design that investigates variance and error estimates in the experimental system, and is where the same extract is compared.

OBI:0001426.label: sex comparison design
OBI:0001426.definition: A study design that assays differences associated with an organism's sex, gender or mating type.

OBI:0001310.label: species comparison design
OBI:0001310.definition: A study design that assays differences between distinct species.

OBI:0001464.label: strain comparison design
OBI:0001464.definition: A study design that assays differences between multiple strains, cultivars, serovars, isolates, lines from organisms of a single species.

OBI:0500020.label: time series design
OBI:0500020.definition: Groups of assays that are related as part of a time series.

OBI:0001313.label: transcription profiling by RT-PCR design
OBI:0001313.definition: A study design which aims to examine the transcriptome of a biological sample by reverse transcription PCR (RT-PCR).

OBI:0001290.label: transcription profiling by array design
OBI:0001290.definition: A study design that identifies forms and abundance of transcripts in the genome using microarray technology.

OBI:0001239.label: transcription profiling by high throughput sequencing design
OBI:0001239.definition: A study design in which sequencing technology (e.g. Solexa/454) is used to generate RNA sequence, analyse the transcibed regions of the genome, and/or to quantitate transcript abundance

OBI:0001427.label: transcription profiling by tiling array design
OBI:0001427.definition: A study design in which gene expression on a genome-wide basis is evaluated, without bias toward coding or noncoding regions, using tiling arrays containing oligonucleotides that are either overlapping or spaced at regular intervals.

OBI:0001430.label: transcription profiling design
OBI:0001430.definition: A study design that identifies forms and abundance of transcripts in the genome.

OBI:0001410.label: translation profiling design
OBI:0001410.definition: A study design in which surface-bound, translationally competent ribosome complexes are used to generate a translation profile for mRNA, where mRNA may be a single molecular species, or a combination of species, including complex mixtures such as those found in the set of mRNAs isolated from a cell or tissue. One or more components of the surface-bound ribosome complex may be labeled at specific positions to permit analysis of multiple or single molecules for determination of ribosomal conformational changes and translation kinetics. Translation profiles are used as the basis for comparison of an mRNA or set of mRNA species. The translation profile can be used to determine such characteristics as kinetics of initiation, kinetic of elongation, identity of the polypeptide product, and the like. Analysis of translation profiles may be used to determine differential gene expression, optimization of mRNA sequences for expression, screening drug candidates for an effect on translation.

OBI:0001259.label: translational bias design
OBI:0001259.definition: A study design that characterizes the association of transcripts and translation machinery.

OBI:0001166.label: validation by real time PCR design
OBI:0001166.definition: a study design in which the accuracy or the quality of the result of an assay is checked by comparing with real time PCR results

OBI:0001162.label: validation by reverse transcription PCR design
OBI:0001162.definition: a study design in which checks the accuracy or the quality of the result of an assay  by comparing with reverse transcription PCR results

OBI:0500003.label: cross over design
OBI:0500003.definition: a repeated measure design which ensures that experimental units receive, in sequence, the treatment (or the control), and then, after a specified time interval (aka *wash-out periods*), switch to the control (or treatment). In this design, subjects (patients in human context) serve as their own controls, and randomization may be used to determine the ordering which a subject receives the treatment and control

OBI:0500004.label: n-to-1 design
OBI:0500004.definition: N-of-1 design is a cross-over design in which the same patient is repeatedly randomised to receive either the experimental treatment or its control (Senn, 1993).

OBI:0500012.label: graeco latin square design
OBI:0500012.definition: Greco-Latin square design is a study design which relates to Latin square design

OBI:0500011.label: latin square design
OBI:0500011.definition: Latin square design is_a study design which allows in its simpler form controlling 2 levels of nuisance variables (also known as blocking variables).he 2 nuisance factors are divided into a tabular grid with the property that each row and each column receive each treatment exactly once.

OBI:0500015.label: 2x2 factorial design
OBI:0500015.definition: a factorial design which has 2 experimental factors (aka independent variables) and 2 factor levels per experimental factors

OBI:0500008.label: balanced incomplete block design
OBI:0500008.definition: balanced incomplete block design is a kind of factorial design where all treatment pairs occur together within a block an equal number ?? times. ??ii' is the number of times treatment i occurs with i'

OBI:0500016.label: fractional factorial design
OBI:0500016.definition: A fractional factorial design is_a study design in which only an adequately chosen fraction of the treatment combinations required for the complete factorial experiment is selected to be run

OBI:0500024.label: standard compliance rule
OBI:0500024.definition: a  standard compliance rule is a compliance rule which defines conformity to a representation standard

OBI:0500025.label: ethical standard compliance rule
OBI:0500025.definition: an ethical standard compliance rule is_a *compliance rule* which enable a  *ethical compliance process* to occur

OBI:0500028.label: exclusion criterion
OBI:0500028.definition: an exclusion criterion (rule) is_a *eligibility criterion*  which defines and states a condition which, if met, makes an entity unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process. For instance, in a study protocol, exclusion criteria indicate the conditions that prospective subjects SHOULD NOT meet to be eligible for participation in a study

OBI:0500027.label: inclusion criterion
OBI:0500027.definition: an inclusion criterion (rule) is_a *eligibility criterion*  which defines and states a condition which, if met, makes an entity suitable for a given task or participation in a given process. For instance, in a study protocol, inclusion criteria indicate the conditions that prospective subjects MUST meet to be eligible for participation in a study.

OBI:0002428.label: BMI range inclusion criterion
OBI:0002428.definition: An inclusion criterion that defines and states a Body Mass Index range, which if met, makes an individual suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

OBI:0002423.label: age of majority inclusion criterion
OBI:0002423.definition: An inclusion criterion that uses the age of majority for a state or institution, where one is generally considered to be an adult, which if met, makes an individual suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

OBI:0002555.label: age group inclusion criterion
OBI:0002555.definition: An inclusion criterion that defines and states an age bracket which, if met, makes an entity suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

OBI:0002455.label: clinically relevant exposure inclusion criterion
OBI:0002455.definition: An inclusion criterion that defines and states one or more clinically relevant histories of exposure of an entity, which, if met, makes the entity suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

OBI:0002454.label: clinically relevant lifestyle inclusion criterion
OBI:0002454.definition: An inclusion criterion that defines and states one or more clinically relevant planned processes that a human being actively participates in , which, if met, makes the human being suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

OBI:0002562.label: country of residence inclusion criteria
OBI:0002562.definition: An inclusion criterion that defines and states one or more countries of residence which, if met, makes a human being suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

OBI:0002460.label: defined population inclusion criterion
OBI:0002460.definition: An inclusion criterion that is based on fitting within the defined characteristics of a population based study design.

OBI:0002563.label: ethnicity inclusion criterion
OBI:0002563.definition: An inclusion criteria that defines and states one or more ethnicities which, if met, makes an entity suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

OBI:0002560.label: family status inclusion criterion
OBI:0002560.definition: An inclusion criterion that defines and states one or more family statuses, which, if met, makes a human being suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

OBI:0002456.label: gravidity inclusion criterion
OBI:0002456.definition: An inclusion criterion that defines and states one or more gravidity statuses of an organism, which, if met, makes the entity suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

OBI:0002453.label: health status inclusion criterion
OBI:0002453.definition: An inclusion criterion that defines and states one or more clinically significant bodily components, dispositions, and/or bodily processes of an entity that are inferred from relevant clinical findings or self-reported, which, if met, makes the entity suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

OBI:0002559.label: hospital patient inclusion criterion
OBI:0002559.definition: An inclusion criterion defines that a human being has to be a hospital patient to be suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

OBI:0002561.label: sex inclusion criterion
OBI:0002561.definition: An inclusion criterion that defines and states one or more sexes which, if met, makes an entity suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

OBI:0002558.label: use of medication inclusion criterion
OBI:0002558.definition: An inclusion criterion that defines and states a a set of medications, which, if used by an entity, makes that entity suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

OBI:0002426.label: chemotherapy treatment within the recent past exclusion criterion
OBI:0002426.definition: An exclusion criterion that defines whether chemotherapy was received within a certain timeframe, which when met, makes an individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

OBI:0002427.label: radiation treatment within the recent past exclusion criterion
OBI:0002427.definition: An exclusion criterion that defines whether radiation was received within a certain timeframe, which when met, makes an individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

OBI:0002434.label: HIV exclusion criterion
OBI:0002434.definition: An exclusion criterion defined  as whether an individual has a history of repeatedly reactive screening assays for HIV-1 or HIV-2 antibody regardless of the results of supplemental assays, which if met, makes the individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

OBI:0002429.label: blood transfusion exclusion criterion
OBI:0002429.definition: An exclusion criterion that is defined by whether the specimen donor received a whole blood transfusion within a specified time frame prior to death, which if met, makes a specimen donor unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

OBI:0002424.label: chemotherapy treatment exclusion criterion
OBI:0002424.definition: An exclusion criterion that defines whether chemotherapy was received or is being received for a previous  or current cancer, which when met, makes an individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process

OBI:0002435.label: exposure to blood borne infectious disease exclusion criterion
OBI:0002435.definition: An exclusion criterion defined  as whether an individual has been exposed to a blood borne infections disease through needle sticks and/or contact with non-intact skin and/or contact with open wounds and/or contact with mucous membranes, which if met, makes the individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

OBI:0002430.label: history of metastatic cancer exclusion criterion
OBI:0002430.definition: An exclusion criterion defined as whether an individual has ever been diagnosed with metastatic cancer (cancer that spread beyond the initial site such as to other organs like brain bone or liver), which if met, makes the individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

OBI:0002432.label: history of sex with someone with a history of blood borne infection  exclusion criterion
OBI:0002432.definition: An exclusion criterion defined  as whether an individual has a history of sex with someone who has been diagnosed or at risk for a blood borne infections disease in a specified time frame, which if met, makes the individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

OBI:0002433.label: history of sex with someone with a history of intravenous drugs exclusion criterion
OBI:0002433.definition: An exclusion criterion defined  as whether an individual has a history of sex with someone who has used intravenous drugs in a specified time frame, which if met, makes the individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

OBI:0002431.label: intravenous drug use exclusion criterion
OBI:0002431.definition: An exclusion criterion defined as when an individual has a history of intravenous drug abuse for a specific timeframe, which if met, makes the individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

OBI:0002425.label: radiation treatment exclusion criteria
OBI:0002425.definition: An exclusion criterion that defines whether radiation was received or is being received for a previous  or current cancer, which when met, makes an individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process

OBI:1110030.label: experimental infection of cell culture
OBI:1110030.definition: is the administration of an infectious agent to a cell culture with the objective to have the agent colonize and replicate in culture

OBI:0600044.label: lavage
OBI:0600044.definition: A protocol application to separate cells and/or cellular secretions from an anatomical space by the introduction and removal of fluid

OBI:0000919.label: animal euthanization
OBI:0000919.definition: A process in which is the end of life of animal is brought about in accordance with local regulations on treatment of animal subjects and using a method which causes minimal pain and distress to the animal subject

OBI:0302894.label: cell lysis
OBI:0302894.definition: cell lysis is a process by which cell membrane integrity of live cells  is compromised and leads to cell death. Cell lysis may be achieved by means of viral action or osmotic shock.

OBI:0000983.label: intranasal mucosal administration
OBI:0000983.definition: The administration of a substance into the intranasal mucosis of an organism

OBI:0000952.label: oral administration
OBI:0000952.definition: The administration of a substance into the mouth of an organism

OBI:0001174.label: passive immunization
OBI:0001174.definition: The injection of immune effector material (antibodies, T cells or B cells) into an organism so that the organisms immune system gains its  immune effector function to recognize specific antigens.

OBI:0000712.label: pathogen challenge
OBI:0000712.definition: A pathogen challenge is the administration of a live pathogenic organism to a host

VO:0000002.label: vaccination
VO:0000002.definition: a process of administering substance in vivo that involves in adding a vaccine into a host (e.g., human) in vivo with the intent to invoke a protective or therapeutic adaptive immune response.

OBI:1110007.label: administration in vivo with infectious agent
OBI:1110007.definition: is an administration of an infectious agent to a host organism

OBI:0000429.label: intraperitoneal administration
OBI:0000429.definition: The administration of a substance into the peritoneum of an organism

OBI:0600013.label: information acquisition
OBI:0600013.definition: An acquisition in which possession of information is gained.

OBI:0600010.label: material acquisition
OBI:0600010.definition: An acquisition in which possession of a material entity is gained.

OBI:0600011.label: acclimatization
OBI:0600011.definition: A protocol application in which an object is left in an environment for some period of time, until some qualities of interest are in equilibrium with that environment.

OBI:0000045.label: waiting
OBI:0000045.definition: not actively doing anything to a material for a duration of time.

OBI:0000690.label: immunoprecipitation
OBI:0000690.definition: is a process which realizes a material separation objective by relying on antibodies to specifically binding to material entity

OBI:0000512.label: isolation of cell population
OBI:0000512.definition: a process in which a population of cells with certain characteristics is isolated from a larger population

OBI:0302906.label: DNA Subtraction
OBI:0302906.definition: a material separation process by which repetitive genomic DNA is removed during the construction of cDNA library.

OBI:1110095.label: blood harvesting
OBI:1110095.definition: A material separation where blood is taken from an organism.

OBI:0001483.label: cell collecting
OBI:0001483.definition: A planned process that collects cells from culture.

OBI:0600037.label: cell culture splitting
OBI:0600037.definition: The act of taking part of a homogeneous cell culture and creating one or more additional separate cultures of similar qualities. input: cell_culture, output cell_culture min cardinality 2. part of cell culturing

OBI:0302886.label: centrifugation
OBI:0302886.definition: centrifugation is a process separating molecules by size or density using centrifugal forces generated by a spinning rotor. G-forces of several hundred thousand times gravity are generated in ultracentrifugation

OBI:0600041.label: concentrate
OBI:0600041.definition: a protocol application to create an output material with an increased density of a material of interest that is part of the input material by separating other parts of the input material

OBI:0600052.label: dialysis
OBI:0600052.definition: a protocol application that uses diffusion through a semi-permeable membrane to separate an input material into two fractions of different composition

OBI:0600053.label: electrophoresis
OBI:0600053.definition: a protocol application that uses an electrical potential to move material through a defined matrix in order to separate it by its resistance to movement and its charge

OBI:0600022.label: excision
OBI:0600022.definition: the use physical means to remove a portion of a substance from the rest

OBI:0302884.label: extraction
OBI:0302884.definition: A material separation in which a desired component of an input material is separated from the remainder

OBI:0302885.label: filtration
OBI:0302885.definition: filtration is a process which separates components suspended in a fluid based on granularity properties relying on a filter device

OBI:0600051.label: gradient separation
OBI:0600051.definition: a protocol application that uses different concentrations of materials in a defined order to create a gradient to facilitate the separation of an input material into its components with specific qualities

OBI:0600029.label: isolation of cell culture supernatant
OBI:0600029.definition: a protocol which results in the separation of supernatant material from a cell culture

OBI:0600018.label: material portioning
OBI:0600018.definition: a material processing in which the input substance is partitioned into a number of portions that are similar in composition.

OBI:1110046.label: organ harvesting
OBI:1110046.definition: The process of removing an organ from its source organism

OBI:0600034.label: precipitation
OBI:0600034.definition: a protocol application to cause a material to precipitate (becoming a solid) out of solution. Input is a solution, output is a solution plus a solid component (the precipitate)

OBI:0600046.label: preparative chromatography
OBI:0600046.definition: the use of a biomaterial's preferential affinity for either the mobile phase or the stationary phase to separate it from other materials of differing affinity

OBI:0001505.label: purification
OBI:0001505.definition: A planned process to separate a material entity into different compositions of which one or more have are purified fractions that contain higher concentration of a desired component, while others contain impurities and are not of interest

OBI:0302900.label: group randomization
OBI:0302900.definition: A group assignment which relies on chance to assign materials to a group of materials in order to avoid bias in experimental set up.

OBI:0002106.label: carboxyfluorescein succinimidyl ester staining assay
OBI:0002106.definition: a assay detecting a molecular label assay where the amount of carboxyfluorescein succinimidyl ester is measured using fluorescence detection.

OBI:0001632.label: immuno staining assay
OBI:0001632.definition: A assay detecting a molecular label assay in which the label is attached to an antibody so that substances are marked based on the antibody's binding specificity.

OBI:0002564.label: histopathology assay
OBI:0002564.definition: A histological assay that is intended to check for the presence or level of a specific disease.

OBI:0302912.label: electroporation
OBI:0302912.definition: a process in which a significant increase in the electrical conductivity and permeability of the cell plasma membrane caused by an externally applied electrical field. It is usually used in molecular biology as a way of introducing some substance into a cell, such as loading it with a molecular probe, a drug that can change the cell's function, or a piece of coding DNA

OBI:0001867.label: establishing cell line
OBI:0001867.definition: a process whereby a new type of cell line is created, either through passaging of a primary cell culture to relative genetic stability and compositional homogeneity, or through some experimental modification of an existing cell line to produce a new line with novel characteristics  (e.g. immortalization or some other stable genetic modification, or selection of some defined subset).

OBI:0001878.label: establishing primary cell culture
OBI:0001878.definition: an establishing cell culture process whereby cells explanted directly from an organismal source or specimen, and placed in culture for maintenance or propagation as a primary cell culture

OBI:0000879.label: random primed DNA labeling
OBI:0000879.definition: a labeling in which random primers are used to uniformly label input DNA

OBI:0600019.label: non-specific labeling
OBI:0600019.definition: The addition of a reagent labeling the entire input biomaterial enabling future detection of the output biomaterial

OBI:0600067.label: specific labeling
OBI:0600067.definition: a labeling in which the labeling reagent used  has a specificity to bind only certain components of the input material

OBI:0001907.label: immortalizing cell line transformation
OBI:0001907.definition: a genetic transformation of a cell line cell with transgenic constructs intended to confer the capability for indefinite propagation in culture

OBI:0600059.label: DNA transduction
OBI:0600059.definition: a genetic transformation which relies on the use of lysogenic infection to transfer DNA sequences into an organism

OBI:0001150.label: chromosomal substitution
OBI:0001150.definition: A genetic transformation in which all, or part, of a chromosome from a donor replaces that of the recipient. It does not include chromosome recombination. For single gene insertion, use the term 'gene knock in'.

OBI:0001149.label: gene knock in
OBI:0001149.definition: a genetic transformation that involves the insertion of a protein coding cDNA sequence at a particular locus in an organism's chromosome. Typically, this is done in mice since the technology for this process is more refined, and because mouse embryonic stem cells are easily manipulated. The difference between knock-in technology and transgenic technology is that a knock-in involves a gene inserted into a specific locus, and is a "targeted" insertion.

OBI:0001148.label: gene knock out
OBI:0001148.definition: a genetic transformation that renders a gene non-functional, e.g. due to a point mutation, or the removal of all, or part of, the gene using recombinant methods.

OBI:0001154.label: induced mutation
OBI:0001154.definition: a genetic transformation that the modification of the genetic material (either coding or non-coding) of an organism is caused by mutagenic compounds or irradiation.

OBI:0001152.label: transfection
OBI:0001152.definition: a genetic transformation which relies on the use of physical, electrical and chemical phenomena to introduce DNA or RNA into a cell

OBI:0001145.label: 3D structure determination of bound complex assay
OBI:0001145.definition: A 3D structure determination assay in which a complex of 2 or more material enties is characterized which provides information on their binding configuration.

OBI:0001721.label: 3D structure determining assay of a 3D B cell epitope:antibody complex
OBI:0001721.definition: A B cell epitope recognition assay that characterizes the 3D structure of an antibody / BCR with a ligand.

OBI:0001999.label: 3D structure determining assay of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex
OBI:0001999.definition: A T cell epitope recognition assay that uses a 3D structure determination of bound complex assay.

OBI:0000912.label: X-ray crystallography assay
OBI:0000912.definition: A 3D structure determination assay in which the diffraction of pattern of X-ray beams in a crystal of purified material entities is used to resolve the 3-dimensional structure of the material entity of interest.

OBI:0000182.label: nuclear magnetic resonance 3D structure determination assay
OBI:0000182.definition: A 3D structure determination assay that uses magnetic properties of atomic nuclei to determine the 3D structure and dynamics of molecules in the input sample.

OBI:0002108.label: small-angle scattering assay
OBI:0002108.definition: A 3D structure determination assay in which the scattering pattern of a neutron or x-ray beam targeted at a material entity is recorded at small angles relative to the incident beam to determine the size, shape and structure of the material entity examined.

OBI:0001920.label: DNA replication timing by sequencing assay
OBI:0001920.definition: An assay in which timing of DNA replication is quantified as a function of genome position based on genome-wide sequencing.

OBI:0000626.label: DNA sequencing assay
OBI:0000626.definition: A sequencing assay which determines information on the sequence of a DNA molecule.

OBI:0000705.label: Edman degradation
OBI:0000705.definition: A sequencing assay in which the amino acid sequence of input peptides or proteins is determined by iteratively cleaving of the amino-terminal (N-terminal) residue without disrupting the peptide bonds and identifying it by e.g. chromatography or electropheresis.

OBI:0001177.label: RNA sequencing assay
OBI:0001177.definition: An assay that determines the sequence of an RNA molecule.

OBI:0001923.label: protein sequencing by tandem mass spectrometry assay
OBI:0001923.definition: A sequencing assay that detremines amino acid sequences of proteins using multiple rounds of mass spectrometry and molecule fragmentation.

OBI:0001960.label: taxonomic diversity assessment by targeted gene survey
OBI:0001960.definition: An assay that dteremines taxonomic and community diversity information by sequencing specific genomic regions used as marker of identity or diversity.

OBI:0002485.label: transcript analysis by single-end sequencing assay
OBI:0002485.definition: A sequencing assay that incorporates single-end reads and sequencing technology to determine transcripts, gene structures, and gene expressions.

OBI:0302891.label: trypsination
OBI:0302891.definition: trypsination is a protease cleavage which uses enzyme trypsin to act on proteins present in an input material entity

OBI:0000552.label: reverse transcribed polymerase chain reaction
OBI:0000552.definition: reverse transcribe pcr is a process which allow amplification of cDNA during a pcr reaction while the cDNA results from a retrotranscription of messenger RNA isolated from a material entity.

OBI:0600049.label: DNA polymerase amplification
OBI:0600049.definition: DNA polymerase amplification is an enzymatic amplification which uses DNA polymerase enzyme to make copies of a DNA contained in biomaterial used as input

OBI:0600057.label: enzymatic DNA replication
OBI:0600057.definition: the use of enzymes to duplicate DNA molecule any process used to make additional copies of a biomaterial

OBI:0001494.label: linear amplification
OBI:0001494.definition: An enzymatic amplification which amplifies nucleic acid sequence by making many copies off the same template.

OBI:0000415.label: polymerase chain reaction
OBI:0000415.definition: PCR is the process in which a DNA polymerase is used to amplify a piece of DNA by in vitro enzymatic replication. As PCR progresses, the DNA thus generated is itself used as a template for replication. This sets in motion a chain reaction in which the DNA template is exponentially amplified.

OBI:0000687.label: nucleotide overhang cloning
OBI:0000687.definition: Nucleotide overhang cloning is the process of inserting nucleic acid into a vector using nucleotide overhangs used to prevent self ligation

OBI:0000790.label: recombinant BAC cloning
OBI:0000790.definition: Recombinant BAC cloning is a  process with the objective to insert genetic material into an F plasmid based bacterial artificial chromosome for future replication of the inserted material

OBI:0000824.label: recombinant YAC cloning
OBI:0000824.definition: Recombinant YAC cloning is a  process with the objective to insert genetic material into a yeast artificial chromosome vector for future replication of the inserted material

OBI:0000799.label: recombinant phage cloning
OBI:0000799.definition: Recombinant phage cloning is the process of using a phage plus some insert nucleic acid for the purposes of amplification of the insert material achieved by phage assembly in vitro.

OBI:0000692.label: recombination enzyme based cloning
OBI:0000692.definition: a recombination enzyme based cloning is a recombinant vector cloning process that uses complementary nucleotide sequences in both the insert genetic material and the cloning vector with a recombination enzyme to directly create a recombinant vector

OBI:0000738.label: restriction enzyme based cloning
OBI:0000738.definition: restriction enzyme based cloning is a recombinant vector cloning process that has as an input genetic material that was cleaved with restriction enzymes, and a cloning vector that was cleaved with complementary restriction enzymes. It uses ligase to chemically join the input genetic material and the cloning vector to create a recombinant vector.

OBI:0600042.label: recombinant plasmid cloning
OBI:0600042.definition: the insertion of a particular DNA fragment into a plasmid in order to make copies of a biomaterial

OBI:0600048.label: vector mediated amplification
OBI:0600048.definition: The process of creating a copy of some biological entity in cell culture

OBI:0600063.label: vector mediated expression
OBI:0600063.definition: vector mediated expression sis the generation of copies of biomaterial by in a cell_culture modified for this purpose by insertion of an expression vector

OBI:0002574.label: RNA extraction with polyA depletion
OBI:0002574.definition: A RNA extraction process in which only RNAs lacking a polyA tail are retained

OBI:0000859.label: cytoplasmic RNA extraction
OBI:0000859.definition: A RNA extraction process in which the desired output material is RNA in the cytoplasm.

OBI:0000888.label: nuclear RNA extraction
OBI:0000888.definition: A RNA extraction process in which the desired output material is RNA in the nucleus.

OBI:0000849.label: organellar RNA extraction
OBI:0000849.definition: A RNA extraction process in which the desired output material is RNA in the organelle(s).

OBI:0000848.label: polyA RNA extraction
OBI:0000848.definition: A RNA extraction process typically involving the use of poly dT oligomers in which the desired output material is polyA RNA.

OBI:0000855.label: total RNA extraction
OBI:0000855.definition: A RNA extraction process in which total cellular and organelle RNA are extracted.

OBI:0000407.label: viral RNA extraction
OBI:0000407.definition: The extraction of RNA from an input material that specifically isolates viral RNA

OBI:0000257.label: DNA extraction
OBI:0000257.definition: A DNA extraction is a nucleic acid extraction where the desired output material is DNA.

OBI:0666666.label: RNA extraction
OBI:0666666.definition: A RNA extraction is a nucleic acid extraction where the desired output material is RNA

OBI:0001176.label: Individual epitope immunization in vivo
OBI:0001176.definition: An immunization in which an individual epitope is administered into a host organism.

OBI:1110084.label: effector T cell function
OBI:1110084.definition: The function inhering in a T cell that is realized in an immune response that results from the T cell receptor binding to the MHC:epitope complex.

GO:0019815.label: B cell receptor complex
GO:0019815.definition: An immunoglobulin complex that is present in the plasma membrane of B cells and that in its canonical form is composed of two identical immunoglobulin heavy chains and two identical immunoglobulin light chains and a signaling subunit, a heterodimer of the Ig-alpha and Ig-beta proteins.

GO:0042101.label: T cell receptor complex
GO:0042101.definition: A protein complex that contains a disulfide-linked heterodimer of T cell receptor (TCR) chains, which are members of the immunoglobulin superfamily, and mediates antigen recognition, ultimately resulting in T cell activation. The TCR heterodimer is associated with the CD3 complex, which consists of the nonpolymorphic polypeptides gamma, delta, epsilon, zeta, and, in some cases, eta (an RNA splice variant of zeta) or Fc epsilon chains.

OBI:0002055.label: assay measuring T cell epitope specific biological activity
OBI:0002055.definition: A T cell epitope recognition assay that detects biological activity.

OBI:0002059.label: assay measuring a binding constant of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex
OBI:0002059.definition: A T cell epitope recognition assay that quantitavely characterizes the binding of a TCR with a ligand by determining a binding constant.

OBI:1110124.label: assay measuring qualitiative binding of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex
OBI:1110124.definition: A T cell epitope recognition assay that qualitatively detects MHC:epitope complex binding to TCR.

OBI:1110052.label: cultured CD4-/CD8- T cell population
OBI:1110052.definition: A T cell population characterized by not expressing the CD4 nor the CD8 molecule on its surface.

OBI:0000720.label: immunologic adjuvant role
OBI:0000720.definition: The role a material entity plays when it is co-administered with an immunogen in order to enhance the immune response to the immunogen.

OBI:1110015.label: Immunization in vivo
OBI:1110015.definition: Process of administering an object playing the role of immunogen to a living organism

OBI:1110114.label: contact to pathogen carrying biological vector
OBI:1110114.definition: a process in which a vector carrying an infectious agent comes close enough to a potential host organism that a contact can result

OBI:1110018.label: living in endemic area
OBI:1110018.definition: a process in which a potential host organism lives in a geographic area in which an infectious agent is present to such a degree of frequency that contact is likely

OBI:1110017.label: living with infected household contact
OBI:1110017.definition: a process in which a a human being lives in the same household as another human being that is known to be infected with an infectious agent

OBI:1110019.label: pathogen release in laboratory accident
OBI:1110019.definition: a process in which a an infectious agent maintained in a laboratory setting is not contained as planned, leading to potential exposure of human beings to the agent

OBI:1110011.label: allergic reaction
OBI:1110011.definition: an allergic reaction is an pathologic immune response by an organism to a non-self entity that is normally harmless(the allergen)

OBI:1110021.label: infection process
OBI:1110021.definition: the detrimental process in which an infectious agent colonizes or replicates in a host environment

OBI:0001317.label: flow cytometry assay measuring cell-cell binding of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex
OBI:0001317.definition: A T cell epitope qualitative binding assay that uses a cell-cell binding detection by flow cytometry assay.

OBI:0001509.label: Edman degradation assay measuring MHC ligand processing and presentation
OBI:0001509.definition: A MHC ligand processing and presentation assay that uses Edman degradation to identify the eluted ligands

OBI:0001500.label: coelution assay measuring MHC ligand processing and presentation using T cell recognition of HPLC fractionated eluate compared to synthetic ligand
OBI:0001500.definition: A MHC ligand processing and presentation assay in which an HPL chromatography is run to separate an input mixture of ligands eluted from MHC into fractions. These fractions are tested for recognition by T cells and compared to the recognition of a synthetic ligand that is presumed to be the recognized epitope. Identical HPLC fractionation and T cell recognition patterns confirm that the specific ligand was presented by MHC molecules.

OBI:0001478.label: mass spectrometry assay measuring MHC ligand processing and presentation
OBI:0001478.definition: A MHC ligand processing and presentation assay that uses a mass spectrometry assay to identify eluted ligands

OBI:0001469.label: monospecific T cell recognition assay measuring MHC ligand processing and presentation
OBI:0001469.definition: A MHC ligand processing and presentation assay in which the presence of a specific ligand in an eluate is detected using the response of T cells that are known to be monospecific for that ligand as a readout.

OBI:0001553.label: assay measuring a binding constant of a MHC:ligand complex
OBI:0001553.definition: A MHC:ligand binding assay that measures a binding constant.

OBI:0002072.label: assay measuring qualitiative binding of a MHC:ligand complex
OBI:0002072.definition: A MHC:ligand binding assay that detects qualitative binding.

OBI:0001706.label: assay measuring B cell epitope specific biological activity
OBI:0001706.definition: A B cell epitope recognition assay that detects biological activity.

OBI:0001709.label: assay measuring a binding constant of a B cell epitope:antibody complex
OBI:0001709.definition: A B cell epitope recognition assay that quantitavely characterizes the binding of an antibody / BCR with a ligand by determining a binding constant.

OBI:0001703.label: assay measuring qualitiative binding of a B cell epitope:antibody complex
OBI:0001703.definition: A B cell epitope recognition assay that detects qualitative binding.

OBI:0002075.label: MHC ligand assay
OBI:0002075.definition: An immune epitope assay that detects either the processing and presentation of a ligand by an antigen presenting cell or the binding of a ligand to an MHC molecule.

OBI:1110127.label: assay measuring binding of a B cell epitope:antibody complex
OBI:1110127.definition: An immune epitope assay that detects B cell epitope recognition.

OBI:1110037.label: assay measuring binding of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex
OBI:1110037.definition: An immune epitope assay that detects T cell epitope recognition.

OBI:0001308.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific IP-10 production by T cells
OBI:0001308.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects IP-10 production by T cells.

OBI:0001232.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific RANTES production by T cells
OBI:0001232.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects RANTES production by T cells.

OBI:0001276.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 1 production by T cells
OBI:0001276.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects production of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 1 by T cells.

OBI:0002056.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 17 production by T cells
OBI:0002056.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects production of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 17 production by T cells.

OBI:0001775.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 19 production by T cells
OBI:0001775.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 19 production by T cells.

OBI:0002134.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 20 production by T cells
OBI:0002134.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 20 production by T cells.

OBI:0001774.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 21 production by T cells
OBI:0001774.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 21 production by T cells.

OBI:0001777.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 22 production by T cells
OBI:0001777.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 22 production by T cells.

OBI:0001345.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 4 production by T cells
OBI:0001345.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 4 production by T cells.

OBI:0001776.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 12 production by T cells
OBI:0001776.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 12 production by T cells.

OBI:0001779.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 13 production by T cells
OBI:0001779.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 13 production by T cells.

OBI:0001778.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 16 production by T cells
OBI:0001778.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 16 production by T cells.

OBI:0001459.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 9 production by T cells
OBI:0001459.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 9 production by T cells.

OBI:0001600.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific granulocyte colony stimulating factor production by T cells
OBI:0001600.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects granulocyte colony stimulating factor production by T cells.

OBI:0001233.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific granulocyte macrophage colony stimulating factor production by T cells
OBI:0001233.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects granulocyte macrophage colony stimulating factor production by T cells.

OBI:0002452.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interferon-alpha production by T cells
OBI:0002452.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interferon-alpha production by T cells.

OBI:0001390.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interferon-beta production by T cells
OBI:0001390.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interferon-beta production by T cells.

OBI:0001414.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interferon-gamma production by T cells
OBI:0001414.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interferon-gamma production by T cells.

OBI:0001388.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-1 alpha production by T cells
OBI:0001388.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-1 alpha production by T cells.

OBI:0001449.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-1 beta production by T cells
OBI:0001449.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-1 beta production by T cells.

OBI:0001209.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-10 production by T cells
OBI:0001209.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-10 production by T cells.

OBI:0001391.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-12 production by T cells
OBI:0001391.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-12 production by T cells.

OBI:0001251.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-13 production by T cells
OBI:0001251.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-13 production by T cells.

OBI:0001292.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-15 production by T cells
OBI:0001292.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-15 production by T cells.

OBI:0001280.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-16 production by T cells
OBI:0001280.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-16 production by T cells.

OBI:0001295.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-17 production by T cells
OBI:0001295.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-17 production by T cells.

OBI:0001380.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-18 production by T cells
OBI:0001380.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-18 production by T cells.

OBI:0001445.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-2 production by T cells
OBI:0001445.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-2 production by T cells.

OBI:0001237.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-21 production by T cells
OBI:0001237.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-21 production by T cells.

OBI:0001217.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-22 production by T cells
OBI:0001217.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-22 production by T cells.

OBI:0001363.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-23 production by T cells
OBI:0001363.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-23 production by T cells.

OBI:0001198.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-27 production by T cells
OBI:0001198.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-27 production by T cells.

OBI:0001406.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-3 production by T cells
OBI:0001406.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-3 production by T cells.

OBI:0001450.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-4 production by T cells
OBI:0001450.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-4 production by T cells.

OBI:0001230.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-5 production by T cells
OBI:0001230.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-5 production by T cells.

OBI:0001451.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-6 production by T cells
OBI:0001451.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-6 production by T cells.

OBI:0001587.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-7 production by T cells
OBI:0001587.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-7 production by T cells.

OBI:0001218.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-8 production by T cells
OBI:0001218.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-8 production by T cells.

OBI:0001333.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific macrophage inflammatory protein-1 alpha production by T cells
OBI:0001333.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects macrophage inflammatory protein-1 alpha production by T cells.

OBI:0001456.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific macrophage inflammatory protein-1 gamma production by T cells
OBI:0001456.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects macrophage inflammatory protein-1 gamma production by T cells.

OBI:0002057.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific macrophage migration inhibitory factor (MIF) production by T cells
OBI:0002057.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects macrophage migration inhibitory factor (MIF) production by T cells.

OBI:0001465.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific monocyte chemotactic protein-1 production by T cells
OBI:0001465.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects monocyte chemotactic protein-1 production by T cells.

OBI:0002058.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific oncostatin M production by T cells
OBI:0002058.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects oncostatin M production by T cells.

OBI:0001264.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific transforming growth factor-beta production by T cells
OBI:0001264.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects transforming growth factor-beta production by T cells.

OBI:0001400.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific tumor necrosis factor superfamily cytokine production by T cells
OBI:0001400.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects tumor necrosis factor superfamily cytokine production by T cells.

OBI:0001570.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific vascular endothelial growth factor production by T cells
OBI:0001570.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects vascular endothelial growth factor production by T cells.

OBI:0001253.label: biological activity assay measuring interleukin-9 production by T cells
OBI:0001253.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-9 production by T cells.

OBI:0002062.label: in vitro assay measuring epitope specific T cell killing
OBI:0002062.definition: A T cell epitope specific killing assay that uses an in vitro cell killing assay.

OBI:0001392.label: in vivo assay measuring epitope specific T cell killing
OBI:0001392.definition: A T cell epitope specific killing assay that uses an in vivo cell mediated cell killing assay.

OBI:0002071.label: in vitro assay measuring epitope specific proliferation of T cells
OBI:0002071.definition: A T cell epitope specific proliferation assay that is performed on cells in vitro.

OBI:0002070.label: in vivo assay measuring epitope specific proliferation of T cells
OBI:0002070.definition: A T cell epitope specific proliferation assay that is performed in vivo.

OBI:0002369.label: clinical history devoid of cancer
OBI:0002369.definition: A clinical history in which there was no diagnosis of cancer.

OBI:0002368.label: clinical history of cancer
OBI:0002368.definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer.

OBI:0002389.label: clinical history of repeated HIV assays
OBI:0002389.definition: A clinical history in which there is repeated reactive screening assays for human immunodeficiency virus (1 or 2) antibodies regardless of the results of supplemental assays.

OBI:0002390.label: exposure to second hand smoke
OBI:0002390.definition: A clinical history in which there has been second hand exposure to tobacco smoking.

OBI:0002372.label: family clinical history of cancer
OBI:0002372.definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a blood relative.

OBI:0002397.label: gynecologic surgery history
OBI:0002397.definition: A clinical history in which a woman has had gynecologic surgery in the past.

OBI:0002405.label: hormonal replacement therapy history
OBI:0002405.definition: A clinical history in which an individual has had hormonal replacement therapy in the past.

OBI:0002393.label: pregnancy history
OBI:0002393.definition: A clinical history in which a female has had a pregnancy.

OBI:0002370.label: unknown clinical history of cancer
OBI:0002370.definition: A clinical history in which it is not known whether there was a diagnosis of cancer.

OBI:1110049.label: allergy
OBI:1110049.definition: is a disease in which an abnormally strong inflammatory immune response is triggered against non-self entities, and the immune response has no protective effect

OBI:1110054.label: autoimmune disease
OBI:1110054.definition: Is a disease characterized by an immune response of an organism against parts of itself

OBI:1110053.label: cancer
OBI:1110053.definition: A disease characterized by abnormal and uncontrolled cell division

OBI:1110040.label: infectious disease
OBI:1110040.definition: is a disease caused by an infectious agent

OBI:1110012.label: occurrence of allergy
OBI:1110012.definition: The process of an allergic disease occurring in an organism.

OBI:1110008.label: occurrence of infectious disease
OBI:1110008.definition: Is an occurrence of a disease caused by an infection

OBI:0002371.label: diagnosis of cancer
OBI:0002371.definition: A diagnosis that is an assertion that a patient who is the subject of a diagnostic process has cancer.

OBI:0002385.label: diagnosis of infectious disease
OBI:0002385.definition: A diagnosis that is an assertion that a patient who is the subject of a diagnostic process has an infectious disease.

OMIABIS:0000052.label: fixed tissue slide specimen
OMIABIS:0000052.definition: A fixed tissue specimen that is placed in a slide.

OBI:0002125.label: H&E-stained fixed tissue slide specimen
OBI:0002125.definition: A fixed tissue slide specimen that is the output of H&E slide staining.

OBI:0002126.label: IHC-stained fixed tissue slide specimen
OBI:0002126.definition: A fixed tissue slide specimen that is the output of immunohistochemistry slide staining.

PATO:0001347.label: F mating type
PATO:0001347.definition: A bacterial mating type indicating the presence of F plasmid in a bacterial cell.

PATO:0001348.label: F minus mating type
PATO:0001348.definition: A bacterial mating type indicating the absence of F plasmid in a bacterial cell.

PATO:0001341.label: a mating type (yeast)
PATO:0001341.definition: A S. cerevisiae mating type cells that secrete a pheromone that in alpha haploids stimulates processes that lead to mating.

PATO:0001344.label: alpha mating type (yeast)
PATO:0001344.definition: A S. cerevisiae mating type cells that secrete a pheromone that stimulates a haploids.

PATO:0000383.label: female
PATO:0000383.definition: A biological sex quality inhering in an individual or a population that only produces gametes that can be fertilised by male gametes.

PATO:0001345.label: h minus
PATO:0001345.definition: A S. pombe mating type determined by the mat1-Mc and mat1-Mi on the mat1 locus.

PATO:0001346.label: h plus
PATO:0001346.definition: A S. pombe mating type determined by the mat1-Pc and mat1-Pi on the mat1 locus.

PATO:0001340.label: hermaphrodite
PATO:0001340.definition: A biological sex quality inhering in an organism or a population with both male and female sexual organs in one individual.

PATO:0000384.label: male
PATO:0000384.definition: A biological sex quality inhering in an individual or a population whose sex organs contain only male gametes.

PATO:0002201.label: handedness
PATO:0002201.definition: A behavioral quality inhering ina bearer by virtue of the bearer's unequal distribution of fine motor skill between its left and right hands or feet.

OBI:0000831.label: DNA residue methylation
OBI:0000831.definition: a quality of a DNA residue that has a methyl group attached to it

PATO:0000011.label: age
PATO:0000011.definition: A time quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of how long the bearer has existed.

PATO:0001421.label: alive
PATO:0001421.definition: A viability quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's condition before death.

PATO:0000186.label: behavioral quality
PATO:0000186.definition: An organismal quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's behavior aggregate of the responses or reactions or movements in a given situation.

PATO:0001339.label: biomaterial purity
PATO:0001339.definition: A composition quality inhering in an bearer by virtue of the bearer's homogeneity of a biomaterial.

PATO:0001396.label: cellular quality
PATO:0001396.definition: A monadic quality of continuant that exists at the cellular level of organisation.

SO:0000988.label: circular
SO:0000988.definition: A quality of a nucleotide polymer that has no terminal nucleotide residues.

PATO:0001167.label: damaged
PATO:0001167.definition: A structural quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer being harmed or injured or spoiled, such that its functionality is impaired.

PATO:0001422.label: dead
PATO:0001422.definition: A viability quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the cessation of the bearer's life.

PATO:0002243.label: fluid flow rate
PATO:0002243.definition: A physical quality inhering in a fluid (liquid or gas) by virtue of the amount of fluid which passes through a given surface per unit time.

PATO:0001985.label: frozen
PATO:0001985.definition: A quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being kept below its freezing point.

PATO:0001025.label: pressure
PATO:0001025.definition: A physical quality that inheres in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's amount of force per unit area it exerts.

PATO:0001547.label: quality of a gas
PATO:0001547.definition: A physical quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's exhibiting the physical characteristics of an entity consisting of particles that have neither a defined volume nor defined shape.

PATO:0001548.label: quality of a liquid
PATO:0001548.definition: A physical quality inhering in an entity exhibiting the physical characteristics of an amorphous (non-crystalline) form of matter between a gas and a solid that has a definite volume, but no definite shape.

PATO:0001546.label: quality of a solid
PATO:0001546.definition: A physical quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's exhibiting the physical characteristics of an entity characterized by particles arranged such that their shape and volume are relatively stable.

OBI:0000885.label: secondary structure of sequence macromolecule
OBI:0000885.definition:
A quality inhering in a molecule that refers to general three-dimensional form of local segments of biopolymers such as proteins and nucleic acids (DNA/RNA). It does not, however, describe specific atomic positions in three-dimensional space, which are considered to be tertiary structure.
Secondary structure was introduced by Kaj Ulrik Linderstrøm-Lang in the 1952 Lane medical lectures at Stanford.

PATO:0000146.label: temperature
PATO:0000146.definition: A physical quality of the thermal energy of a system.

PATO:0000918.label: volume
PATO:0000918.definition: A 3-D extent quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's amount of 3-dimensional space it occupies.

PATO:0001631.label: relational spatial quality
PATO:0001631.definition: A quality of related physical entities inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's pertaining to or involving or having the nature of space in relation to another entity.

PATO:0001385.label: aneuploid
PATO:0001385.definition: A ploidy quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's containing a non-integral multiple of the monoploid number, due to extra or missing chromosomes.

PATO:0001394.label: diploid
PATO:0001394.definition: A ploidy quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's having two copies (homologs) of each chromosome, usually one from the mother and one from the father.

PATO:0001375.label: haploid
PATO:0001375.definition: A ploidy quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's containing a single set of homologous chromosomes.

PATO:0001377.label: polyploid
PATO:0001377.definition: A ploidy quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's containing more than two homologous sets of chromosomes.

PATO:0001374.label: ploidy
PATO:0001374.definition: A cellular quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's number of homologous sets of chromosomes in the nucleus or primary chromosome-containing compartment of the cell, each set essentially coding for all the biological traits of the organism.

PATO:0001632.label: anterior to
PATO:0001632.definition: A spatial quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being located toward the front of an organism relative to another entity.

PATO:0001233.label: dorsal to
PATO:0001233.definition: A spatial quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being located toward the back or upper surface of an organism relative to another entity.

PATO:0001193.label: lateral to
PATO:0001193.definition: A spatial quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being located toward the side relative to another entity.

PATO:0001792.label: left side of
PATO:0001792.definition: A spatial quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being located on left side of from the a another entity.

PATO:0001793.label: right side of
PATO:0001793.definition: A spatial quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being located on right side of a another entity.

PATO:0001196.label: ventral to
PATO:0001196.definition: A spatial quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being located toward the abdomen of an organism relative to another entity.

PATO:0000047.label: biological sex
PATO:0000047.definition: An organismal quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's ability to undergo sexual reproduction in order to differentiate the individuals or types involved.

PATO:0002204.label: ambidextrous handedness
PATO:0002204.definition: Handedness where the organism exhibits no overall dominance in the use of right or left hand or foot in the performance of tasks that require one hand or foot or a dominant hand or foot.

PATO:0002202.label: left handedness
PATO:0002202.definition: Handedness where the organism preferentially uses the left hand or foot for tasks requiring the use of a single hand or foot or a dominant hand or foot.

PATO:0002203.label: right handedness
PATO:0002203.definition: Handedness where the organism preferentially uses the right hand or foot for tasks requiring the use of a single hand or foot or a dominant hand or foot.

PR:000001018.label: CD3 subunit with immunoglobulin domain
PR:000001018.definition: A protein with a core domain composition consisting of an extracellular N-terminal domain that adopts an immunoglobulin fold, a transmembrane domain, and an intracellular C-terminal domain with a single copy of the Immunoreceptor tyrosine-based activation motif (Pfam:PF02189) (ITAM). It constitutes the invariant subunit of the T cell antigen receptor (TCR). TCR is a surface receptor on T cells responsible for recognizing MHC-restricted antigens and initiating the cellular immune response.

PR:000001004.label: CD4 molecule
PR:000001004.definition: A protein that is a translation product of the human CD4 gene or a 1:1 ortholog thereof. CD4 is an accessory protein for MHC class-II antigen/T-cell receptor interaction. It is the primary receptor for HIV-1. CD4 has four immunoglobulin-like domains in its extracellular region that share the same structure, but can differ in sequence.

OBI:1110132.label: CD8 receptor
OBI:1110132.definition: A transmembrane glycoprotein that serves as a co-receptor for the T cell receptor.

PR:000025402.label: T cell receptor co-receptor CD8
PR:000025402.definition: A protein complex that is a membrane-bound heterodimeric co-receptor for MHC class-I antigen/T-cell receptor interaction.

PR:000003252.label: antithrombin-III
PR:000003252.definition: A serpin that is a translation product of the human SERPINC1 gene or a 1:1 ortholog thereof.

PR:000006592.label: deoxyribonuclease-1
PR:000006592.definition: A protein that is a translation product of the human DNASE1 gene or a 1:1 ortholog thereof.

PR:000003745.label: double-stranded RNA-specific adenosine deaminase
PR:000003745.definition: A protein that is a translation product of the human ADAR gene or a 1:1 ortholog thereof.

PR:000007928.label: glial cell line-derived neurotrophic factor
PR:000007928.definition: A protein that is a translation product of the human GDNF gene or a 1:1 ortholog thereof.

PR:000025467.label: guanyl-specific ribonuclease T1
PR:000025467.definition: A protein that is a translation product of the Aspergillus oryzae rntA gene or a 1:1 ortholog thereof.

PR:000025471.label: nuclease S1
PR:000025471.definition: A protein that is a translation product of the Aspergillus oryzae nucS gene or a 1:1 ortholog thereof.

OBI:0000732.label: restriction enzyme
OBI:0000732.definition: an enzyme that has a specific target cleavage sites within nucleic acids

PR:000025478.label: ribonuclease CL3
PR:000025478.definition: A protein with ribonuclease activity that is purified from chicken liver.

PR:000014060.label: ribonuclease T2
PR:000014060.definition: A protein that is a translation product of the human RNASET2 gene or a 1:1 ortholog thereof.

PR:000025475.label: ribonuclease U2
PR:000025475.definition: A protein that is a translation product of the Ustilago sphaerogena RNU2 gene or a 1:1 ortholog thereof.

PR:000025477.label: ribonuclease V1
PR:000025477.definition: A protein with ribonuclease activity that is a constituent of cobra venom.

OBI:0000250.label: dye role
OBI:0000250.definition: A molecular label role which inheres in a material entity and which is realized in the process of detecting a molecular dye that imparts color to some material of interest.

OBI:0000163.label: radiolabel role
OBI:0000163.definition: a molecular label role which inheres in a material entity which is realized by the process of radioactivity detection

CHEBI:51756.label: Alexa Fluor 532
CHEBI:51756.definition: An organosulfonic acid that has formula C34H33N3O11S2.

CHEBI:51760.label: Alexa Fluor 546
CHEBI:51760.definition: An organic heteropentacyclic compound that has formula C44H46Cl3N4NaO14S3.

CHEBI:52673.label: Alexa Fluor 555
CHEBI:52673.definition: A fluorescent dye of absorption wavelength 555 nm and emission wavelength 565 nm, derived from a 3,6-diaminoxanthene-4,5-disulfate.

CHEBI:15956.label: biotin
CHEBI:15956.definition: An organic heterobicyclic compound that consists of 2-oxohexahydro-1H-thieno[3,4-d]imidazole having a valeric acid substituent attached to the tetrahydrothiophene ring. The parent of the class of biotins.

CHEBI:42098.label: digoxigenin
