CHEBI:42098.definition: A hydroxy steroid that consists of 5beta-cardanolide having a double bond at the 20(22)-position as well as hydroxy groups at the 3beta-, 12beta- and 14beta-positions. It has been isolated from the plant species of the genus Digitalis.

CHEBI:31624.label: fluorescein
CHEBI:31624.definition: A xanthene dye that is highly fluorescent, detectable even when present in minute quantities. Used forensically to detect traces of blood, in analytical chemistry as an indicator in silver nitrate titrations and in microscopy.

SO:0001248.label: assembly
SO:0001248.definition: A region of the genome of known length that is composed by ordering and aligning two or more different regions.

SO:0000276.label: miRNA
SO:0000276.definition: Small, ~22-nt, RNA molecule that is the endogenous transcript of a miRNA gene. Micro RNAs are produced from precursor molecules (SO:0000647) that can form local hairpin structures, which ordinarily are processed (via the Dicer pathway) such that a single miRNA molecule accumulates from one arm of a hairpin precursor molecule. Micro RNAs may trigger the cleavage of their target molecules or act as translational repressors.

SO:0000104.label: polypeptide
SO:0000104.definition: A sequence of amino acids linked by peptide bonds which may lack appreciable tertiary structure and may not be liable to irreversible denaturation.

OBI:0000811.label: primary structure of DNA macromolecule
OBI:0000811.definition: a quality of a DNA molecule that inheres in its bearer due to the order of its DNA nucleotide residues.

OBI:0000845.label: primary structure of RNA molecule
OBI:0000845.definition: The primary structure of an RNA molecule that is completely defined by the set of its nucleic residue parts and the linear order induced by the peptide bonds that hold them together

SO:0000149.label: contig
SO:0000149.definition: A contiguous sequence derived from sequence assembly. Has no gaps, but may contain N's from unavailable bases.

SO:0000148.label: supercontig
SO:0000148.definition: One or more contigs that have been ordered and oriented using end-read information. Contains gaps that are filled with N's.

SO:0000353.label: sequence_assembly
SO:0000353.definition: A sequence of nucleotides that has been algorithmically derived from an alignment of two or more different sequences.

UBERON:0000173.label: amniotic fluid
UBERON:0000173.definition: Amniotic fluid is a bodily fluid consisting of watery liquid surrounding and cushioning a growing fetus within the amnion. It allows the fetus to move freely without the walls of the uterus being too tight against its body. Buoyancy is also provided. The composition of the fluid changes over the course of gestation. Initially, amniotic fluid is similar to maternal plasma, mainly water with electrolytes. As the fetus develops, proteins, carbohydrates, lipids, phospholipids originating from the lungs, fetal cells, and urea are deposited in the fluid.

UBERON:0001970.label: bile
UBERON:0001970.definition: vital aqueous secretion of the liver that is formed by hepatocytes and modified down stream by absorptive and secretory properties of the bile duct epithelium.

UBERON:0000178.label: blood
UBERON:0000178.definition: A fluid that is composed of blood plasma and erythrocytes.

UBERON:0001359.label: cerebrospinal fluid
UBERON:0001359.definition: A clear, colorless, bodily fluid, that occupies the subarachnoid space and the ventricular system around and inside the brain and spinal cord.

UBERON:0001988.label: feces
UBERON:0001988.definition: Portion of semisolid bodily waste discharged through the anus[MW,modified]

UBERON:0001913.label: milk
UBERON:0001913.definition: An emulsion of fat globules within a fluid that is secreted by the mammary gland during lactation.

UBERON:0002409.label: pericardial fluid
UBERON:0002409.definition: Transudate contained in the pericardial cavity.[FMA]

UBERON:0001268.label: peritoneal fluid
UBERON:0001268.definition: Transudate contained in the peritoneal cavity.

UBERON:0001087.label: pleural fluid
UBERON:0001087.definition: Transudate contained in the pleural cavity.

UBERON:0001836.label: saliva
UBERON:0001836.definition: A fluid produced in the oral cavity by salivary glands, typically used in predigestion, but also in other functions.

UBERON:0007311.label: sputum
UBERON:0007311.definition: Matter ejected from the lungs, bronchi, and trachea, through the mouth.

UBERON:0001089.label: sweat
UBERON:0001089.definition: Secretion produced by a sweat gland.

UBERON:0001090.label: synovial fluid
UBERON:0001090.definition: Transudate contained in the synovial cavity of joints, and in the cavity of tendon sheaths and bursae.

UBERON:0001088.label: urine
UBERON:0001088.definition: Excretion that is the output of a kidney

UBERON:0001797.label: vitreous humor
UBERON:0001797.definition: A transparent, semigelatinous substance that fills the cavity behind the crystalline lens of the eye and in front of the retina

UBERON:0002369.label: adrenal gland
UBERON:0002369.definition: Either of a pair of complex endocrine organs near the anterior medial border of the kidney consisting of a mesodermal cortex that produces glucocorticoid, mineralocorticoid, and androgenic hormones and an ectodermal medulla that produces epinephrine and norepinephrine[BTO].

UBERON:0000947.label: aorta
UBERON:0000947.definition: The main trunk of the systemic arterial system that carries blood from the heart to all the organs and other structures of the body, bringing oxygenated blood to all parts of the body in the systemic circulation

UBERON:0000955.label: brain
UBERON:0000955.definition: The brain is the center of the nervous system in all vertebrate, and most invertebrate, animals. Some primitive animals such as jellyfish and starfish have a decentralized nervous system without a brain, while sponges lack any nervous system at all. In vertebrates, the brain is located in the head, protected by the skull and close to the primary sensory apparatus of vision, hearing, balance, taste, and smell[WP].

UBERON:0000310.label: breast
UBERON:0000310.definition: The upper ventral region of an animal's torso.

UBERON:0001155.label: colon
UBERON:0001155.definition: Last portion of the large intestine before it becomes the rectum.

UBERON:0001621.label: coronary artery
UBERON:0001621.definition: An artery that supplies the myocardium.

UBERON:0001225.label: cortex of kidney
UBERON:0001225.definition: Outer cortical portion of the kidney, between the renal capsule and the renal medulla.

UBERON:0002067.label: dermis
UBERON:0002067.definition: The dermis is a layer of skin between the epidermis (with which it makes up the skin) and subcutaneous tissues, and is composed of two layers, the papillary and reticular dermis[WP].

UBERON:0007650.label: esophagogastric junction
UBERON:0007650.definition: The junction between the esophagus and the stomach epithelium

UBERON:0002469.label: esophagus mucosa
UBERON:0002469.definition: A mucosa that is part of a esophagus [Automatically generated definition].

UBERON:0000992.label: female gonad
UBERON:0000992.definition: the gonad of a female organism which contains germ cells

UBERON:0000948.label: heart
UBERON:0000948.definition: A myogenic muscular circulatory organ found in the vertebrate cardiovascular system composed of chambers of cardiac muscle. It is the primary circulatory organ.

UBERON:0002072.label: hypodermis
UBERON:0002072.definition: Lowermost layer of the integumentary system in vertebrates. Types of cells that are found in the hypodermis are fibroblasts, adipose cells, and macrophages. It is derived from the mesoderm, but unlike the dermis, it is not derived from the dermatome region of the mesoderm. The hypodermis is used mainly for fat storage[WP].

UBERON:0002116.label: ileum
UBERON:0002116.definition: the portion of the small intestine that extends from the jejunum to the colon

UBERON:0002812.label: left cerebral hemisphere
UBERON:0002812.definition: A cerebral hemisphere that is in the left side of a brain.

UBERON:0002107.label: liver
UBERON:0002107.definition: An exocrine gland which secretes bile and functions in metabolism of protein and carbohydrate and fat, synthesizes substances involved in the clotting of the blood, synthesizes vitamin A, detoxifies poisonous substances, stores glycogen, and breaks down worn-out erythrocytes[GO].

UBERON:0002048.label: lung
UBERON:0002048.definition: Respiration organ that develops as an oupocketing of the esophagus.

UBERON:0000029.label: lymph node
UBERON:0000029.definition: Any of the rounded masses of lymphoid tissue that are surrounded by a capsule of connective tissue, are distributed along the lymphatic vessels, and contain numerous lymphocytes which filter the flow of lymph.

UBERON:0001830.label: minor salivary gland
UBERON:0001830.definition: One of the smaller, largely mucus-secreting, exocrine glands of the oral cavity, consisting of the labial, buccal, molar, lingual, and palatine glands[MP].

UBERON:0000165.label: mouth
UBERON:0000165.definition: The proximal portion of the digestive tract, containing the oral cavity and bounded by the oral opening. In vertebrates, this extends to the pharynx and includes gums, lips, tongue and parts of the palate. Typically also includes the teeth, except where these occur elsewhere (e.g. pharyngeal jaws) or protrude from the mouth (tusks).

UBERON:0005022.label: mucosa of nasopharynx
UBERON:0005022.definition: A mucosa that is part of a nasopharynx [Automatically generated definition].

UBERON:0005023.label: mucosa of oropharynx
UBERON:0005023.definition: A mucosa that is part of a oropharynx [Automatically generated definition].

UBERON:0000481.label: multi-tissue structure
UBERON:0000481.definition: Anatomical structure that has as its parts two or more portions of tissue of at least two different types and which through specific morphogenetic processes forms a single distinct structural unit demarcated by bona-fide boundaries from other distinct structural units of different types.

UBERON:0003688.label: omentum
UBERON:0003688.definition: A fold of peritoneum originating at the stomach and supporting the viscera.

UBERON:0000463.label: organism substance
UBERON:0000463.definition: Material anatomical entity in a gaseous, liquid, semisolid or solid state; produced by anatomical structures or derived from inhaled and ingested substances that have been modified by anatomical structures as they pass through the body.

UBERON:0001264.label: pancreas
UBERON:0001264.definition: An endoderm derived structure that produces precursors of digestive enzymes and blood glucose regulating enzymes[GO].

UBERON:0000007.label: pituitary gland
UBERON:0000007.definition: The pituitary gland is an endocrine gland that secretes hormones that regulate many other glands [GO]. An endocrine gland located ventral to the diencephalon and derived from mixed neuroectodermal and non neuroectodermal origin [ZFIN].

UBERON:0001987.label: placenta
UBERON:0001987.definition: organ of metabolic interchange between fetus and mother, partly of embryonic origin and partly of maternal origin[GO]. The fetal portion of the placenta is known as the villous chorion. The maternal portion is known as the decidua basalis. The two portions are held together by anchoring villi that are anchored to the decidua basalis by the cytotrophoblastic shell.

UBERON:0002367.label: prostate gland
UBERON:0002367.definition: The prostate gland is a partly muscular, partly glandular body that is situated near the base of the mammalian male urethra and secretes an alkaline viscid fluid which is a major constituent of the ejaculatory fluid.

UBERON:0002813.label: right cerebral hemisphere
UBERON:0002813.definition: A cerebral hemisphere that is in the right side of a brain.

UBERON:0001159.label: sigmoid colon
UBERON:0001159.definition: The part of the large intestine that is closest to the rectum and anus. It forms a loop that averages about 40 cm. in length, and normally lies within the pelvis, but on account of its freedom of movement it is liable to be displaced into the abdominal cavity.

UBERON:0002097.label: skin of body
UBERON:0002097.definition: The organ covering the body that consists of the dermis and epidermis.

UBERON:0002106.label: spleen
UBERON:0002106.definition: the organ that functions to filter blood and to store red corpuscles and platelets

UBERON:0000945.label: stomach
UBERON:0000945.definition: An expanded region of the vertebrate alimentary tract that serves as a food storage compartment and digestive organ. A stomach is lined, in whole or in part by a glandular epithelium.

UBERON:0001037.label: strand of hair
UBERON:0001037.definition: A filament, mostly protein, that grows from follicles found in the dermis[WP].

UBERON:0036149.label: suprapubic skin
UBERON:0036149.definition: Area of skin in the hypoastric region of the abdomen.

UBERON:0000473.label: testis
UBERON:0000473.definition: A gonad of a male animal. A gonad produces and releases sperm.

UBERON:0002046.label: thyroid gland
UBERON:0002046.definition: A two-lobed endocrine gland found in all vertebrates, located in front of and on either side of the trachea in humans, and producing various hormones, such as triiodothyronine and calcitonin[BTO].

UBERON:0007610.label: tibial artery
UBERON:0007610.definition: The anterior and posterior arteries created at the bifurcation of the popliteal artery. The anterior tibial artery begins at the lower border of the popliteus muscle and lies along the tibia at the distal part of the leg to surface superficially anterior to the ankle joint. Its branches are distributed throughout the leg, ankle, and pes. The posterior tibial artery begins at the lower border of the popliteus muscle, lies behind the tibia in the lower part of its course, and is found situated between the medial malleolus and the medial process of the calcaneal tuberosity. Its branches are distributed throughout the leg and foot.

UBERON:0000479.label: tissue
UBERON:0000479.definition: Multicellular anatomical structure that consists of many cells of one or a few types, arranged in an extracellular matrix such that their long-range organisation is at least partly a repetition of their short-range organisation.

UBERON:0001255.label: urinary bladder
UBERON:0001255.definition: distensible musculomembranous organ situated in the anterior part of the pelvic cavity in which urine collects before excretion[MP].

UBERON:0000995.label: uterus
UBERON:0000995.definition: the female muscular organ of gestation in which the developing embryo or fetus is nourished until birth

UBERON:0000996.label: vagina
UBERON:0000996.definition: A fibromuscular tubular tract leading from the uterus to the exterior of the body in female placental mammals and marsupials, or to the cloaca in female birds, monotremes, and some reptiles[WP].

UBERON:0001638.label: vein
UBERON:0001638.definition: Any of the tubular branching vessels that carry blood from the capillaries toward the heart.

UBERON:0001873.label: caudate nucleus
UBERON:0001873.definition: Subcortical nucleus of telecephalic origin consisting of an elongated gray mass lying lateral to and bordering the lateral ventricle. It is divided into a head, body and tail in some species.

UBERON:0000956.label: cerebral cortex
UBERON:0000956.definition: The thin layer of gray matter on the surface of the cerebral hemisphere that develops from the telencephalon. It consists of the neocortex (6 layered cortex or isocortex), the hippocampal formation and the olfactory cortex.

UBERON:0001874.label: putamen
UBERON:0001874.definition: Subcortical nucleus of telencephalic , which together with the caudate nucleus, forms the striatum. The putamen lies lateral to the internal capsule and medial to the external medullary lamina, and is separated from the caudate nucleus by the fibers of the internal capsule for most of its length, except at its anterior portion.

UBERON:0001323.label: tibial nerve
UBERON:0001323.definition: The tibial nerve is a branch of the sciatic nerve. The tibial nerve passes through the popliteal fossa to pass below the arch of soleus. In the popliteal fossa the nerve gives off branches to gastrocnemius, popliteus, soleus and plantaris muscles, an articular branch to the knee joint, and a cutaneous branch that will become the sural nerve. The sural nerve is joined by fibres from the common peroneal nerve and runs down the calf to supply the lateral side of the foot. Below the soleus muscle the nerve lies close to the tibia and supplies the tibialis posterior, the flexor digitorum longus and the flexor hallucis longus. The nerve passes into the foot running posterior to the medial malleolus. Here it is bound down by the flexor retinaculum in company with the posterior tibial artery. [WP,unvetted].

UBERON:0001013.label: adipose tissue
UBERON:0001013.definition: Portion of connective tissue composed of adipocytes enmeshed in areolar tissue

UBERON:0002371.label: bone marrow
UBERON:0002371.definition: the soft tissue that fills the cavities of bones

UBERON:0000483.label: epithelium
UBERON:0000483.definition: Portion of tissue, that consists of one or more layers of epithelial cells connected to each other by cell junctions and which is underlain by a basal lamina. Examples: simple squamous epithelium, glandular cuboidal epithelium, transitional epithelium, myoepithelium[CARO].

UBERON:0004648.label: esophagus muscularis mucosa
UBERON:0004648.definition: A muscularis mucosa that is part of a esophagus.

UBERON:0001134.label: skeletal muscle tissue
UBERON:0001134.definition: Muscle tissue that consists primarily of skeletal muscle fibers.

UBERON:0006618.label: atrium auricular region
UBERON:0006618.definition: A small conical pouch projections located on the upper anterior portion of each atrium of the heart.

UBERON:0002037.label: cerebellum
UBERON:0002037.definition: Part of the metencephalon that lies in the posterior cranial fossa behind the brain stem. It is concerned with the coordination of movement[MESH]. A large dorsally projecting part of the brain concerned especially with the coordination of muscles and the maintenance of bodily equilibrium, situated between the brain stem and the back of the cerebrum , and formed in humans of two lateral lobes and a median lobe[BTO]. Brain structure derived from the anterior hindbrain, and perhaps including posterior midbrain. The cerebellum plays a role in somatic motor function, the control of muscle tone, and balance[ZFA].

UBERON:0002358.label: peritoneum
UBERON:0002358.definition: A serous membrane that lines the peritoneal cavity[VHOG,modified].

UBERON:0000362.label: renal medulla
UBERON:0000362.definition: the inner portion of the kidney consisting of the renal pyramids

OBI:0001715.label: obsolete B cell epitope competitive binding assay
OBI:0001715.definition: A competitive inhibition of binding assay using a assay

OBI:0001712.label: obsolete B cell epitope direct binding assay
OBI:0001712.definition: A direct binding assay using a assay

OBI:0001737.label: obsolete B cell epitope specific X-ray crystallography assay
OBI:0001737.definition: A X-ray crystallography assay measuring epitope specfic antibody binding event in angstroms

OBI:0000667.label: obsolete MHC multimer staining assay
OBI:0000667.definition: An MHC multimer assay is an assay that detects T cells capable of binding the MHC:ligand complexes present in the multimer. The multimer is fluorescently labelled. The T cells bound to multimers are counted in a flow cytometer

OBI:0001540.label: obsolete T cell recognition of eluted MHC ligand assay
OBI:0001540.definition: An assay that identifies an MHC ligand using a T cell response assay as a readout

OBI:0001572.label: obsolete cell bound MHC binding constant determination assay
OBI:0001572.definition: An assay that measures the affinity of a ligand to MHC moleculs bound to the cell surface and that quantifies the affinity with a binding constant.

OBI:0001582.label: obsolete cell bound MHC direct binding assay
OBI:0001582.definition: direct binding assay measuring MHC ligand binding using MHC derived from a cell

OBI:0001560.label: obsolete cell lysate MHC binding constant determination assay
OBI:0001560.definition: An assay that measures the affinity of a ligand to a MHC in a cell lysate preparation and that quantifies the affinity with a binding constant.

OBI:0001574.label: obsolete cell lysate MHC competitive binding assay using radioactivity detection
OBI:0001574.definition: competitive inhibition of binding assay measuring MHC ligand binding by radioactivity detection using MHC derived from a cell lysate

OBI:0000665.label: obsolete intracellular cytokine staining assay
OBI:0000665.definition: The measurement of cytokines within the cytoplasm of a cell by permeabilizing the cell membrane to allow entry of specific antibodies, and counting the stained cells using a flow cytometer.

OBI:0000856.label: obsolete intracellular material detection by flow cytometry assay
OBI:0000856.definition: An assay in which the presence of a material inside a cell is measured by permeabilizing the cell membrane to allow entry of specific antibodies, and counting the stained cells using a flow cytometer.

OBI:0001250.label: obsolete intracellular material detection by flow cytometry assay  of epitope specific cytotoxic T cell degranulation
OBI:0001250.definition: An intracellular material detection by flow cytometry assay  that measures epitope specific cytotoxic T cell degranulation

OBI:0001576.label: obsolete purified MHC binding constant determination assay
OBI:0001576.definition: An assay that measures the affinity of a ligand to a purified MHC complex preparation and that quantifies the affinity with a binding constant.

OBI:0001611.label: obsolete purified MHC direct binding assay
OBI:0001611.definition: direct binding assay measuring MHC ligand binding using MHC derived from a purified MHC molecule preparation

OBI:0000698.label: obsolete_DNA ligase
OBI:0000698.definition: A DNA ligase is an enzyme that covalently joins two compatible pieces of DNA through the cleavage of an ATP molecule

OBI:0000986.label: obsolete_DNA sequencing training service
OBI:0000986.definition: A training process with the objective to provide a trainee with the skill to run DNA sequencing experiments

OBI:0000972.label: obsolete_electrically powered device
OBI:0000972.definition: a processed material created to have a function and which requires electrical power to execute

IAO:0000576.label: obsolete_establishing a CRID registry
IAO:0000576.definition: a planned process with the objective to establish a system that allows to refer to specific entities of a certain kind and store information about them, by establishing a CRID registry and plan specifications for the process of 1) assigning a CRID and 2) looking up a CRID.

OBI:0000936.label: obsolete_material access provider role
OBI:0000936.definition: a service provider role which is realized by a servicer provider organization performing access to some material

OBI:0000797.label: obsolete_primary structure of protein
OBI:0000797.definition: The primary structure of a protein that is completely defined by the set of its amino acid residue parts and the linear order induced by the peptide bonds that hold them together

OBI:0000830.label: obsolete_primary structure of sequence macromolecule
OBI:0000830.definition: A quality inhering in a molecule that is completely defined by the linear sequence of a set of residues which are connected by directional, linear bonds

OBI:0000980.label: obsolete_protocol service provider role
OBI:0000980.definition: a service provider role which is realized by a servicer provider organization performing a protocol execution

OBI:0001037.label: obsolete_specimen fixation function
OBI:0001037.definition:
A specimen 
fixation function is a function that holds or fastens an entity in a fixed position.

OBI:0000682.label: obsolete_study result
OBI:0000682.definition: Study result is an information content entity  that is a specified data output of a study.

OBI:0000929.label: obsolete_training service provider role
OBI:0000929.definition: a service provider role which is realized by a servicer provider organization performing some training

IAO:0000024.label: obsolete_unit of measure
IAO:0000024.definition: a unit of measure is the quality of some material entity compared to which another quality is some multiple of.

OBI:0000109.label: biological vector role
OBI:0000109.definition: a biological vector role is a material to be added role that is realized by the process of transmitting material to the organism that is the target of the transmission.

BFO:0000005.label: obsolete dependent continuant
BFO:0000005.definition: A continuant  that is either dependent on one or other independent continuant  bearers or inheres in or is borne by other entities.

IAO:0000019.label: obsolete2_binary digital entity
IAO:0000019.definition: A binary digital entity is a digital entity that is encoded in a way that is not easily human readable and that contains other than text characters.

IAO:0000093.label: obsolete2_binary executable
IAO:0000093.definition: Binary executable is a digital entity consisting of the binary representation of machine instructions of a specific processor or they may be binary pseudocode for a virtual machine. A non-source executable file is also called an object program. It is assumed that the binary executable file contains properly-formatted computer instructions.  (derived from Wikipedia, Nov 1, 2007)

IAO:0000105.label: obsolete2_digital document
IAO:0000105.definition: A digital document is a digital entity consisting of an electronic file which can be rendered into human-readable form by one or more computational applications.  The digital document does not refer to the information content of the document but to an instance of the file.

IAO:0000012.label: obsolete2_digital entity
IAO:0000012.definition: A digital entity is an information entity which is a collection of bits that can be interpreted by a computer. Two digital entities are the same if they are bitwise identical.

IAO:0000059.label: obsolete2_report figure
IAO:0000059.definition: A report figure is a report display element that has some aspect of illustration, but may be a composite of figures, images, and other elements

IAO:0000047.label: obsolete2_text based digital entity
IAO:0000047.definition: A text based digital entity is a digital entity that is encoded so that it only contains text characters.

OBI:0302901.label: obsolete_activation
OBI:0302901.definition:
a process by which a material entity status is modified and conferred a capability of reacting
(this sounds like a circular definition , hugh!)

OBI:0302745.label: obsolete_adipose tissue
OBI:0302745.definition: adipose tissue is a tissue which main constituents are adipocytes. adipose tissue can be classified base on its location (site) but also based on adipocyte subtypes (brown or white) which reflect functional differences and is only found in animals, Vertebrates or invertebrates.

OBI:0100015.label: obsolete_anatomical entity
OBI:0100015.definition: An anatomical entity is a material entity that is part of a multicellular organism, and which is large enough so that it forms an identifiable structure in the organism. Specifically, it excludes granular parts of the organism, such as atoms, molecules, cells, which can be removed from the organism without affecting it. It is defined as the union of 'multi-tissue structure', 'body substance' and 'portion of tissue'

OBI:0000223.label: obsolete_blinded medication role
OBI:0000223.definition: Is a role which inheres in a material entity which is manufactured to be similar in appearance to a test material entity in e.g. a clinical trial to prevent participants from detecting which is the active and inactive substance

OBI:0100062.label: obsolete_cell line
OBI:0100062.definition: A secondary cultured cell population that represents a genetically stable and homogenous population of cultured cells that shares a common propagation history (ie has been successively passaged together in culture).

OBI:0100055.label: obsolete_cell line cell
OBI:0100055.definition: A material entity that represents generations of a primary culture.

OBI:0302714.label: obsolete_collection (of entities of organismal origin)
OBI:0302714.definition: a collection is a bfo:aggregate object, that is a set of material object of the same kind

OBI:0600065.label: obsolete_defined processes
OBI:0600065.definition: Place holder class, see editor note

OBI:0000233.label: obsolete_defined_material
OBI:0000233.definition: Place holder class, Utility class to gather the defined classes

OBI:0000449.label: obsolete_defined_output
OBI:0000449.definition:
This is only a placeholder for defined classes, as are its siblings _defined_material and _defined protocol application.
Its children should be defined classes constructed as output of a process.

OBI:1110055.label: obsolete_disease
OBI:1110055.definition: placeholder to be imported from disease ontology

OBI:0000205.label: obsolete_dropout role
OBI:0000205.definition: Dropout is a study subject role borne by an entity realized by a process of leaving the study earlier than the protocol specified and where the bearer of the dropout role had been borne study subject role prior to bearing dropout role.

OBI:0000296.label: obsolete_enrollment
OBI:0000296.definition: enrollment is a process of identifying a set of objects for further use in an investigation based on a set of criteria or rules

OBI:0100039.label: obsolete_fragment derived from protein
OBI:0100039.definition: A material entity which is derived from a  protein

OBI:0000442.label: obsolete_heart
OBI:0000442.definition: The heart is a muscular organ found in all vertebrates that is responsible for pumping blood throughout the blood vessels by repeated, rhythmic contractions

OBI:0000446.label: obsolete_identification
OBI:0000446.definition: a process by which the identity (what a thing is) of a material entity is established within a certain confidence interval

OBI:0100035.label: obsolete_immortal cell
OBI:0100035.definition: a cell derived from a multicellular organism that has the potential to replicate indefinitely

OBI:0100056.label: obsolete_immortal cell line culture
OBI:0100056.definition: A cell line that is expected to be capable of indefinite propagation in an vitro culture.

OBI:0000140.label: obsolete_label role
OBI:0000140.definition: Label role is a role which inheres in a material entity and which is realized in a detection of label assay

OBI:0302743.label: obsolete_liver
OBI:0302743.definition: liver is an anatomical entity which constituent are mainly hepatocytes, which has a function of detoxification, hematopoietic center, glucose and fat metabolism management. liver is only found in animals , all Vertebrates and some families of invertebrates

OBI:0000577.label: obsolete_molecular concentration
OBI:0000577.definition: A concentration is a relational quality that inheres in a material entity towards molecular scattered aggregate that is part of it by virtue of some ratio of masses of the two or the counts of the grains of the two or volume occupied by the larger material entity.

OBI:1110002.label: obsolete_occurrence of disease
OBI:1110002.definition: An occurrence of disease is a process involving pathologic changes within an organism

OBI:0000323.label: obsolete_peritoneum
OBI:0000323.definition: is the serous membrane that forms the lining of the abdominal cavity

OBI:0000050.label: obsolete_platform
OBI:0000050.definition: A platform is an object_aggregate that is the set of instruments and software needed to perform a process. definition_source: OBI.

OBI:0100069.label: obsolete_polymer
OBI:0100069.definition: A macromolecule is a molecule of high relative molecular mass, the structure of which essentially comprises the multiple repetition of units derived, actually or conceptually, from molecules of low relative molecular mass.

OBI:0001009.label: obsolete_qualitative binding detection assay
OBI:0001009.definition: A binding assay where the specified output determines if two or more material entities do or do not have the disposition to form a complex above a threshold level of significance. The threshold can be defined through detection limits of the instrument, the use of experimental controls that establish what is considered significant binding, or a predefined cutoff based on what binding is considered significant in a certain context.

IAO:0000091.label: obsolete_report element
IAO:0000091.definition: A report element is a narrative object in which information is presented and consumed by a human being, and is part of a report. Examples of report elements are figure (dot plot), table, text portion (may include a movie or audio clip on a web page).

IAO:0000097.label: obsolete_report table
IAO:0000097.definition: A report table is a report display element consisting of a matrix of cells layed out in a grid, some set of which are filled with some information content

OBI:0000100.label: obsolete_role of being first subject treated
OBI:0000100.definition: First subject treated role is a study subject role borne by the subject realized in the application of the process specified in intervention study design with no previous study subject realizing the role prior in the study

OBI:0000264.label: obsolete_sample population
OBI:0000264.definition: A sample population is an object aggregate that is selected from the population, e.g. the fish in the net that were sampled from the lake, the people that responded to the call for volunteers.

IAO:0000035.label: obsolete_study interpretation
IAO:0000035.definition: A study interpretation is a textual entity about the implications of a study result. Examples include discussion of whether a hypothesis is false, whether the study failed to address the hypothesis, and whether the study results have led to new hypotheses

IAO:0000182.label: obsolete_survival curve
IAO:0000182.definition: A survival curve is a report graph which is a graphical representation of data where the percentage of survival is plotted as a function of time.

OBI:0000420.label: obsolete_trypsinized material
OBI:0000420.definition: A material entity that has undergone a process of digestion with trypsin
